QuEST v3.6.0
The Quantum Exact Simulation Toolkit
Functions
Unit tests

Unit tests of the QuEST API, using Catch2 in C++14. More...

Detailed Description

Unit tests of the QuEST API, using Catch2 in C++14.

Function Documentation

◆ TEST_CASE() [1/136]

TEST_CASE ( "applyDiagonalOp"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also
applyDiagonalOp
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 37 of file test_operators.cpp.

37 {
38
39 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
40
41 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
42
43 // try 10 random operators
44 GENERATE( range(0,10) );
45
46 // make a totally random (non-Hermitian) diagonal oeprator
47 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOp(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
48 for (long long int i=0; i<op.numElemsPerChunk; i++) {
49 op.real[i] = getRandomReal(-5, 5);
50 op.imag[i] = getRandomReal(-5, 5);
51 }
52 syncDiagonalOp(op);
53
54 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
55
56 QVector ref = toQMatrix(op) * refVec;
57 applyDiagonalOp(quregVec, op);
58 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, ref) );
59 }
60 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
61
62 QMatrix ref = toQMatrix(op) * refMatr;
63 applyDiagonalOp(quregMatr, op);
64 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, ref, 100*REAL_EPS) );
65 }
66
67 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
68 }
69 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
70
71 SECTION( "mismatching size" ) {
72
73 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOp(NUM_QUBITS + 1, QUEST_ENV);
74
75 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyDiagonalOp(quregVec, op), Contains("equal number of qubits"));
76 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyDiagonalOp(quregMatr, op), Contains("equal number of qubits"));
77
78 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
79 }
80 }
81 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
82}
applyDiagonalOp

TEST_CASE ( "applyFullQFT"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also
applyFullQFT
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 88 of file test_operators.cpp.

88 {
89
90 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
91
92 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
93
94 // try 10 times for each kind of input
95 GENERATE( range(0,10) );
96
97 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
98
99 SECTION( "normalised" ) {
100
101 refVec = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
102 toQureg(quregVec, refVec);
103 refVec = getDFT(refVec);
104
105 applyFullQFT(quregVec);
106 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
107 }
108 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
109
110 refVec = getRandomQVector(1 << NUM_QUBITS);
111 toQureg(quregVec, refVec);
112 refVec = getDFT(refVec);
113
114 applyFullQFT(quregVec);
115 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
116 }
117 }
118 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
119
120 SECTION( "pure" ) {
121
122 /* a pure density matrix should be mapped to a pure state
123 * corresponding to the state-vector DFT
124 */
125
126 refVec = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
127 refMatr = getPureDensityMatrix(refVec);
128
129 toQureg(quregMatr, refMatr);
130 applyFullQFT(quregMatr);
131
132 refVec = getDFT(refVec);
133 refMatr = getPureDensityMatrix(refVec);
134
135 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr) );
136 }
137 SECTION( "mixed" ) {
138
139 /* a mixed density matrix, conceptualised as a mixture of orthogonal
140 * state-vectors, should be mapped to an equally weighted mixture
141 * of DFTs of each state-vector (because QFT is unitary and hence
142 * maintains state orthogonality)
143 */
144
145 int numStates = (1 << NUM_QUBITS)/4; // quarter as many states as possible
146 std::vector<QVector> states = getRandomOrthonormalVectors(NUM_QUBITS, numStates);
147 std::vector<qreal> probs = getRandomProbabilities(numStates);
148
149 // set qureg to random mixture
150 refMatr = getMixedDensityMatrix(probs, states);
151 toQureg(quregMatr, refMatr);
152
153 // apply QFT to mixture
154 applyFullQFT(quregMatr);
155
156 // compute dft of mixture, via dft of each state
157 refMatr = getZeroMatrix(1 << NUM_QUBITS);
158 for (int i=0; i<numStates; i++)
159 refMatr += probs[i] * getPureDensityMatrix(getDFT(states[i]));
160
161 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr) );
162 }
163 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
164
165 /* repeat method above, except that we use unnormalised vectors,
166 * and mix them with arbitrary complex numbers instead of probabilities,
167 * yielding an unnormalised density matrix
168 */
169
170 int numVecs = (1 << NUM_QUBITS)/4; // quarter as many states as possible
171 std::vector<QVector> vecs;
172 std::vector<qcomp> coeffs;
173 for (int i=0; i<numVecs; i++) {
174 vecs.push_back(getRandomQVector(1 << NUM_QUBITS));
175 coeffs.push_back(getRandomComplex());
176 }
177
178 // produce unnormalised matrix
179 refMatr = getZeroMatrix(1 << NUM_QUBITS);
180 for (int i=0; i<numVecs; i++)
181 refMatr += coeffs[i] * getPureDensityMatrix(vecs[i]);
182
183 toQureg(quregMatr, refMatr);
184 applyFullQFT(quregMatr);
185
186 // compute target matrix via dft of each unnormalised vector
187 refMatr = getZeroMatrix(1 << NUM_QUBITS);
188 for (int i=0; i<numVecs; i++)
189 refMatr += coeffs[i] * getPureDensityMatrix(getDFT(vecs[i]));
190
191 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr) );
192 }
193 }
194 }
195 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
196
197 SUCCEED( );
198 }
199 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
200}
applyFullQFT
void applyFullQFT(Qureg qureg)
Applies the quantum Fourier transform (QFT) to the entirety of qureg.

getZeroMatrix

Returns a dim-by-dim square complex matrix, initialised to all zeroes.
Definition: utilities.cpp:153
getRandomComplex
qcomp getRandomComplex()
Returns a random complex number within the square closing (-1-i) and (1+i), from a distribution unifo...
Definition: utilities.cpp:432
getDFT
QVector getDFT(QVector in)
Returns the discrete fourier transform of vector in.
Definition: utilities.cpp:653
getRandomProbabilities
std::vector< qreal > getRandomProbabilities(int numProbs)
Returns a list of random real scalars, each in [0, 1], which sum to unity.
Definition: utilities.cpp:473
getRandomOrthonormalVectors
std::vector< QVector > getRandomOrthonormalVectors(int numQb, int numStates)
Returns a list of random orthonormal complex vectors, from an undisclosed distribution.
Definition: utilities.cpp:614
getMixedDensityMatrix
QMatrix getMixedDensityMatrix(std::vector< qreal > probs, std::vector< QVector > states)
Returns a mixed density matrix formed from mixing the given pure states, which are assumed normalised...
Definition: utilities.cpp:641
getRandomStateVector
QVector getRandomStateVector(int numQb)
Returns a random numQb-length L2-normalised state-vector from an undisclosed distribution.
Definition: utilities.cpp:469
getPureDensityMatrix
QMatrix getPureDensityMatrix(QVector state)
Returns a density matrix initialised into the given pure state.
Definition: utilities.cpp:508
toQureg
void toQureg(Qureg qureg, QVector vec)
Initialises the state-vector qureg to have the same amplitudes as vec.
Definition: utilities.cpp:1224

References applyFullQFT(), areEqual(), CLEANUP_TEST, getDFT(), getMixedDensityMatrix(), getPureDensityMatrix(), getRandomComplex(), getRandomOrthonormalVectors(), getRandomProbabilities(), getRandomQVector(), getRandomStateVector(), getZeroMatrix(), NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, and toQureg().

◆ TEST_CASE() [3/136]

TEST_CASE ( "applyGateMatrixN"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also
applyGateMatrixN
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 208 of file test_operators.cpp.

208 {
209
210 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
211
212 // figure out max-num (inclusive) targs allowed by hardware backend
213 int maxNumTargs = calcLog2(quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk);
214
215 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
216
217 // generate all possible qubit arrangements
218 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumTargs+1) ); // inclusive upper bound
219 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
220
221 // for each qubit arrangement, use a new random unitary
222 QMatrix op = getRandomQMatrix(1 << numTargs);
223 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs);
224 toComplexMatrixN(op, matr);
225
226 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
227
228 applyGateMatrixN(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr);
229 applyReferenceOp(refVec, targs, numTargs, op);
230 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
231 }
232 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
233
234 applyGateMatrixN(quregMatr, targs, numTargs, matr);
235 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, targs, numTargs, op);
236 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 1E4*REAL_EPS) );
237 }
238 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
239 }
240 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
241
242 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
243
244 // there cannot be more targets than qubits in register
245 int numTargs = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
246 int targs[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
247 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(NUM_QUBITS+1); // prevent seg-fault
248
249 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyGateMatrixN(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("Invalid number of target"));
250 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
251 }
252 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
253
254 int numTargs = 3;
255 int targs[] = {1,2,2};
256 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
257
258 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyGateMatrixN(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("target") && Contains("unique"));
259 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
260 }
261 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
262
263 int numTargs = 3;
264 int targs[] = {1,2,3};
265 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
266
267 int inv = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
268 targs[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTargs) )] = inv; // make invalid target
269 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyGateMatrixN(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
270
271 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
272 }
273 SECTION( "matrix creation" ) {
274
275 int numTargs = 3;
276 int targs[] = {1,2,3};
277
278 /* compilers don't auto-initialise to NULL; the below circumstance
279 * only really occurs when 'malloc' returns NULL in createComplexMatrixN,
280 * which actually triggers its own validation. Hence this test is useless
281 * currently.
282 */
283 ComplexMatrixN matr;
284 matr.real = NULL;
285 matr.imag = NULL;
286 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyGateMatrixN(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("created") );
287 }
288 SECTION( "matrix dimensions" ) {
289
290 int targs[2] = {1,2};
291 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(3); // intentionally wrong size
292
293 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyGateMatrixN(quregVec, targs, 2, matr), Contains("matrix size"));
294 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
295 }
296 SECTION( "matrix fits in node" ) {
297
298 // pretend we have a very limited distributed memory (judged by matr size)
299 quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk = 1;
300 int qb[] = {1,2};
301 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(2); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
302 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyGateMatrixN(quregVec, qb, 2, matr), Contains("targets too many qubits"));
303 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
304 }
305 }
306 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
307}
applyGateMatrixN
void applyGateMatrixN(Qureg qureg, int *targs, int numTargs, ComplexMatrixN u)

Definition: QuEST.h:189
ComplexMatrixN::imag
qreal ** imag

TEST_CASE ( "applyGateSubDiagonalOp"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
applyGateSubDiagonalOp
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 315 of file test_operators.cpp.

315 {
316
317 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
318
319 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
320
321 // generate all possible targets
322 int numTargs = GENERATE( range(1,NUM_QUBITS+1) );
323 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
324
325 // initialise a random non-unitary diagonal op
326 SubDiagonalOp op = createSubDiagonalOp(numTargs);
327 for (long long int i=0; i<op.numElems; i++) {
328 op.real[i] = getRandomReal(-10,10);
329 op.imag[i] = getRandomReal(-10,10);
330 }
331 QMatrix opMatr = toQMatrix(op);
332
333 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
334
335 applyGateSubDiagonalOp(quregVec, targs, numTargs, op);
336 applyReferenceOp(refVec, targs, numTargs, opMatr);
337 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
338 }
339 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
340
341 applyGateSubDiagonalOp(quregMatr, targs, numTargs, op);
342 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, targs, numTargs, opMatr);
343 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 1E4*REAL_EPS) );
344 }
345
346 destroySubDiagonalOp(op);
347 }
348 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
349
350 SECTION( "diagonal dimension" ) {
351
352 int numTargs = 3;
353 SubDiagonalOp op = createSubDiagonalOp(numTargs);
354
355 int badNumTargs = GENERATE_COPY( numTargs-1, numTargs+1 );
356 int badTargs[NUM_QUBITS+1];
357
358 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyGateSubDiagonalOp(quregVec, badTargs, badNumTargs, op), Contains("incompatible dimension") );
359 destroySubDiagonalOp(op);
360 }
361 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
362
363 // make too many targets (which are otherwise valid)
364 SubDiagonalOp badOp = createSubDiagonalOp(NUM_QUBITS + 1);
365 int targs[NUM_QUBITS + 1];
366 for (int t=0; t<badOp.numQubits; t++)
367 targs[t] = t;
368 for (int i=0; i<badOp.numElems; i++)
369 badOp.real[i] = 1;
370
371 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyGateSubDiagonalOp(quregVec, targs, badOp.numQubits, badOp), Contains("Invalid number of target qubits") );
372 destroySubDiagonalOp(badOp);
373 }
374 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
375
376 // make a valid unitary diagonal op
377 SubDiagonalOp op = createSubDiagonalOp(3);
378 for (int i=0; i<op.numElems; i++)
379 op.real[i] = 1;
380
381 // make a repetition in the target list
382 int targs[] = {2,1,2};
383
384 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyGateSubDiagonalOp(quregVec, targs, op.numQubits, op), Contains("target qubits must be unique") );
385 destroySubDiagonalOp(op);
386 }
387 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
388
389 // make a valid unitary diagonal op
390 SubDiagonalOp op = createSubDiagonalOp(3);
391 for (int i=0; i<op.numElems; i++)
392 op.real[i] = 1;
393
394 int targs[] = {0,1,2};
395
396 // make each target in-turn invalid
397 int badIndex = GENERATE( range(0,3) );
398 int badValue = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
399 targs[badIndex] = badValue;
400
401 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyGateSubDiagonalOp(quregVec, targs, op.numQubits, op), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
402 destroySubDiagonalOp(op);
403 }
404 }
405 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
406}

414 {
415
416 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
417
418 // every test will use a unique random matrix
419 QMatrix op = getRandomQMatrix(2); // 2-by-2
420 ComplexMatrix2 matr = toComplexMatrix2(op);
421
422 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
423
424 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
425
426 // reference boilerplate
427 int* ctrls = NULL;
428 int numCtrls = 0;
429 int targs[] = {target};
430 int numTargs = 1;
431
432 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
433
434 applyMatrix2(quregVec, target, matr);
435 applyReferenceMatrix(refVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, op);
436
437 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
438 }
439 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {

445 }

448
449 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {

452 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMatrix2(quregVec, target, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
453 }
454 }
455 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );

TEST_CASE ( "applyMatrix4"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also
applyMatrix4
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 464 of file test_operators.cpp.

464 {
465
466 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
467
468 // in distributed mode, each node must be able to fit all amps modified by matrix
469 REQUIRE( quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk >= 4 );
470
471 // every test will use a unique random matrix
472 QMatrix op = getRandomQMatrix(4); // 4-by-4
473 ComplexMatrix4 matr = toComplexMatrix4(op);
474
475 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
476
477 int targ1 = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
478 int targ2 = GENERATE_COPY( filter([=](int t){ return t!=targ1; }, range(0,NUM_QUBITS)) );
479
480 // reference boilerplate
481 int* ctrls = NULL;
482 int numCtrls = 0;
483 int targs[] = {targ1, targ2};
484 int numTargs = 2;
485
486 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
487
488 applyMatrix4(quregVec, targ1, targ2, matr);
489 applyReferenceMatrix(refVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, op);
490 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
491 }
492 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
493
494 applyMatrix4(quregMatr, targ1, targ2, matr);
495 applyReferenceMatrix(refMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, op);
496 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
497 }
498 }
499 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
500
501 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
502
503 int targ1 = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
504 int targ2 = 0;
505 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMatrix4(quregVec, targ1, targ2, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
506 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMatrix4(quregVec, targ2, targ1, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
507 }
508 SECTION( "repetition of targets" ) {
509
510 int qb = 0;
511 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMatrix4(quregVec, qb, qb, matr), Contains("target") && Contains("unique") );
512 }
513 SECTION( "matrix fits in node" ) {
514
515 // pretend we have a very limited distributed memory
516 quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk = 1;
517 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMatrix4(quregVec, 0, 1, matr), Contains("targets too many qubits"));
518 }
519 }
520 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
521}
applyMatrix4

◆ TEST_CASE() [7/136]

TEST_CASE ( "applyMatrixN"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also
applyMatrixN
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 529 of file test_operators.cpp.

529 {
530
531 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
532
533 // figure out max-num (inclusive) targs allowed by hardware backend
534 int maxNumTargs = calcLog2(quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk);
535
536 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
537
538 // generate all possible qubit arrangements
539 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumTargs+1) ); // inclusive upper bound
540 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
541
542 // for each qubit arrangement, use a new random matrix
543 QMatrix op = getRandomQMatrix(1 << numTargs);
544 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs);
545 toComplexMatrixN(op, matr);
546
547 // reference boilerplate
548 int* ctrls = NULL;
549 int numCtrls = 0;
550
551 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
552
553 applyMatrixN(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr);
554 applyReferenceMatrix(refVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, op);
555 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
556 }
557 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
558
559 applyMatrixN(quregMatr, targs, numTargs, matr);
560 applyReferenceMatrix(refMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, op);
561 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 100*REAL_EPS) );
562 }
563 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
564 }
565 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
566
567 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
568
569 // there cannot be more targets than qubits in register
570 int numTargs = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
571 int targs[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
572 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(NUM_QUBITS+1); // prevent seg-fault
573
574 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMatrixN(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("Invalid number of target"));
575 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
576 }
577 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
578
579 int numTargs = 3;
580 int targs[] = {1,2,2};
581 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
582
583 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMatrixN(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("target") && Contains("unique"));
584 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
585 }
586 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
587
588 int numTargs = 3;
589 int targs[] = {1,2,3};
590 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
591
592 int inv = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
593 targs[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTargs) )] = inv; // make invalid target
594 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMatrixN(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
595
596 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
597 }
598 SECTION( "matrix creation" ) {
599
600 int numTargs = 3;
601 int targs[] = {1,2,3};
602
603 /* compilers don't auto-initialise to NULL; the below circumstance
604 * only really occurs when 'malloc' returns NULL in createComplexMatrixN,
605 * which actually triggers its own validation. Hence this test is useless
606 * currently.
607 */
608 ComplexMatrixN matr;
609 matr.real = NULL;
610 matr.imag = NULL;
611 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMatrixN(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("created") );
612 }
613 SECTION( "matrix dimensions" ) {
614
615 int targs[2] = {1,2};
616 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(3); // intentionally wrong size
617
618 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMatrixN(quregVec, targs, 2, matr), Contains("matrix size"));
619 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
620 }
621 SECTION( "matrix fits in node" ) {
622
623 // pretend we have a very limited distributed memory (judged by matr size)
624 quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk = 1;
625 int qb[] = {1,2};
626 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(2); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
627 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMatrixN(quregVec, qb, 2, matr), Contains("targets too many qubits"));
628 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
629 }
630 }
631 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
632}
applyMatrixN
void applyMatrixN(Qureg qureg, int *targs, int numTargs, ComplexMatrixN u)
Apply a general N-by-N matrix, which may be non-unitary, on any number of target qubits.
Definition: QuEST.c:1134

References applyMatrixN(), applyReferenceMatrix(), areEqual(), calcLog2(), CLEANUP_TEST, createComplexMatrixN(), destroyComplexMatrixN(), getRandomQMatrix(), ComplexMatrixN::imag, NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, ComplexMatrixN::real, sublists(), and toComplexMatrixN().

◆ TEST_CASE() [8/136]

TEST_CASE ( "applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also
applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 640 of file test_operators.cpp.

640 {
641
642 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
643
644 // figure out max-num targs (inclusive) allowed by hardware backend
645 int maxNumTargs = calcLog2(quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk);
646 if (maxNumTargs >= NUM_QUBITS)
647 maxNumTargs = NUM_QUBITS - 1; // leave room for min-number of control qubits
648
649 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
650
651 // try all possible numbers of targets and controls
652 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumTargs+1) );
653 int maxNumCtrls = NUM_QUBITS - numTargs;
654 int numCtrls = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumCtrls+1) );
655
656 // generate all possible valid qubit arrangements
657 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
658 int* ctrls = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numCtrls, targs, numTargs) );
659
660 // for each qubit arrangement, use a new random unitary
661 QMatrix op = getRandomQMatrix(1 << numTargs);
662 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs);
663 toComplexMatrixN(op, matr);
664
665 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
666
667 applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, matr);
668 applyReferenceOp(refVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, op);
669 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
670 }
671 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
672
673 applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN(quregMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, matr);
674 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, op);
675 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 1E4*REAL_EPS) );
676 }
677 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
678 }
679 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
680
681 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
682
683 // there cannot be more targets than qubits in register
684 // (numTargs=NUM_QUBITS is caught elsewhere, because that implies ctrls are invalid)
685 int numTargs = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
686 int targs[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
687 int ctrls[] = {0};
688 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(NUM_QUBITS+1); // prevent seg-fault
689 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(NUM_QUBITS+1), matr); // ensure unitary
690
691 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("Invalid number of target"));
692 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
693 }
694 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
695
696 int ctrls[] = {0};
697 int numTargs = 3;
698 int targs[] = {1,2,2};
699 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
700 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(numTargs), matr); // ensure unitary
701
702 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("target") && Contains("unique"));
703 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
704 }
705 SECTION( "number of controls" ) {
706
707 int numCtrls = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
708 int ctrls[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // avoids seg-fault if validation not triggered
709 int targs[1] = {0};
710 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(1);
711 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(1), matr); // ensure unitary
712
713 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, 1, matr), Contains("Invalid number of control"));
714 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
715 }
716 SECTION( "repetition in controls" ) {
717
718 int ctrls[] = {0,1,1};
719 int targs[] = {3};
720 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(1);
721 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(1), matr); // ensure unitary
722
723 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, 3, targs, 1, matr), Contains("control") && Contains("unique"));
724 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
725 }
726 SECTION( "control and target collision" ) {
727
728 int ctrls[] = {0,1,2};
729 int targs[] = {3,1,4};
730 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(3);
731 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(3), matr); // ensure unitary
732
733 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, 3, targs, 3, matr), Contains("Control") && Contains("target") && Contains("disjoint"));
734 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
735 }
736 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
737
738 // valid inds
739 int numQb = 2;
740 int qb1[2] = {0,1};
741 int qb2[2] = {2,3};
742 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numQb);
743 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(numQb), matr); // ensure unitary
744
745 // make qb1 invalid
746 int inv = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
747 qb1[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numQb))] = inv;
748
749 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN(quregVec, qb1, numQb, qb2, numQb, matr), Contains("Invalid control") );
750 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN(quregVec, qb2, numQb, qb1, numQb, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
751 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
752 }
753 SECTION( "matrix creation" ) {
754
755 int ctrls[1] = {0};
756 int targs[3] = {1,2,3};
757
758 /* compilers don't auto-initialise to NULL; the below circumstance
759 * only really occurs when 'malloc' returns NULL in createComplexMatrixN,
760 * which actually triggers its own validation. Hence this test is useless
761 * currently.
762 */
763 ComplexMatrixN matr;
764 matr.real = NULL;
765 matr.imag = NULL;
766 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, 3, matr), Contains("created") );
767 }
768 SECTION( "matrix dimensions" ) {
769
770 int ctrls[1] = {0};
771 int targs[2] = {1,2};
772 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(3); // intentionally wrong size
773 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(3), matr); // ensure unitary
774
775 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, 2, matr), Contains("matrix size"));
776 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
777 }
778 SECTION( "matrix fits in node" ) {
779
780 // pretend we have a very limited distributed memory (judged by matr size)
781 quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk = 1;
782 int ctrls[1] = {0};
783 int targs[2] = {1,2};
784 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(2);
785 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(2), matr); // ensure unitary
786
787 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, 2, matr), Contains("targets too many qubits"));
788 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
789 }
790 }
791 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
792}
getRandomUnitary
QMatrix getRandomUnitary(int numQb)
Returns a uniformly random (under Haar) 2^numQb-by-2^numQb unitary matrix.
Definition: utilities.cpp:531
applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN
void applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN(Qureg qureg, int *ctrls, int numCtrls, int *targs, int numTargs, ComplexMatrixN m)
Apply a general multi-controlled multi-qubit gate specified as an (possibly non-unitary) arbitrary co...
Definition: QuEST.c:1163

References applyMultiControlledGateMatrixN(), applyReferenceOp(), areEqual(), calcLog2(), CLEANUP_TEST, createComplexMatrixN(), destroyComplexMatrixN(), getRandomQMatrix(), getRandomUnitary(), ComplexMatrixN::imag, NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, ComplexMatrixN::real, sublists(), and toComplexMatrixN().

◆ TEST_CASE() [9/136]

TEST_CASE ( "applyMultiControlledMatrixN"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also
applyMultiControlledMatrixN
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 800 of file test_operators.cpp.

800 {
801
802 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
803
804 // figure out max-num targs (inclusive) allowed by hardware backend
805 int maxNumTargs = calcLog2(quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk);
806 if (maxNumTargs >= NUM_QUBITS)
807 maxNumTargs = NUM_QUBITS - 1; // leave room for min-number of control qubits
808
809 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
810
811 // try all possible numbers of targets and controls
812 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumTargs+1) );
813 int maxNumCtrls = NUM_QUBITS - numTargs;
814 int numCtrls = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumCtrls+1) );
815
816 // generate all possible valid qubit arrangements
817 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
818 int* ctrls = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numCtrls, targs, numTargs) );
819
820 // for each qubit arrangement, use a new random unitary
821 QMatrix op = getRandomQMatrix(1 << numTargs);
822 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs);
823 toComplexMatrixN(op, matr);
824
825 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
826
827 applyMultiControlledMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, matr);
828 applyReferenceMatrix(refVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, op);
829 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
830 }
831 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
832
833 applyMultiControlledMatrixN(quregMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, matr);
834 applyReferenceMatrix(refMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, op);
835 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 100*REAL_EPS) );
836 }
837 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
838 }
839 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
840
841 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
842
843 // there cannot be more targets than qubits in register
844 // (numTargs=NUM_QUBITS is caught elsewhere, because that implies ctrls are invalid)
845 int numTargs = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
846 int targs[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
847 int ctrls[] = {0};
848 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(NUM_QUBITS+1); // prevent seg-fault
849 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomQMatrix( 1 << (NUM_QUBITS+1)), matr);
850
851 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("Invalid number of target"));
852 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
853 }
854 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
855
856 int ctrls[] = {0};
857 int numTargs = 3;
858 int targs[] = {1,2,2};
859 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
860 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomQMatrix(1 << numTargs), matr);
861
862 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("target") && Contains("unique"));
863 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
864 }
865 SECTION( "number of controls" ) {
866
867 int numCtrls = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
868 int ctrls[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // avoids seg-fault if validation not triggered
869 int targs[1] = {0};
870 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(1);
871 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomQMatrix(1 << 1), matr);
872
873 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, 1, matr), Contains("Invalid number of control"));
874 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
875 }
876 SECTION( "repetition in controls" ) {
877
878 int ctrls[] = {0,1,1};
879 int targs[] = {3};
880 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(1);
881 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomQMatrix(1 << 1), matr);
882
883 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, 3, targs, 1, matr), Contains("control") && Contains("unique"));
884 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
885 }
886 SECTION( "control and target collision" ) {
887
888 int ctrls[] = {0,1,2};
889 int targs[] = {3,1,4};
890 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(3);
891 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomQMatrix(1 << 3), matr);
892
893 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, 3, targs, 3, matr), Contains("Control") && Contains("target") && Contains("disjoint"));
894 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
895 }
896 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
897
898 // valid inds
899 int numQb = 2;
900 int qb1[2] = {0,1};
901 int qb2[2] = {2,3};
902 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numQb);
903 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomQMatrix(1 << numQb), matr);
904
905 // make qb1 invalid
906 int inv = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
907 qb1[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numQb))] = inv;
908
909 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledMatrixN(quregVec, qb1, numQb, qb2, numQb, matr), Contains("Invalid control") );
910 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledMatrixN(quregVec, qb2, numQb, qb1, numQb, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
911 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
912 }
913 SECTION( "matrix creation" ) {
914
915 int ctrls[1] = {0};
916 int targs[3] = {1,2,3};
917
918 /* compilers don't auto-initialise to NULL; the below circumstance
919 * only really occurs when 'malloc' returns NULL in createComplexMatrixN,
920 * which actually triggers its own validation. Hence this test is useless
921 * currently.
922 */
923 ComplexMatrixN matr;
924 matr.real = NULL;
925 matr.imag = NULL;
926 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, 3, matr), Contains("created") );
927 }
928 SECTION( "matrix dimensions" ) {
929
930 int ctrls[1] = {0};
931 int targs[2] = {1,2};
932 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(3); // intentionally wrong size
933 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomQMatrix(1 << 3), matr);
934
935 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, 2, matr), Contains("matrix size"));
936 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
937 }
938 SECTION( "matrix fits in node" ) {
939
940 // pretend we have a very limited distributed memory (judged by matr size)
941 quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk = 1;
942 int ctrls[1] = {0};
943 int targs[2] = {1,2};
944 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(2);
945 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomQMatrix(1 << 2), matr);
946
947 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiControlledMatrixN(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, 2, matr), Contains("targets too many qubits"));
948 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
949 }
950 }
951 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
952}
applyMultiControlledMatrixN
void applyMultiControlledMatrixN(Qureg qureg, int *ctrls, int numCtrls, int *targs, int numTargs, ComplexMatrixN u)
Apply a general N-by-N matrix, which may be non-unitary, with additional controlled qubits.
Definition: QuEST.c:1182

References applyMultiControlledMatrixN(), applyReferenceMatrix(), areEqual(), calcLog2(), CLEANUP_TEST, createComplexMatrixN(), destroyComplexMatrixN(), getRandomQMatrix(), ComplexMatrixN::imag, NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, ComplexMatrixN::real, sublists(), and toComplexMatrixN().

◆ TEST_CASE() [10/136]

TEST_CASE ( "applyMultiVarPhaseFunc"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also
applyMultiVarPhaseFunc
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 960 of file test_operators.cpp.

960 {
961
962 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
963
964 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
965
966 // try every kind of binary encodings
967 enum bitEncoding encoding = GENERATE( UNSIGNED,TWOS_COMPLEMENT );
968
969 // try every possible number of registers
970 // (between #qubits containing 1, and 1 containing #qubits)
971 int numRegs;
972 int maxNumRegs = 0;
973 if (encoding == UNSIGNED)
974 maxNumRegs = NUM_QUBITS;
975 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
976 maxNumRegs = NUM_QUBITS/2; // floors
977 numRegs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1, maxNumRegs+1) );
978
979 // try every possible total number of involed qubits
980 int totalNumQubits;
981 int minTotalQubits = 0;
982 if (encoding == UNSIGNED)
983 // each register must contain at least 1 qubit
984 minTotalQubits = numRegs;
985 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
986 // each register must contain at least 2 qubits
987 minTotalQubits = 2*numRegs;
988 totalNumQubits = GENERATE_COPY( range(minTotalQubits,NUM_QUBITS+1) );
989
990 // try every qubits subset and ordering
991 int* regs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), totalNumQubits) );
992
993 // assign each sub-reg its minimum length
994 int unallocQubits = totalNumQubits;
995 VLA(int, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs);
996 for (int i=0; i<numRegs; i++)
997 if (encoding == UNSIGNED) {
998 numQubitsPerReg[i] = 1;
999 unallocQubits -= 1;
1000 }
1001 else if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT) {
1002 numQubitsPerReg[i] = 2;
1003 unallocQubits -= 2;
1004 }
1005 // and randomly allocate the remaining qubits between the registers
1006 while (unallocQubits > 0) {
1007 numQubitsPerReg[getRandomInt(0,numRegs)] += 1;
1008 unallocQubits--;
1009 }
1010
1011
1012 // each register gets a random number of terms in the full phase function
1013 VLA(int, numTermsPerReg, numRegs);
1014 int numTermsTotal = 0;
1015 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r++) {
1016 int numTerms = getRandomInt(1,5);
1017 numTermsPerReg[r] = numTerms;
1018 numTermsTotal += numTerms;
1019 }
1020
1021 // populate the multi-var phase function with random but POSITIVE-power terms,
1022 // which must further be integers in two's complement
1023 int flatInd = 0;
1024 VLA(qreal, coeffs, numTermsTotal);
1025 VLA(qreal, expons, numTermsTotal);
1026 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r++) {
1027 for (int t=0; t<numTermsPerReg[r]; t++) {
1028 coeffs[flatInd] = getRandomReal(-10,10);
1029 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
1030 expons[flatInd] = getRandomInt(0, 3+1);
1031 else if (encoding == UNSIGNED)
1032 expons[flatInd] = getRandomReal(0, 3);
1033
1034 flatInd++;
1035 }
1036 }
1037
1038 /* To perform this calculation more distinctly from the QuEST
1039 * core method, we can exploit that
1040 * exp(i (f1[x1] + f2[x2]))|x2>|x1> = exp(i f2[x2])|x2> (x) exp(i f1[x1])|x1>
1041 * and so compute a separate diagonal matrix for each sub-register with
1042 * phases determined only by its own variable, and Kronecker multiply
1043 * them together. The target qubits of the Kronecker product is then
1044 * just the full register, stored in *regs.
1045 */
1046 QMatrix allRegMatr{{1}};
1047 int startInd = 0;
1048
1049 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r++) {
1050
1051 QMatrix singleRegMatr = getZeroMatrix( 1 << numQubitsPerReg[r] );
1052
1053 for (size_t i=0; i<singleRegMatr.size(); i++) {
1054
1055 long long int ind = 0;
1056 if (encoding == UNSIGNED)
1057 ind = i;
1058 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
1059 ind = getTwosComplement(i, numQubitsPerReg[r]);
1060
1061 qreal phase = 0;
1062 for (int t=0; t<numTermsPerReg[r]; t++)
1063 phase += coeffs[t+startInd] * pow(ind, expons[t+startInd]);
1064
1065 singleRegMatr[i][i] = expI(phase);
1066 }
1067 allRegMatr = getKroneckerProduct(singleRegMatr, allRegMatr);
1068 startInd += numTermsPerReg[r];
1069 }
1070
1071 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1072
1073 applyMultiVarPhaseFunc(quregVec, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, encoding, coeffs, expons, numTermsPerReg);
1074 applyReferenceOp(refVec, regs, totalNumQubits, allRegMatr);
1075 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec, 1E4*REAL_EPS) );
1076 }
1077 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1078
1079 applyMultiVarPhaseFunc(quregMatr, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, encoding, coeffs, expons, numTermsPerReg);
1080 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, regs, totalNumQubits, allRegMatr);
1081 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 1E6*REAL_EPS) );
1082 }
1083 }
1084 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1085
1086 int numRegs = 2;
1087 int numQubitsPerReg[] = {2,3};
1088 int qubits[] = {0,1,2,3,4};
1089
1090 SECTION( "number of registers" ) {
1091
1092 numRegs = GENERATE_COPY( -1, 0, 1+MAX_NUM_REGS_APPLY_ARBITRARY_PHASE );
1093 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, NULL), Contains("Invalid number of qubit subregisters") );
1094 }
1095 SECTION( "number of qubits" ) {
1096
1097 numQubitsPerReg[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numRegs))] = GENERATE( -1, 0, 1+NUM_QUBITS );
1098 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, NULL), Contains("Invalid number of qubits") );
1099 }
1100 SECTION( "repetition of qubits" ) {
1101
1102 qubits[GENERATE(2,3,4)] = qubits[1];
1103 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, NULL), Contains("The qubits must be unique") );
1104 }
1105 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
1106
1107 qubits[GENERATE(range(0,NUM_QUBITS))] = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
1108 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, NULL), Contains("Invalid qubit index") );
1109 }
1110 SECTION( "number of terms" ) {
1111
1112 int numTermsPerReg[] = {3, 3};
1113
1114 numTermsPerReg[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numRegs))] = GENERATE( -1, 0 );
1115 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, numTermsPerReg), Contains("Invalid number of terms in the phase function") );
1116 }
1117 SECTION( "bit encoding name" ) {
1118
1119 enum bitEncoding enc = (enum bitEncoding) GENERATE( -1, 2 );
1120 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, enc, NULL, NULL, NULL), Contains("Invalid bit encoding") );
1121 }
1122 SECTION( "two's complement register" ) {
1123
1124 numQubitsPerReg[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numRegs))] = 1;
1125 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, TWOS_COMPLEMENT, NULL, NULL, NULL), Contains("A sub-register contained too few qubits to employ TWOS_COMPLEMENT encoding") );
1126 }
1127 SECTION( "fractional exponent" ) {
1128
1129 int numTermsPerReg[] = {3, 3};
1130 qreal coeffs[] = {0,0,0, 0,0,0};
1131 qreal expos[] = {1,2,3, 1,2,3};
1132
1133 expos[GENERATE(range(0,6))] = GENERATE( 0.5, 1.999, 5.0001 );
1134 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, TWOS_COMPLEMENT, coeffs, expos, numTermsPerReg), Contains("The phase function contained a fractional exponent, which is illegal in TWOS_COMPLEMENT") );
1135
1136 // ensure fractional exponents are valid in unsigned mode however
1137 REQUIRE_NOTHROW( applyMultiVarPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, coeffs, expos, numTermsPerReg) );
1138
1139 }
1140 SECTION( "negative exponent" ) {
1141
1142 int numTermsPerReg[] = {3, 3};
1143 qreal coeffs[] = {0,0,0, 0,0,0};
1144 qreal expos[] = {1,2,3, 1,2,3};
1145
1146 expos[GENERATE(range(0,6))] = GENERATE( -1, -2, -2.5 );
1147 enum bitEncoding enc = GENERATE( UNSIGNED, TWOS_COMPLEMENT );
1148
1149 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, enc, coeffs, expos, numTermsPerReg), Contains("The phase function contained an illegal negative exponent") );
1150 }
1151 }
1152 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
1153}
MAX_NUM_REGS_APPLY_ARBITRARY_PHASE
#define MAX_NUM_REGS_APPLY_ARBITRARY_PHASE
Definition: QuEST_precision.h:85
applyMultiVarPhaseFunc
void applyMultiVarPhaseFunc(Qureg qureg, int *qubits, int *numQubitsPerReg, int numRegs, enum bitEncoding encoding, qreal *coeffs, qreal *exponents, int *numTermsPerReg)
Induces a phase change upon each amplitude of qureg, determined by a multi-variable exponential polyn...
Definition: QuEST.c:769
getTwosComplement
long long int getTwosComplement(long long int decimal, int numBits)
Returns the two's complement signed encoding of the unsigned number decimal, which must be a number b...

getRandomInt
int getRandomInt(int min, int max)
Returns a random integer between min (inclusive) and max (exclusive), from the uniform distribution.
Definition: utilities.cpp:527
getKroneckerProduct
QVector getKroneckerProduct(QVector b, QVector a)
Returns b (otimes) a.
Definition: utilities.cpp:143
qreal
#define qreal
A precision-agnostic floating point number, as determined by QuEST_PREC.

bitEncoding
Flags for specifying how the bits in sub-register computational basis states are mapped to indices in...

qcomp expI(qreal phase)
Returns the unit-norm complex number exp(i*phase).
Definition: utilities.cpp:418
VLA
#define VLA(type, name, len)
This is absolute war against MSVC C++14 which does not permit variable-length arrays.

References applyMultiVarPhaseFunc(), applyReferenceOp(), areEqual(), CLEANUP_TEST, expI(), getKroneckerProduct(), getRandomInt(), getRandomReal(), getTwosComplement(), getZeroMatrix(), MAX_NUM_REGS_APPLY_ARBITRARY_PHASE, NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, qreal, sublists(), TWOS_COMPLEMENT, UNSIGNED, and VLA.

◆ TEST_CASE() [11/136]

TEST_CASE ( "applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also
applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 1161 of file test_operators.cpp.

1161 {
1162
1163 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
1164
1165 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1166
1167 // try every kind of binary encodings
1168 enum bitEncoding encoding = GENERATE( UNSIGNED,TWOS_COMPLEMENT );
1169
1170 // try every possible number of registers
1171 // (between #qubits containing 1, and 1 containing #qubits)
1172 int numRegs;
1173 int maxNumRegs = 0;
1174 if (encoding == UNSIGNED)
1175 maxNumRegs = NUM_QUBITS;
1176 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
1177 maxNumRegs = NUM_QUBITS/2; // floors
1178 numRegs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1, maxNumRegs+1) );
1179
1180 // try every possible total number of involed qubits
1181 int totalNumQubits;
1182 int minTotalQubits = 0;
1183 if (encoding == UNSIGNED)
1184 // each register must contain at least 1 qubit
1185 minTotalQubits = numRegs;
1186 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
1187 // each register must contain at least 2 qubits
1188 minTotalQubits = 2*numRegs;
1189 totalNumQubits = GENERATE_COPY( range(minTotalQubits,NUM_QUBITS+1) );
1190
1191 // try every qubits subset and ordering
1192 int* regs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), totalNumQubits) );
1193
1194 // assign each sub-reg its minimum length
1195 int unallocQubits = totalNumQubits;
1196 VLA(int, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs);
1197 for (int i=0; i<numRegs; i++)
1198 if (encoding == UNSIGNED) {
1199 numQubitsPerReg[i] = 1;
1200 unallocQubits -= 1;
1201 }
1202 else if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT) {
1203 numQubitsPerReg[i] = 2;
1204 unallocQubits -= 2;
1205 }
1206 // and randomly allocate the remaining qubits between the registers
1207 while (unallocQubits > 0) {
1208 numQubitsPerReg[getRandomInt(0,numRegs)] += 1;
1209 unallocQubits--;
1210 }
1211
1212
1213 // each register gets a random number of terms in the full phase function
1214 VLA(int, numTermsPerReg, numRegs);
1215 int numTermsTotal = 0;
1216 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r++) {
1217 int numTerms = getRandomInt(1,5);
1218 numTermsPerReg[r] = numTerms;
1219 numTermsTotal += numTerms;
1220 }
1221
1222 // populate the multi-var phase function with random but POSITIVE-power terms,
1223 // which must further be integers in two's complement
1224 int flatInd = 0;
1225 VLA(qreal, coeffs, numTermsTotal);
1226 VLA(qreal, expons, numTermsTotal);
1227 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r++) {
1228 for (int t=0; t<numTermsPerReg[r]; t++) {
1229 coeffs[flatInd] = getRandomReal(-10,10);
1230 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
1231 expons[flatInd] = getRandomInt(0, 3+1);
1232 else if (encoding == UNSIGNED)
1233 expons[flatInd] = getRandomReal(0, 3);
1234
1235 flatInd++;
1236 }
1237 }
1238
1239
1240 // choose a random number of overrides (even overriding every amplitude)
1241 int numOverrides = getRandomInt(0, (1<<totalNumQubits) + 1);
1242
1243 // randomise each override index (uniqueness isn't checked)
1244 VLA(long long int, overrideInds, numOverrides*numRegs);
1245 flatInd = 0;
1246 for (int v=0; v<numOverrides; v++) {
1247 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r++) {
1248 if (encoding == UNSIGNED)
1249 overrideInds[flatInd] = getRandomInt(0, 1<<numQubitsPerReg[r]);
1250 else if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
1251 overrideInds[flatInd] = getRandomInt(-(1<<(numQubitsPerReg[r]-1)), (1<<(numQubitsPerReg[r]-1))-1);
1252 flatInd++;
1253 }
1254 }
1255
1256 // override to a random phase
1257 VLA(qreal, overridePhases, numOverrides);
1258 for (int v=0; v<numOverrides; v++)
1259 overridePhases[v] = getRandomReal(-4, 4); // periodic in [-pi, pi]
1260
1261 /* To perform this calculation more distinctly from the QuEST
1262 * core method, we can exploit that
1263 * exp(i (f1[x1] + f2[x2]))|x2>|x1> = exp(i f2[x2])|x2> (x) exp(i f1[x1])|x1>
1264 * and so compute a separate diagonal matrix for each sub-register with
1265 * phases determined only by its own variable, and Kronecker multiply
1266 * them together. The target qubits of the Kronecker product is then
1267 * just the full register, stored in *regs. We do this, then iterate
1268 * the list of overrides directly to overwrite the ultimate diagonal
1269 * entries
1270 */
1271 QMatrix allRegMatr{{1}};
1272 int startInd = 0;
1273 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r++) {
1274
1275 QMatrix singleRegMatr = getZeroMatrix( 1 << numQubitsPerReg[r] );
1276
1277 for (size_t i=0; i<singleRegMatr.size(); i++) {
1278
1279 long long int ind = 0;
1280 if (encoding == UNSIGNED)
1281 ind = i;
1282 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
1283 ind = getTwosComplement(i, numQubitsPerReg[r]);
1284
1285 qreal phase = 0;
1286 for (int t=0; t<numTermsPerReg[r]; t++)
1287 phase += coeffs[t+startInd] * pow(ind, expons[t+startInd]);
1288
1289 singleRegMatr[i][i] = expI(phase);
1290 }
1291 allRegMatr = getKroneckerProduct(singleRegMatr, allRegMatr);
1292 startInd += numTermsPerReg[r];
1293 }
1294 setDiagMatrixOverrides(allRegMatr, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, encoding, overrideInds, overridePhases, numOverrides);
1295
1296 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1297
1298 applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, encoding, coeffs, expons, numTermsPerReg, overrideInds, overridePhases, numOverrides);
1299 applyReferenceOp(refVec, regs, totalNumQubits, allRegMatr);
1300 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec, 1E4*REAL_EPS) );
1301 }
1302 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1303
1304 applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregMatr, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, encoding, coeffs, expons, numTermsPerReg, overrideInds, overridePhases, numOverrides);
1305 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, regs, totalNumQubits, allRegMatr);
1306 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 1E6*REAL_EPS) );
1307 }
1308 }
1309 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1310
1311 int numRegs = 2;
1312 int numQubitsPerReg[] = {2,3};
1313 int qubits[] = {0,1,2,3,4};
1314
1315 SECTION( "number of registers" ) {
1316
1317 numRegs = GENERATE_COPY( -1, 0, 1+MAX_NUM_REGS_APPLY_ARBITRARY_PHASE );
1318 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("Invalid number of qubit subregisters") );
1319 }
1320 SECTION( "number of qubits" ) {
1321
1322 numQubitsPerReg[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numRegs))] = GENERATE( -1, 0, 1+NUM_QUBITS );
1323 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("Invalid number of qubits") );
1324 }
1325 SECTION( "repetition of qubits" ) {
1326
1327 qubits[GENERATE(2,3,4)] = qubits[1];
1328 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("The qubits must be unique") );
1329 }
1330 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
1331
1332 qubits[GENERATE(range(0,NUM_QUBITS))] = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
1333 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("Invalid qubit index") );
1334 }
1335 SECTION( "number of terms" ) {
1336
1337 int numTermsPerReg[] = {3, 3};
1338
1339 numTermsPerReg[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numRegs))] = GENERATE( -1, 0 );
1340 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, numTermsPerReg, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("Invalid number of terms in the phase function") );
1341 }
1342 SECTION( "bit encoding name" ) {
1343
1344 enum bitEncoding enc = (enum bitEncoding) GENERATE( -1, 2 );
1345 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, enc, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("Invalid bit encoding") );
1346 }
1347 SECTION( "two's complement register" ) {
1348
1349 numQubitsPerReg[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numRegs))] = 1;
1350 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, TWOS_COMPLEMENT, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("A sub-register contained too few qubits to employ TWOS_COMPLEMENT encoding") );
1351 }
1352 SECTION( "fractional exponent" ) {
1353
1354 int numTermsPerReg[] = {3, 3};
1355 qreal coeffs[] = {0,0,0, 0,0,0};
1356 qreal expos[] = {1,2,3, 1,2,3};
1357
1358 expos[GENERATE(range(0,6))] = GENERATE( 0.5, 1.999, 5.0001 );
1359 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, TWOS_COMPLEMENT, coeffs, expos, numTermsPerReg, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("The phase function contained a fractional exponent, which is illegal in TWOS_COMPLEMENT") );
1360
1361 // ensure fractional exponents are valid in unsigned mode however
1362 REQUIRE_NOTHROW( applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, coeffs, expos, numTermsPerReg, NULL, NULL, 0) );
1363 }
1364 SECTION( "negative exponent" ) {
1365
1366 int numTermsPerReg[] = {3, 3};
1367 qreal coeffs[] = {0,0,0, 0,0,0};
1368 qreal expos[] = {1,2,3, 1,2,3};
1369
1370 expos[GENERATE(range(0,6))] = GENERATE( -1, -2, -2.5 );
1371 enum bitEncoding enc = GENERATE( UNSIGNED, TWOS_COMPLEMENT );
1372
1373 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, enc, coeffs, expos, numTermsPerReg, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("The phase function contained an illegal negative exponent") );
1374 }
1375 SECTION( "number of overrides" ) {
1376
1377 int numTermsPerReg[] = {3, 3};
1378 qreal coeffs[] = {0,0,0, 0,0,0};
1379 qreal expos[] = {1,2,3, 1,2,3};
1380
1381 int numOverrides = -1;
1382 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, coeffs, expos, numTermsPerReg, NULL, NULL, numOverrides), Contains("Invalid number of phase function overrides specified") );
1383 }
1384 SECTION( "override indices" ) {
1385
1386 int numTermsPerReg[] = {3, 3};
1387 qreal coeffs[] = {0,0,0, 0,0,0};
1388 qreal expos[] = {1,2,3, 1,2,3};
1389
1390 // numQubitsPerReg = {2, 3}
1391 int numOverrides = 3;
1392 long long int overrideInds[] = {0,0, 0,0, 0,0}; // repetition not checked
1393 qreal overridePhases[] = {.1, .1, .1};
1394
1395 // first element of overrideInds coordinate is a 2 qubit register
1396 enum bitEncoding enc = UNSIGNED;
1397 int badInd = GENERATE(0, 2, 4);
1398 overrideInds[badInd] = GENERATE( -1, (1<<2) );
1399 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, enc, coeffs, expos, numTermsPerReg, overrideInds, overridePhases, numOverrides), Contains("Invalid phase function override index, in the UNSIGNED encoding") );
1400 overrideInds[badInd] = 0;
1401
1402 // second element of overrideInds coordinate is a 3 qubit register
1403 badInd += 1;
1404 overrideInds[badInd] = GENERATE( -1, (1<<3) );
1405 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, enc, coeffs, expos, numTermsPerReg, overrideInds, overridePhases, numOverrides), Contains("Invalid phase function override index, in the UNSIGNED encoding") );
1406 overrideInds[badInd] = 0;
1407 badInd -= 1;
1408
1409 enc = TWOS_COMPLEMENT;
1410 int minInd = -(1<<(numQubitsPerReg[0]-1));
1411 int maxInd = (1<<(numQubitsPerReg[0]-1)) - 1;
1412 overrideInds[badInd] = GENERATE_COPY( minInd-1, maxInd+1 );
1413 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, enc, coeffs, expos, numTermsPerReg, overrideInds, overridePhases, numOverrides), Contains("Invalid phase function override index, in the TWOS_COMPLEMENT encoding") );
1414 overrideInds[badInd] = 0;
1415
1416 badInd++;
1417 minInd = -(1<<(numQubitsPerReg[1]-1));
1418 maxInd = (1<<(numQubitsPerReg[1]-1)) -1;
1419 overrideInds[badInd] = GENERATE_COPY( minInd-1, maxInd+1 );
1420 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, enc, coeffs, expos, numTermsPerReg, overrideInds, overridePhases, numOverrides), Contains("Invalid phase function override index, in the TWOS_COMPLEMENT encoding") );
1421 }
1422 }
1423 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
1424}
applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides
void applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(Qureg qureg, int *qubits, int *numQubitsPerReg, int numRegs, enum bitEncoding encoding, qreal *coeffs, qreal *exponents, int *numTermsPerReg, long long int *overrideInds, qreal *overridePhases, int numOverrides)
Induces a phase change upon each amplitude of qureg, determined by a multi-variable exponential polyn...

setDiagMatrixOverrides
void setDiagMatrixOverrides(QMatrix &matr, int *numQubitsPerReg, int numRegs, enum bitEncoding encoding, long long int *overrideInds, qreal *overridePhases, int numOverrides)
Modifies the given diagonal matrix such that the diagonal elements which correspond to the coordinate...

References applyMultiVarPhaseFuncOverrides(), applyReferenceOp(), areEqual(), CLEANUP_TEST, expI(), getKroneckerProduct(), getRandomInt(), getRandomReal(), getTwosComplement(), getZeroMatrix(), MAX_NUM_REGS_APPLY_ARBITRARY_PHASE, NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, qreal, setDiagMatrixOverrides(), sublists(), TWOS_COMPLEMENT, UNSIGNED, and VLA.

◆ TEST_CASE() [12/136]

TEST_CASE ( "applyNamedPhaseFunc"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also
applyNamedPhaseFunc
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 1432 of file test_operators.cpp.

1432 {
1433
1434 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
1435
1436 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1437
1438 // try every kind of binary encoding
1439 enum bitEncoding encoding = GENERATE( UNSIGNED,TWOS_COMPLEMENT );
1440
1441 // try every possible number of registers
1442 // (between #qubits containing 1, and 1 containing #qubits)
1443 int numRegs;
1444 int maxNumRegs = 0;
1445 if (encoding == UNSIGNED)
1446 maxNumRegs = NUM_QUBITS;
1447 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
1448 maxNumRegs = NUM_QUBITS/2; // floors
1449 numRegs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1, maxNumRegs+1) );
1450
1451 // try every possible total number of involved qubits
1452 int totalNumQubits;
1453 int minTotalQubits = 0;
1454 if (encoding == UNSIGNED)
1455 // each register must contain at least 1 qubit
1456 minTotalQubits = numRegs;
1457 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
1458 // each register must contain at least 2 qubits
1459 minTotalQubits = 2*numRegs;
1460 totalNumQubits = GENERATE_COPY( range(minTotalQubits,NUM_QUBITS+1) );
1461
1462 // try every qubits subset and ordering
1463 int* regs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), totalNumQubits) );
1464
1465 // assign each sub-reg its minimum length
1466 int unallocQubits = totalNumQubits;
1467 VLA(int, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs);
1468 for (int i=0; i<numRegs; i++)
1469 if (encoding == UNSIGNED) {
1470 numQubitsPerReg[i] = 1;
1471 unallocQubits -= 1;
1472 }
1473 else if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT) {
1474 numQubitsPerReg[i] = 2;
1475 unallocQubits -= 2;
1476 }
1477 // and randomly allocate the remaining qubits between the registers
1478 while (unallocQubits > 0) {
1479 numQubitsPerReg[getRandomInt(0,numRegs)] += 1;
1480 unallocQubits--;
1481 }
1482
1483 // for reference, determine the values corresponding to each register for all basis states
1484 std::vector<std::vector<qreal>> regVals(1<<totalNumQubits, std::vector<qreal>(numRegs));
1485 for (long long int i=0; i<(1<<totalNumQubits); i++) {
1486
1487 long long int bits = i;
1488 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r++) {
1489 regVals[i][r] = bits % (1 << numQubitsPerReg[r]);
1490 bits = bits >> numQubitsPerReg[r];
1491
1492 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
1493 regVals[i][r] = getTwosComplement(regVals[i][r], numQubitsPerReg[r]);
1494 }
1495 }
1496
1497 /* the reference diagonal matrix which assumes the qubits are
1498 * contiguous and strictly increasing between the registers, and hence
1499 * only depends on the number of qubits in each register.
1500 */
1501 QMatrix diagMatr = getZeroMatrix(1 << totalNumQubits);
1502
1503 SECTION( "NORM" ) {
1504
1505 for (size_t i=0; i<diagMatr.size(); i++) {
1506 qreal phase = 0;
1507 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r++)
1508 phase += pow(regVals[i][r], 2);
1509 phase = sqrt(phase);
1510 diagMatr[i][i] = expI(phase);
1511 }
1512
1513 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1514
1515 applyNamedPhaseFunc(quregVec, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, encoding, NORM);
1516 applyReferenceOp(refVec, regs, totalNumQubits, diagMatr);
1517 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec, 1E2*REAL_EPS) );
1518 }
1519 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1520
1521 applyNamedPhaseFunc(quregMatr, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, encoding, NORM);
1522 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, regs, totalNumQubits, diagMatr);
1523 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 142*REAL_EPS) );
1524 }
1525 }
1526 SECTION( "PRODUCT" ) {
1527
1528 for (size_t i=0; i<diagMatr.size(); i++) {
1529 qreal phase = 1;
1530 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r++)
1531 phase *= regVals[i][r];
1532 diagMatr[i][i] = expI(phase);
1533 }
1534
1535 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1536
1537 applyNamedPhaseFunc(quregVec, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, encoding, PRODUCT);
1538 applyReferenceOp(refVec, regs, totalNumQubits, diagMatr);
1539 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec, 1E2*REAL_EPS) );
1540 }
1541 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1542
1543 applyNamedPhaseFunc(quregMatr, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, encoding, PRODUCT);
1544 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, regs, totalNumQubits, diagMatr);
1545 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 142*REAL_EPS) );
1546 }
1547 }
1548 SECTION( "DISTANCE" ) {
1549
1550 // test only if there are an even number of registers
1551 if (numRegs%2 == 0) {
1552
1553 for (size_t i=0; i<diagMatr.size(); i++) {
1554 qreal phase = 0;
1555 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r+=2)
1556 phase += pow(regVals[i][r+1]-regVals[i][r], 2);
1557 phase = sqrt(phase);
1558 diagMatr[i][i] = expI(phase);
1559 }
1560 }
1561
1562 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1563
1564 if (numRegs%2 == 0) {
1565 applyNamedPhaseFunc(quregVec, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, encoding, DISTANCE);
1566 applyReferenceOp(refVec, regs, totalNumQubits, diagMatr);
1567 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec, 1E2*REAL_EPS) );
1568 }
1569 }
1570 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1571
1572 if (numRegs%2 == 0) {
1573 applyNamedPhaseFunc(quregMatr, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, encoding, DISTANCE);
1574 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, regs, totalNumQubits, diagMatr);
1575 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 142*REAL_EPS) );
1576 }
1577 }
1578 }
1579 }
1580 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1581
1582 int numRegs = 2;
1583 int numQubitsPerReg[] = {2,3};
1584 int regs[] = {0,1,2,3,4};
1585
1586 SECTION( "number of registers" ) {
1587
1588 numRegs = GENERATE_COPY( -1, 0, 1+MAX_NUM_REGS_APPLY_ARBITRARY_PHASE );
1589 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyNamedPhaseFunc(quregVec, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, NORM), Contains("Invalid number of qubit subregisters") );
1590 }
1591 SECTION( "number of qubits" ) {
1592
1593 numQubitsPerReg[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numRegs))] = GENERATE( -1, 0, 1+NUM_QUBITS );
1594 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyNamedPhaseFunc(quregVec, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, NORM), Contains("Invalid number of qubits") );
1595 }
1596 SECTION( "repetition of qubits" ) {
1597
1598 regs[GENERATE(2,3,4)] = regs[1];
1599 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyNamedPhaseFunc(quregVec, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, NORM), Contains("The qubits must be unique") );
1600 }
1601 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
1602
1603 regs[GENERATE(range(0,NUM_QUBITS))] = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
1604 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyNamedPhaseFunc(quregVec, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, NORM), Contains("Invalid qubit index") );
1605 }
1606 SECTION( "bit encoding name" ) {
1607
1608 enum bitEncoding enc = (enum bitEncoding) GENERATE( -1, 2 );
1609 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyNamedPhaseFunc(quregVec, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, enc, NORM), Contains("Invalid bit encoding") );
1610 }
1611 SECTION( "two's complement register" ) {
1612
1613 numQubitsPerReg[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numRegs))] = 1;
1614 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyNamedPhaseFunc(quregVec, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, TWOS_COMPLEMENT, NORM), Contains("A sub-register contained too few qubits to employ TWOS_COMPLEMENT encoding") );
1615 }
1616 SECTION( "phase function name" ) {
1617
1618 enum phaseFunc func = (enum phaseFunc) GENERATE( -1, MAX_INDEX_PHASE_FUNC + 1 );
1619 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyNamedPhaseFunc(quregVec, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, func), Contains("Invalid named phase function") );
1620 }
1621 SECTION( "phase function parameters" ) {
1622
1623 enum phaseFunc func = GENERATE( SCALED_NORM, INVERSE_NORM, SCALED_INVERSE_NORM, SCALED_INVERSE_SHIFTED_NORM, SCALED_PRODUCT, INVERSE_PRODUCT, SCALED_INVERSE_PRODUCT, SCALED_DISTANCE, INVERSE_DISTANCE, SCALED_INVERSE_DISTANCE, SCALED_INVERSE_SHIFTED_DISTANCE );
1624 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyNamedPhaseFunc(quregVec, regs, numQubitsPerReg, numRegs, UNSIGNED, func), Contains("Invalid number of parameters") );
1625 }
1626 SECTION( "distance pair registers" ) {
1627
1628 int numQb[] = {1,1,1,1,1};
1629 int qb[] = {0,1,2,3,4};
1630
1631 numRegs = GENERATE( 1, 3, 5 );
1632 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyNamedPhaseFunc(quregVec, qb, numQb, numRegs, UNSIGNED, DISTANCE), Contains("Phase functions DISTANCE") && Contains("even number of sub-registers") );
1633 }
1634 }
1635 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
1636}
applyNamedPhaseFunc
void applyNamedPhaseFunc(Qureg qureg, int *qubits, int *numQubitsPerReg, int numRegs, enum bitEncoding encoding, enum phaseFunc functionNameCode)
Induces a phase change upon each amplitude of qureg, determined by a named (and potentially multi-var...

TEST_CASE ( "applyNamedPhaseFuncOverrides"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also

Author
