TEST_CASE ( "applyPhaseFunc"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also
applyPhaseFunc
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 3360 of file test_operators.cpp.

3360 {
3361
3362 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
3363
3364 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
3365
3366 // try every kind of binary encodings
3367 enum bitEncoding encoding = GENERATE( UNSIGNED,TWOS_COMPLEMENT );
3368
3369 // try every sub-register size
3370 int numQubits = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,NUM_QUBITS+1) );
3371
3372 // force at least 2 qubits in two's compement though
3373 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT && numQubits == 1)
3374 numQubits++;
3375
3376 // try every possible sub-register
3377 int* qubits = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numQubits) );
3378
3379 // choose a random number of terms in the phase function
3380 int numTerms = getRandomInt(1, 5);
3381
3382 // populate the phase function with random but POSITIVE-power terms,
3383 // and in two's complement mode, strictly integer powers
3384 VLA(qreal, coeffs, numTerms);
3385 VLA(qreal, expons, numTerms);
3386 for (int t=0; t<numTerms; t++) {
3387 coeffs[t] = getRandomReal(-10,10);
3388 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
3389 expons[t] = getRandomInt(0, 3+1); // repetition of power is ok
3390 else
3391 expons[t] = getRandomReal(0, 3);
3392 }
3393
3394 // build a reference diagonal matrix, on the reduced Hilbert space
3395 QMatrix matr = getZeroMatrix( 1 << numQubits );
3396 for (size_t i=0; i<matr.size(); i++) {
3397
3398 long long int ind = 0;
3399 if (encoding == UNSIGNED)
3400 ind = i;
3401 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
3402 ind = getTwosComplement(i, numQubits);
3403
3404 qreal phase = 0;
3405 for (int t=0; t<numTerms; t++)
3406 phase += coeffs[t] * pow(ind, expons[t]);
3407
3408 matr[i][i] = expI(phase);
3409 }
3410
3411 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
3412
3413 applyPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, encoding, coeffs, expons, numTerms);
3414 applyReferenceOp(refVec, qubits, numQubits, matr);
3415 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec, 1E4*REAL_EPS) );
3416 }
3417 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
3418
3419 applyPhaseFunc(quregMatr, qubits, numQubits, encoding, coeffs, expons, numTerms);
3420 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, qubits, numQubits, matr);
3421 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 1E6*REAL_EPS) );
3422 }
3423 }
3424 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
3425
3426 int numQubits = 3;
3427 int qubits[] = {0,1,2};
3428
3429 SECTION( "number of qubits" ) {
3430
3431 numQubits = GENERATE_COPY( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
3432 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFunc(quregVec, NULL, numQubits, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, 1), Contains("Invalid number of qubits") );
3433 }
3434 SECTION( "repetition of qubits" ) {
3435
3436 qubits[GENERATE(1,2)] = qubits[0];
3437 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, 1), Contains("The qubits must be unique") );
3438 }
3439 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
3440
3441 int inv = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
3442 qubits[ GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numQubits) )] = inv;
3443 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, 1), Contains("Invalid qubit index") );
3444 }
3445 SECTION( "number of terms" ) {
3446
3447 int numTerms = GENERATE( -1, 0 );
3448 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, numTerms), Contains("Invalid number of terms in the phase function") );
3449 }
3450 SECTION( "bit encoding name" ) {
3451
3452 enum bitEncoding enc = (enum bitEncoding) GENERATE( -1,2 );
3453 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, enc, NULL, NULL, 1), Contains("Invalid bit encoding") );
3454 }
3455 SECTION( "two's complement register" ) {
3456
3457 numQubits = 1;
3458 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, TWOS_COMPLEMENT, NULL, NULL, 1), Contains("too few qubits to employ TWOS_COMPLEMENT") );
3459 }
3460 SECTION( "fractional exponent" ) {
3461
3462 int numTerms = 3;
3463 qreal coeffs[] = {0,0,0};
3464 qreal expos[] = {1,2,3};
3465 expos[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTerms) )] = GENERATE( 0.5, 1.999, 5.0001 );
3466
3467 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, TWOS_COMPLEMENT, coeffs, expos, numTerms), Contains("fractional exponent") && Contains("TWOS_COMPLEMENT") && Contains("negative indices were not overriden") );
3468 }
3469 SECTION( "negative exponent" ) {
3470
3471 int numTerms = 3;
3472 qreal coeffs[] = {0,0,0};
3473 qreal expos[] = {1,2,3};
3474 expos[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTerms) )] = GENERATE( -1, -2, -1.5 );
3475
3476 enum bitEncoding encoding = GENERATE( UNSIGNED, TWOS_COMPLEMENT );
3477
3478 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFunc(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, encoding, coeffs, expos, numTerms), Contains("The phase function contained a negative exponent which would diverge at zero, but the zero index was not overriden") );
3479 }
3480 }
3481 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
3482}
applyPhaseFunc
void applyPhaseFunc(Qureg qureg, int *qubits, int numQubits, enum bitEncoding encoding, qreal *coeffs, qreal *exponents, int numTerms)
Induces a phase change upon each amplitude of qureg, determined by the passed exponential polynomial ...
Definition: QuEST.c:734

References applyPhaseFunc(), applyReferenceOp(), areEqual(), CLEANUP_TEST, expI(), getRandomInt(), getRandomReal(), getTwosComplement(), getZeroMatrix(), NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, qreal, sublists(), TWOS_COMPLEMENT, UNSIGNED, and VLA.

◆ TEST_CASE() [19/136]

TEST_CASE ( "applyPhaseFuncOverrides"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also
applyPhaseFuncOverrides
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 3490 of file test_operators.cpp.

3490 {
3491
3492 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
3493
3494 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
3495
3496 // try every kind of binary encodings
3497 enum bitEncoding encoding = GENERATE( UNSIGNED,TWOS_COMPLEMENT );
3498
3499 // try every sub-register size
3500 int numQubits = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,NUM_QUBITS+1) );
3501
3502 // force at least 2 qubits in two's compement though
3503 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT && numQubits == 1)
3504 numQubits++;
3505
3506 // try every possible sub-register
3507 int* qubits = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numQubits) );
3508
3509 // choose a random number of terms in the phase function
3510 int numTerms = getRandomInt(1, 21);
3511
3512 // populate the phase function with random powers.
3513 // this includes negative powers, so we must always override 0.
3514 // in two's complement, we must use only integer powers
3515 VLA(qreal, coeffs, numTerms);
3516 VLA(qreal, expons, numTerms);
3517 for (int t=0; t<numTerms; t++) {
3518 coeffs[t] = getRandomReal(-10,10);
3519 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
3520 expons[t] = getRandomInt(-3, 3+1); // note we COULD do getRandomReal(), and override all negatives
3521 else
3522 expons[t] = getRandomReal(-3, 3);
3523 }
3524
3525 // choose a random number of overrides (even overriding every amplitude)
3526 int numOverrides = getRandomInt(1, (1<<numQubits) + 1);
3527
3528 // randomise each override index (uniqueness isn't checked)
3529 VLA(long long int, overrideInds, numOverrides);
3530 overrideInds[0] = 0LL;
3531 for (int i=1; i<numOverrides; i++)
3532 if (encoding == UNSIGNED)
3533 overrideInds[i] = getRandomInt(0, 1<<numQubits);
3534 else if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
3535 overrideInds[i] = getRandomInt(-(1<<(numQubits-1)), (1<<(numQubits-1))-1);
3536
3537 // override to a random phase
3538 VLA(qreal, overridePhases, numOverrides);
3539 for (int i=0; i<numOverrides; i++)
3540 overridePhases[i] = getRandomReal(-4, 4); // periodic in [-pi, pi]
3541
3542 // build a reference diagonal matrix, on the reduced Hilbert space
3543 QMatrix matr = getZeroMatrix( 1 << numQubits );
3544 for (size_t i=0; i<matr.size(); i++) {
3545
3546 long long int ind = 0;
3547 if (encoding == UNSIGNED)
3548 ind = i;
3549 if (encoding == TWOS_COMPLEMENT)
3550 ind = getTwosComplement(i, numQubits);
3551
3552 // reference diagonal matrix incorporates overriden phases
3553 qreal phase;
3554 bool overriden = false;
3555 for (int v=0; v<numOverrides; v++) {
3556 if (ind == overrideInds[v]) {
3557 phase = overridePhases[v];
3558 overriden = true;
3559 break;
3560 }
3561 }
3562
3563 if (!overriden) {
3564 phase = 0;
3565 for (int t=0; t<numTerms; t++)
3566 phase += coeffs[t] * pow(ind, expons[t]);
3567 }
3568
3569 matr[i][i] = expI(phase);
3570 }
3571
3572 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
3573
3574 applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, encoding, coeffs, expons, numTerms, overrideInds, overridePhases, numOverrides);
3575 applyReferenceOp(refVec, qubits, numQubits, matr);
3576 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec, 1E4*REAL_EPS) );
3577 }
3578 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
3579
3580 applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregMatr, qubits, numQubits, encoding, coeffs, expons, numTerms, overrideInds, overridePhases, numOverrides);
3581 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, qubits, numQubits, matr);
3582 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 1E6*REAL_EPS) );
3583 }
3584 }
3585 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
3586
3587 int numQubits = 3;
3588 int qubits[] = {0,1,2};
3589
3590 SECTION( "number of qubits" ) {
3591
3592 int numQubits = GENERATE_COPY( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
3593 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, NULL, numQubits, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, 1, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("Invalid number of qubits") );
3594 }
3595 SECTION( "repetition qubits" ) {
3596
3597 qubits[GENERATE(1,2)] = qubits[0];
3598 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, 1, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("The qubits must be unique") );
3599 }
3600 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
3601
3602 int inv = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
3603 qubits[ GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numQubits) )] = inv;
3604 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, 1, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("Invalid qubit index") );
3605 }
3606 SECTION( "number of terms" ) {
3607
3608 int numTerms = GENERATE( -1, 0 );
3609 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, UNSIGNED, NULL, NULL, numTerms, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("Invalid number of terms in the phase function") );
3610 }
3611 SECTION( "bit encoding name" ) {
3612
3613 enum bitEncoding enc = (enum bitEncoding) GENERATE( -1,2 );
3614 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, enc, NULL, NULL, 1, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("Invalid bit encoding") );
3615 }
3616 SECTION( "two's complement register" ) {
3617
3618 numQubits = 1;
3619 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, TWOS_COMPLEMENT, NULL, NULL, 1, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("too few qubits to employ TWOS_COMPLEMENT") );
3620 }
3621 SECTION( "number of overrides" ) {
3622
3623 qreal dummyTerms[] = {0};
3624
3625 int numOverrides = GENERATE_COPY( -1, 1 + (1<<numQubits) );
3626 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, UNSIGNED, dummyTerms, dummyTerms, 1, NULL, NULL, numOverrides), Contains("Invalid number of phase function overrides") );
3627 }
3628 SECTION( "override indices" ) {
3629
3630 int numOverrides = 3;
3631 long long int overrideInds[] = {0,1,2};
3632 qreal overridePhases[] = {.1,.1,.1};
3633 qreal dummyTerms[] = {0};
3634
3635 enum bitEncoding encoding = UNSIGNED;
3636 overrideInds[GENERATE(0,1,2)] = GENERATE_COPY( -1, (1<<numQubits) );
3637 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, encoding, dummyTerms, dummyTerms, 1, overrideInds, overridePhases, numOverrides), Contains("Invalid phase function override index, in the UNSIGNED encoding") );
3638
3639 encoding = TWOS_COMPLEMENT;
3640 long long int newInds[] = {0,1,2};
3641 int minInd = -(1<<(numQubits-1));
3642 int maxInd = (1<<(numQubits-1)) -1;
3643 newInds[GENERATE(0,1,2)] = GENERATE_COPY( minInd-1, maxInd+1 );
3644 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, encoding, dummyTerms, dummyTerms, 1, newInds, overridePhases, numOverrides), Contains("Invalid phase function override index, in the TWOS_COMPLEMENT encoding") );
3645 }
3646 SECTION( "fractional exponent" ) {
3647
3648 int numTerms = 3;
3649 qreal coeffs[] = {0,0,0};
3650 qreal expos[] = {1,2,3};
3651
3652 // make one exponent fractional, thereby requiring negative overrides
3653 expos[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTerms) )] = GENERATE( 0.5, 1.999, 5.0001 );
3654
3655 // catch when no negative indices are overridden
3656 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, TWOS_COMPLEMENT, coeffs, expos, numTerms, NULL, NULL, 0), Contains("fractional exponent") && Contains("TWOS_COMPLEMENT") && Contains("negative indices were not overriden") );
3657
3658 int numNegs = 1 << (numQubits-1);
3659 VLA(long long int, overrideInds, numNegs);
3660 VLA(qreal, overridePhases, numNegs);
3661 for (int i=0; i<numNegs; i++) {
3662 overrideInds[i] = -(i+1);
3663 overridePhases[i] = 0;
3664 }
3665
3666 // ensure no throw when all are overriden
3667 REQUIRE_NOTHROW( applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, TWOS_COMPLEMENT, coeffs, expos, numTerms, overrideInds, overridePhases, numNegs) );
3668
3669 // catch when at least one isn't overriden
3670 overrideInds[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numNegs) )] = 0; // override a non-negative
3671 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, TWOS_COMPLEMENT, coeffs, expos, numTerms, overrideInds, overridePhases, numNegs), Contains("fractional exponent") && Contains("TWOS_COMPLEMENT") && Contains("negative indices were not overriden") );
3672 }
3673 SECTION( "negative exponent" ) {
3674
3675 int numTerms = 3;
3676 qreal coeffs[] = {0,0,0};
3677 qreal expos[] = {1,2,3};
3678 expos[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTerms) )] = GENERATE( -1, -2 );
3679
3680 enum bitEncoding encoding = GENERATE( UNSIGNED, TWOS_COMPLEMENT );
3681
3682 // test both when giving no overrides, and giving all non-zero overrides
3683 int numOverrides = GENERATE( 0, 3 );
3684 long long int overrideInds[] = {1,2,3};
3685 qreal overridePhases[] = {0,0,0};
3686 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, encoding, coeffs, expos, numTerms, overrideInds, overridePhases, numOverrides), Contains("The phase function contained a negative exponent which would diverge at zero, but the zero index was not overriden") );
3687
3688 // but ensure that when the zero IS overriden (anywhere), there's no error
3689 numOverrides = 3;
3690 overrideInds[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numOverrides))] = 0;
3691 REQUIRE_NOTHROW( applyPhaseFuncOverrides(quregVec, qubits, numQubits, encoding, coeffs, expos, numTerms, overrideInds, overridePhases, numOverrides) );
3692 }
3693 }
3694 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
3695}
applyPhaseFuncOverrides
void applyPhaseFuncOverrides(Qureg qureg, int *qubits, int numQubits, enum bitEncoding encoding, qreal *coeffs, qreal *exponents, int numTerms, long long int *overrideInds, qreal *overridePhases, int numOverrides)
Induces a phase change upon each amplitude of qureg, determined by the passed exponential polynomial ...
Definition: QuEST.c:751

References applyPhaseFuncOverrides(), applyReferenceOp(), areEqual(), CLEANUP_TEST, expI(), getRandomInt(), getRandomReal(), getTwosComplement(), getZeroMatrix(), NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, qreal, sublists(), TWOS_COMPLEMENT, UNSIGNED, and VLA.

TEST_CASE ( "applyProjector"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also

Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 3703 of file test_operators.cpp.

3703 {
3704
3705 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
3706 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
3707
3708 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
3709
3710 int qubit = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
3711 int outcome = GENERATE( 0, 1 );
3712
3713 // repeat these random tests 10 times on every qubit, and for both outcomes
3714 GENERATE( range(0,10) );
3715
3716 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
3717
3718 SECTION( "normalised" ) {
3719
3720 // use a random L2 state for every qubit & outcome
3721 QVector vecRef = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
3722 toQureg(vec, vecRef);
3723
3724 // zero non-outcome reference amps
3725 for (size_t ind=0; ind<vecRef.size(); ind++) {
3726 int bit = (ind >> qubit) & 1; // target-th bit
3727 if (bit != outcome)
3728 vecRef[ind] = 0;
3729 }
3730
3731 applyProjector(vec, qubit, outcome);
3732 REQUIRE( areEqual(vec, vecRef) );
3733 }
3734 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
3735
3736 // use a random non-physical state for every qubit & outcome
3737 QVector vecRef = getRandomQVector(1 << NUM_QUBITS);
3738 toQureg(vec, vecRef);
3739
3740 // zero non-outcome reference amps
3741 for (size_t ind=0; ind<vecRef.size(); ind++) {
3742 int bit = (ind >> qubit) & 1; // target-th bit
3743 if (bit != outcome)
3744 vecRef[ind] = 0;
3745 }
3746
3747 applyProjector(vec, qubit, outcome);
3748 REQUIRE( areEqual(vec, vecRef) );
3749 }
3750 }
3751 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
3752
3753 SECTION( "pure" ) {
3754
3755 QVector vecRef = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
3756 QMatrix matRef = getPureDensityMatrix(vecRef);
3757
3758 toQureg(mat, matRef);
3759 applyProjector(mat, qubit, outcome);
3760
3761 // zero any amplitudes that aren't |outcome><outcome|
3762 for (size_t r=0; r<matRef.size(); r++) {
3763 for (size_t c=0; c<matRef.size(); c++) {
3764 int ketBit = (c >> qubit) & 1;
3765 int braBit = (r >> qubit) & 1;
3766 if (!(ketBit == outcome && braBit == outcome))
3767 matRef[r][c] = 0;
3768 }
3769 }
3770
3771 REQUIRE( areEqual(mat, matRef) );
3772 }
3773 SECTION( "mixed" ) {
3774
3775 QMatrix matRef = getRandomDensityMatrix(NUM_QUBITS);
3776
3777 toQureg(mat, matRef);
3778 applyProjector(mat, qubit, outcome);
3779
3780 // zero any amplitudes that aren't |outcome><outcome|
3781 for (size_t r=0; r<matRef.size(); r++) {
3782 for (size_t c=0; c<matRef.size(); c++) {
3783 int ketBit = (c >> qubit) & 1;
3784 int braBit = (r >> qubit) & 1;
3785 if (!(ketBit == outcome && braBit == outcome))
3786 matRef[r][c] = 0;
3787 }
3788 }
3789
3790 REQUIRE( areEqual(mat, matRef) );
3791 }
3792 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
3793
3794 QMatrix matRef = getRandomQMatrix(1 << NUM_QUBITS);
3795
3796 toQureg(mat, matRef);
3797 applyProjector(mat, qubit, outcome);
3798
3799 // zero any amplitudes that aren't |outcome><outcome|
3800 for (size_t r=0; r<matRef.size(); r++) {
3801 for (size_t c=0; c<matRef.size(); c++) {
3802 int ketBit = (c >> qubit) & 1;
3803 int braBit = (r >> qubit) & 1;
3804 if (!(ketBit == outcome && braBit == outcome))
3805 matRef[r][c] = 0;
3806 }
3807 }
3808
3809 REQUIRE( areEqual(mat, matRef) );
3810 }
3811 }
3812 }
3813 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
3814
3815 SECTION( "qubit index" ) {
3816
3817 int qubit = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
3818 int outcome = 0;
3819 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyProjector(mat, qubit, outcome), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
3820 }
3821 SECTION( "outcome value" ) {
3822
3823 int qubit = 0;
3824 int outcome = GENERATE( -1, 2 );
3825 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyProjector(mat, qubit, outcome), Contains("Invalid measurement outcome") );
3826 }
3827 }
3828 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
3829 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
3830}
applyProjector
void applyProjector(Qureg qureg, int qubit, int outcome)
Force the target qubit of qureg into the given classical outcome, via a non-renormalising projection.

QMatrix getRandomDensityMatrix(int numQb)
Returns a random numQb-by-numQb density matrix, from an undisclosed distribution, in a very mixed sta...

TEST_CASE ( "applyQFT"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also
applyQFT
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 3838 of file test_operators.cpp.

3838 {
3839
3840 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
3841
3842 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
3843
3844 // try every sub-register size
3845 int numQubits = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,NUM_QUBITS+1) );
3846
3847 // try every possible sub-register
3848 int* qubits = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numQubits) );
3849
3850 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
3851
3852 SECTION( "normalised" ) {
3853
3854 QVector refVec = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
3855 toQureg(quregVec, refVec);
3856
3857 applyQFT(quregVec, qubits, numQubits);
3858 refVec = getDFT(refVec, qubits, numQubits);
3859
3860 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
3861 }
3862 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
3863
3864 QVector refVec = getRandomQVector(1 << NUM_QUBITS);
3865 toQureg(quregVec, refVec);
3866
3867 applyQFT(quregVec, qubits, numQubits);
3868 refVec = getDFT(refVec, qubits, numQubits);
3869
3870 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
3871 }
3872 }
3873 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
3874
3875 SECTION( "pure" ) {
3876
3877 /* a pure density matrix should be mapped to a pure state
3878 * corresponding to the state-vector DFT
3879 */
3880
3881 refVec = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
3882 refMatr = getPureDensityMatrix(refVec);
3883 toQureg(quregMatr, refMatr);
3884
3885 applyQFT(quregMatr, qubits, numQubits);
3886 refVec = getDFT(refVec, qubits, numQubits);
3887 refMatr = getPureDensityMatrix(refVec);
3888
3889 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr) );
3890 }
3891 SECTION( "mixed" ) {
3892
3893 /* a mixed density matrix, conceptualised as a mixture of orthogonal
3894 * state-vectors, should be mapped to an equally weighted mixture
3895 * of DFTs of each state-vector (because QFT is unitary and hence
3896 * maintains state orthogonality)
3897 */
3898
3899 int numStates = (1 << NUM_QUBITS)/4; // a quarter of as many states as are possible
3900 std::vector<QVector> states = getRandomOrthonormalVectors(NUM_QUBITS, numStates);
3901 std::vector<qreal> probs = getRandomProbabilities(numStates);
3902
3903 // set qureg to random mixture of state-vectors
3904 refMatr = getMixedDensityMatrix(probs, states);
3905 toQureg(quregMatr, refMatr);
3906
3907 // apply QFT to mixture
3908 applyQFT(quregMatr, qubits, numQubits);
3909
3910 // compute dft of mixture, via dft of each state
3911 refMatr = getZeroMatrix(1 << NUM_QUBITS);
3912 for (int i=0; i<numStates; i++) {
3913 QVector dft = getDFT(states[i], qubits, numQubits);
3914 refMatr += probs[i] * getPureDensityMatrix(dft);
3915 }
3916
3917 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr) );
3918 }
3919 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
3920
3921 /* repeat method above, except that we use unnormalised vectors,
3922 * and mix them with arbitrary complex numbers instead of probabilities,
3923 * yielding an unnormalised density matrix
3924 */
3925
3926 int numVecs = (1 << NUM_QUBITS)/4; // a quarter of as many states as are possible
3927 std::vector<QVector> vecs;
3928 std::vector<qcomp> coeffs;
3929 for (int i=0; i<numVecs; i++) {
3930 vecs.push_back(getRandomQVector(1 << NUM_QUBITS));
3931 coeffs.push_back(getRandomComplex());
3932 }
3933
3934 // produce unnormalised matrix via random complex sum of random unnormalised vectors
3935 refMatr = getZeroMatrix(1 << NUM_QUBITS);
3936 for (int i=0; i<numVecs; i++)
3937 refMatr += coeffs[i] * getPureDensityMatrix(vecs[i]);
3938
3939 toQureg(quregMatr, refMatr);
3940 applyQFT(quregMatr, qubits, numQubits);
3941
3942 // compute target matrix via dft of each unnormalised vector
3943 refMatr = getZeroMatrix(1 << NUM_QUBITS);
3944 for (int i=0; i<numVecs; i++) {
3945 QVector dft = getDFT(vecs[i], qubits, numQubits);
3946 refMatr += coeffs[i] * getPureDensityMatrix(dft);
3947 }
3948
3949 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr) );
3950 }
3951 }
3952 }
3953 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
3954
3955 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
3956
3957 // there cannot be more targets than qubits in register
3958 int numQubits = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
3959 int qubits[NUM_QUBITS+1];
3960
3961 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyQFT(quregVec, qubits, numQubits), Contains("Invalid number of target"));
3962 }
3963 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
3964
3965 int numQubits = 3;
3966 int qubits[] = {1,2,2};
3967
3968 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyQFT(quregVec, qubits, numQubits), Contains("target") && Contains("unique"));
3969 }
3970 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
3971
3972 int numQubits = 3;
3973 int qubits[] = {1,2,3};
3974
3975 int inv = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
3976 qubits[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numQubits) )] = inv; // make invalid target
3977 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyQFT(quregVec, qubits, numQubits), Contains("Invalid target") );
3978 }
3979 }
3980 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
3981}
applyQFT
void applyQFT(Qureg qureg, int *qubits, int numQubits)
Applies the quantum Fourier transform (QFT) to a specific subset of qubits of the register qureg.
Definition: QuEST.c:874

References applyQFT(), areEqual(), CLEANUP_TEST, getDFT(), getMixedDensityMatrix(), getPureDensityMatrix(), getRandomComplex(), getRandomOrthonormalVectors(), getRandomProbabilities(), getRandomQVector(), getRandomStateVector(), getZeroMatrix(), NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, sublists(), and toQureg().

◆ TEST_CASE() [22/136]

TEST_CASE ( "applySubDiagonalOp"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
applySubDiagonalOp
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 3989 of file test_operators.cpp.

3989 {
3990
3991 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
3992
3993 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
3994
3995 // generate all possible targets
3996 int numTargs = GENERATE( range(1,NUM_QUBITS+1) );
3997 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
3998
3999 // initialise a random non-unitary diagonal op
4000 SubDiagonalOp op = createSubDiagonalOp(numTargs);
4001 for (long long int i=0; i<op.numElems; i++) {
4002 op.real[i] = getRandomReal(-10,10);
4003 op.imag[i] = getRandomReal(-10,10);
4004 }
4005 QMatrix opMatr = toQMatrix(op);
4006
4007 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
4008
4009 applySubDiagonalOp(quregVec, targs, numTargs, op);
4010 applyReferenceMatrix(refVec, targs, numTargs, opMatr);
4011 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
4012 }
4013 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
4014
4015 applySubDiagonalOp(quregMatr, targs, numTargs, op);
4016 applyReferenceMatrix(refMatr, targs, numTargs, opMatr);
4017 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 100*REAL_EPS) );
4018 }
4019
4020 destroySubDiagonalOp(op);
4021 }
4022 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
4023
4024 SECTION( "diagonal dimension" ) {
4025
4026 int numTargs = 3;
4027 SubDiagonalOp op = createSubDiagonalOp(numTargs);
4028
4029 int badNumTargs = GENERATE_COPY( numTargs-1, numTargs+1 );
4030 int badTargs[NUM_QUBITS+1];
4031
4032 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applySubDiagonalOp(quregVec, badTargs, badNumTargs, op), Contains("incompatible dimension") );
4033 destroySubDiagonalOp(op);
4034 }
4035 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
4036
4037 // make too many targets (which are otherwise valid)
4038 SubDiagonalOp badOp = createSubDiagonalOp(NUM_QUBITS + 1);
4039 int targs[NUM_QUBITS + 1];
4040 for (int t=0; t<badOp.numQubits; t++)
4041 targs[t] = t;
4042 for (int i=0; i<badOp.numElems; i++)
4043 badOp.real[i] = 1;
4044
4045 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applySubDiagonalOp(quregVec, targs, badOp.numQubits, badOp), Contains("Invalid number of target qubits") );
4046 destroySubDiagonalOp(badOp);
4047 }
4048 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
4049
4050 // make a valid unitary diagonal op
4051 SubDiagonalOp op = createSubDiagonalOp(3);
4052 for (int i=0; i<op.numElems; i++)
4053 op.real[i] = 1;
4054
4055 // make a repetition in the target list
4056 int targs[] = {2,1,2};
4057
4058 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applySubDiagonalOp(quregVec, targs, op.numQubits, op), Contains("target qubits must be unique") );
4059 destroySubDiagonalOp(op);
4060 }
4061 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
4062
4063 // make a valid unitary diagonal op
4064 SubDiagonalOp op = createSubDiagonalOp(3);
4065 for (int i=0; i<op.numElems; i++)
4066 op.real[i] = 1;
4067
4068 int targs[] = {0,1,2};
4069
4070 // make each target in-turn invalid
4071 int badIndex = GENERATE( range(0,3) );
4072 int badValue = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
4073 targs[badIndex] = badValue;
4074
4075 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applySubDiagonalOp(quregVec, targs, op.numQubits, op), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
4076 destroySubDiagonalOp(op);
4077 }
4078 }
4079 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
4080}
applySubDiagonalOp
void applySubDiagonalOp(Qureg qureg, int *qubits, int numQubits, SubDiagonalOp op)
Left-apply a many-qubit a diagonal matrix upon a specific set of qubits of a quantum register.
Definition: QuEST.c:1206

References applyReferenceMatrix(), applySubDiagonalOp(), areEqual(), createSubDiagonalOp(), destroySubDiagonalOp(), getRandomReal(), SubDiagonalOp::imag, NUM_QUBITS, SubDiagonalOp::numElems, SubDiagonalOp::numQubits, PREPARE_TEST, SubDiagonalOp::real, sublists(), and toQMatrix().

◆ TEST_CASE() [23/136]

TEST_CASE ( "applyTrotterCircuit"  ,
""  [operators] 
)
See also
applyTrotterCircuit
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 4088 of file test_operators.cpp.

4088 {
4089
4090 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
4091 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
4092 initDebugState(vec);
4093 initDebugState(mat);
4094
4095 Qureg vecRef = createCloneQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
4096 Qureg matRef = createCloneQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
4097
4098 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
4099
4100 SECTION( "one term" ) {
4101
4102 // a Hamiltonian with one term has an exact (trivial) Trotterisation
4103 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS, 1);
4104
4105 // H = coeff X Y Z (on qubits 0,1,2)
4106 qreal coeff = getRandomReal(-5, 5);
4107 int numTargs = 3;
4108 int targs[] = {0, 1, 2};
4109 pauliOpType codes[] = {PAULI_X, PAULI_Y, PAULI_Z};
4110 hamil.termCoeffs[0] = coeff;
4111 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++)
4112 hamil.pauliCodes[targs[i]] = codes[i];
4113
4114 // time can be negative
4115 qreal time = getRandomReal(-2,2);
4116
4117 // by commutation, all reps & orders yield the same total unitary
4118 int reps = GENERATE( range(1,5) );
4119
4120 // applyTrotter(t, 1, 1) = exp(-i t coeff paulis)
4121 // multiRotatePauli(a) = exp(- i a / 2 paulis)
4122
4123 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
4124
4125 int order = GENERATE( 1, 2, 4 );
4126
4127 applyTrotterCircuit(vec, hamil, time, order, reps);
4128 multiRotatePauli(vecRef, targs, codes, numTargs, 2*time*coeff);
4129 REQUIRE( areEqual(vec, vecRef, 10*REAL_EPS) );
4130 }
4131 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
4132
4133 int order = GENERATE( 1, 2 ); // precision bites density-matrices quickly
4134
4135 applyTrotterCircuit(mat, hamil, time, order, reps);
4136 multiRotatePauli(matRef, targs, codes, numTargs, 2*time*coeff);
4137 REQUIRE( areEqual(mat, matRef, 1E2*REAL_EPS) );
4138 }
4139
4140 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
4141 }
4142 SECTION( "commuting terms" ) {
4143
4144 // a Hamiltonian of commuting terms, Trotterises exactly
4145 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS, 2);
4146
4147 // H = c0 X Y I + c1 X I Z (on qubits 0,1,2)
4148 int targs[] = {0, 1, 2};
4149 hamil.pauliCodes[0] = PAULI_X;
4150 hamil.pauliCodes[0 + NUM_QUBITS] = PAULI_X;
4151 hamil.pauliCodes[1] = PAULI_Y;
4152 hamil.pauliCodes[1 + NUM_QUBITS] = PAULI_I;
4153 hamil.pauliCodes[2] = PAULI_I;
4154 hamil.pauliCodes[2 + NUM_QUBITS] = PAULI_Z;
4155 for (int i=0; i<hamil.numSumTerms; i++)
4156 hamil.termCoeffs[i] = getRandomReal(-5,5);
4157
4158 // time can be negative
4159 qreal time = getRandomReal(-2,2);
4160
4161 // applyTrotter(t, 1, 1) = exp(-i t c0 paulis0) exp(-i t c1 paulis1)
4162 // multiRotatePauli(a) = exp(- i a / 2 paulis)
4163
4164 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
4165
4166 int reps = GENERATE( range(1,5) );
4167 int order = GENERATE( 1, 2, 4 );
4168
4169 applyTrotterCircuit(vec, hamil, time, order, reps);
4170 multiRotatePauli(vecRef, targs, hamil.pauliCodes, 3, 2*time*hamil.termCoeffs[0]);
4171 multiRotatePauli(vecRef, targs, &(hamil.pauliCodes[NUM_QUBITS]), 3, 2*time*hamil.termCoeffs[1]);
4172 REQUIRE( areEqual(vec, vecRef, 10*REAL_EPS) );
4173 }
4174 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
4175
4176 int reps = GENERATE( range(1,5) );
4177 int order = GENERATE( 1, 2 ); // precision hurts density matrices quickly
4178
4179 applyTrotterCircuit(mat, hamil, time, order, reps);
4180 multiRotatePauli(matRef, targs, hamil.pauliCodes, 3, 2*time*hamil.termCoeffs[0]);
4181 multiRotatePauli(matRef, targs, &(hamil.pauliCodes[NUM_QUBITS]), 3, 2*time*hamil.termCoeffs[1]);
4182 REQUIRE( areEqual(mat, matRef, 1E2*REAL_EPS) );
4183 }
4184
4185 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
4186 }
4187 SECTION( "general" ) {
4188
4189 /* We'll consider an analytic time-evolved state, so that we can avoid
4190 * comparing applyTrotterCircuit to other numerical approximations.
4191 * We can construct such a state, by using a Hamiltonian with known
4192 * analytic eigenvalues, and hence a known period. Time evolution of the
4193 * period will just yield the input state.
4194 *
4195 * E.g. H = pi sqrt(2) X Y Z X Y + pi Y Z X Y Z + pi Z X Y Z X
4196 * has (degenerate) eigenvalues +- 2 pi, so the period
4197 * of the Hamiltonian is t=1.
4198 */
4199
4200 // hardcoded 5 qubits here in the Pauli codes
4201 REQUIRE( NUM_QUBITS == 5 );
4202
4203 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS, 3);
4204 qreal coeffs[] = {(qreal) (M_PI * sqrt(2.0)), M_PI, M_PI};
4205 enum pauliOpType codes[] = {
4206 PAULI_X, PAULI_Y, PAULI_Z, PAULI_X, PAULI_Y,
4207 PAULI_Y, PAULI_Z, PAULI_X, PAULI_Y, PAULI_Z,
4208 PAULI_Z, PAULI_X, PAULI_Y, PAULI_Z, PAULI_X};
4209 initPauliHamil(hamil, coeffs, codes);
4210
4211 // evolving to t=1 should leave the input state unchanged
4212 qreal time = 1;
4213
4214 // since unnormalised (initDebugState), max fid is 728359.8336
4215 qreal fidNorm = 728359.8336;
4216
4217 SECTION( "absolute" ) {
4218
4219 // such a high order and reps should yield precise solution
4220 int order = 4;
4221 int reps = 20;
4222 applyTrotterCircuit(vec, hamil, time, 4, 20);
4223 qreal fid = calcFidelity(vec, vecRef) / fidNorm;
4224
4225 REQUIRE( fid == Approx(1).epsilon(1E-8) );
4226 }
4227 SECTION( "repetitions scaling" ) {
4228
4229 // exclude order 1; too few reps for monotonic increase of accuracy
4230 int order = GENERATE( 2, 4, 6 );
4231
4232 // accuracy should increase with increasing repetitions
4233 int reps[] = {1, 5, 10};
4234
4235 qreal prevFid = 0;
4236 for (int i=0; i<3; i++) {
4237 initDebugState(vec);
4238 applyTrotterCircuit(vec, hamil, time, order, reps[i]);
4239 qreal fid = calcFidelity(vec, vecRef) / fidNorm;
4240
4241 REQUIRE( fid >= prevFid );
4242 prevFid = fid;
4243 }
4244 }
4245 SECTION( "order scaling" ) {
4246
4247 // exclude order 1; too few reps for monotonic increase of accuracy
4248 int reps = GENERATE( 5, 10 );
4249
4250 // accuracy should increase with increasing repetitions
4251 int orders[] = {1, 2, 4, 6};
4252
4253 qreal prevFid = 0;
4254 for (int i=0; i<4; i++) {
4255 initDebugState(vec);
4256 applyTrotterCircuit(vec, hamil, time, orders[i], reps);
4257 qreal fid = calcFidelity(vec, vecRef) / fidNorm;
4258
4259 REQUIRE( fid >= prevFid );
4260 prevFid = fid;
4261 }
4262 }
4263
4264 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
4265 }
4266 }
4267 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
4268
4269 SECTION( "repetitions" ) {
4270
4271 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS, 1);
4272 int reps = GENERATE( -1, 0 );
4273
4274 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyTrotterCircuit(vec, hamil, 1, 1, reps), Contains("repetitions must be >=1") );
4275
4276 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
4277 }
4278 SECTION( "order" ) {
4279
4280 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS, 1);
4281 int order = GENERATE( -1, 0, 3, 5, 7 );
4282
4283 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyTrotterCircuit(vec, hamil, 1, order, 1), Contains("order must be 1, or an even number") );
4284
4285 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
4286 }
4287 SECTION( "pauli codes" ) {
4288
4289 int numTerms = 3;
4290 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS, numTerms);
4291
4292 // make one pauli code wrong
4293 hamil.pauliCodes[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTerms*NUM_QUBITS) )] = (pauliOpType) GENERATE( -1, 4 );
4294 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyTrotterCircuit(vec, hamil, 1, 1, 1), Contains("Invalid Pauli code") );
4295
4296 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
4297 }
4298 SECTION( "matching hamiltonian qubits" ) {
4299
4300 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS + 1, 1);
4301
4302 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyTrotterCircuit(vec, hamil, 1, 1, 1), Contains("same number of qubits") );
4303 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( applyTrotterCircuit(mat, hamil, 1, 1, 1), Contains("same number of qubits") );
4304
4305 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
4306 }
4307 }
4308
4309 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
4310 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
4311 destroyQureg(vecRef, QUEST_ENV);
4312 destroyQureg(matRef, QUEST_ENV);
4313}

TEST_CASE ( "calcDensityInnerProduct"  ,
""  [calculations] 
)
See also
calcDensityInnerProduct
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 15 of file test_calculations.cpp.

15 {
16
17 Qureg mat1 = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
18 Qureg mat2 = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
19
20 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
21
22 // repeat these random tests 10 times
23 GENERATE( range(0,10) );
24
25 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
26
27 SECTION( "pure" ) {
28
29 // mat1 = |r1><r1|
30 QVector r1 = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
31 toQureg(mat1, getKetBra(r1,r1));
32
33 // mat2 = |r2><r2|
34 QVector r2 = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
35 toQureg(mat2, getKetBra(r2,r2));
36
37 // prod( |r1><r1|, |r2><r2| ) = |<r1|r2>|^2
38 qcomp prod = 0;
39 for (size_t i=0; i<r1.size(); i++)
40 prod += conj(r1[i]) * r2[i];
41 qreal densProd = pow(abs(prod),2);
42
43 REQUIRE( calcDensityInnerProduct(mat1,mat2) == Approx(densProd) );
44 }
45 SECTION( "mixed" ) {
46
47 QMatrix ref1 = getRandomDensityMatrix(NUM_QUBITS);
48 QMatrix ref2 = getRandomDensityMatrix(NUM_QUBITS);
49 toQureg(mat1, ref1);
50 toQureg(mat2, ref2);
51
52 // prod(mat1, mat2) = sum_{ij} conj(mat1_{ij}) * mat2_{ij}
53 qcomp refProd = 0;
54 for (size_t i=0; i<ref1.size(); i++)
55 for (size_t j=0; j<ref1.size(); j++)
56 refProd += conj(ref1[i][j]) * ref2[i][j];
57 REQUIRE( imag(refProd) == Approx(0).margin(REAL_EPS) );
58
59 REQUIRE( calcDensityInnerProduct(mat1,mat2) == Approx(real(refProd)) );
60
61 // should be invariant under ordering
62 REQUIRE( calcDensityInnerProduct(mat1,mat2) == Approx(calcDensityInnerProduct(mat2,mat1)) );
63 }
64 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
65
66 // set both to random (non-Hermitian) complex matrices
67 QMatrix ref1 = getRandomQMatrix(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
68 QMatrix ref2 = getRandomQMatrix(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
69 toQureg(mat1, ref1);
70 toQureg(mat2, ref2);
71
72 // prod(mat1, mat2) = real(sum_{ij} conj(mat1_{ij}) * mat2_{ij})
73 qcomp refProd = 0;
74 for (size_t i=0; i<ref1.size(); i++)
75 for (size_t j=0; j<ref1.size(); j++)
76 refProd += conj(ref1[i][j]) * ref2[i][j];
77
78 REQUIRE( calcDensityInnerProduct(mat1,mat2) == Approx(real(refProd)) );
79 }
80 }
81 }
82 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
83
84 SECTION( "dimensions" ) {
85
86 Qureg mat3 = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS + 1, QUEST_ENV);
87 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcDensityInnerProduct(mat1,mat3), Contains("Dimensions") && Contains("don't match") );
88 destroyQureg(mat3, QUEST_ENV);
89 }
90 SECTION( "state-vectors" ) {
91
92 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
93
94 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcDensityInnerProduct(mat1,vec), Contains("valid only for density matrices") );
95 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcDensityInnerProduct(vec,mat1), Contains("valid only for density matrices") );
96 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcDensityInnerProduct(vec,vec), Contains("valid only for density matrices") );
97
98 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
99 }
100 }
101 destroyQureg(mat1, QUEST_ENV);
102 destroyQureg(mat2, QUEST_ENV);
103}

TEST_CASE ( "calcExpecDiagonalOp"  ,
""  [calculations] 
)
See also
calcExpecDiagonalOp
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 111 of file test_calculations.cpp.

111 {
112
113 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
114 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
115 initDebugState(vec);
116 initDebugState(mat);
117 QVector vecRef = toQVector(vec);
118 QMatrix matRef = toQMatrix(mat);
119
120 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
121
122 // try 10 random operators
123 GENERATE( range(0,10) );
124
125 // make a totally random (non-Hermitian) diagonal oeprator
126 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOp(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
127 for (long long int i=0; i<op.numElemsPerChunk; i++) {
128 op.real[i] = getRandomReal(-5, 5);
129 op.imag[i] = getRandomReal(-5, 5);
130 }
131 syncDiagonalOp(op);
132
133 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
134
135 /* calcExpecDiagOp calculates <qureg|diag|qureg> */
136
137 QVector sumRef = toQMatrix(op) * vecRef;
138 qcomp prod = 0;
139 for (size_t i=0; i<vecRef.size(); i++)
140 prod += conj(vecRef[i]) * sumRef[i];
141
142 Complex res = calcExpecDiagonalOp(vec, op);
143 REQUIRE( res.real == Approx(real(prod)).margin(REAL_EPS) );
144 REQUIRE( res.imag == Approx(imag(prod)).margin(REAL_EPS) );
145 }
146 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
147
148 /* calcExpecDiagOp calculates Trace( diag * qureg ) */
149 matRef = toQMatrix(op) * matRef;
150 qcomp tr = 0;
151 for (size_t i=0; i<matRef.size(); i++)
152 tr += matRef[i][i];
153
154 Complex res = calcExpecDiagonalOp(mat, op);
155 REQUIRE( res.real == Approx(real(tr)).margin(100*REAL_EPS) );
156 REQUIRE( res.imag == Approx(imag(tr)).margin(100*REAL_EPS) );
157 }
158
159 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
160 }
161 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
162
163 SECTION( "mismatching size" ) {
164
165 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOp(NUM_QUBITS + 1, QUEST_ENV);
166
167 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecDiagonalOp(vec, op), Contains("equal number of qubits"));
168 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecDiagonalOp(mat, op), Contains("equal number of qubits"));
169
170 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
171 }
172 }
173 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
174 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
175}
calcExpecDiagonalOp
Complex calcExpecDiagonalOp(Qureg qureg, DiagonalOp op)
Computes the expected value of the diagonal operator op for state qureg.
Definition: QuEST.c:1324
Complex
Represents one complex number.

Definition: QuEST.h:106

◆ TEST_CASE() [26/136]

TEST_CASE ( "calcExpecPauliHamil"  ,
""  [calculations] 
)
See also
calcExpecPauliHamil
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 183 of file test_calculations.cpp.

183 {
184
185 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
186 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
187 initDebugState(vec);
188 initDebugState(mat);
189 QVector vecRef = toQVector(vec);
190 QMatrix matRef = toQMatrix(mat);
191
192 Qureg vecWork = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
193 Qureg matWork = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
194
195 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
196
197 /* it's too expensive to try every possible Pauli configuration, so
198 * we'll try 10 random codes, and for each, random coefficients
199 */
200 GENERATE( range(0,10) );
201
202 int numTerms = GENERATE( 1, 2, 10, 15 );
203 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS, numTerms);
204 setRandomPauliSum(hamil);
205 QMatrix refHamil = toQMatrix(hamil);
206
207 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
208
209 /* calcExpecPauliHamil calculates <qureg|pauliHum|qureg> */
210
211 QVector sumRef = refHamil * vecRef;
212 qcomp prod = 0;
213 for (size_t i=0; i<vecRef.size(); i++)
214 prod += conj(vecRef[i]) * sumRef[i];
215 REQUIRE( imag(prod) == Approx(0).margin(10*REAL_EPS) );
216
217 qreal res = calcExpecPauliHamil(vec, hamil, vecWork);
218 REQUIRE( res == Approx(real(prod)).margin(10*REAL_EPS) );
219 }
220 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
221
222 /* calcExpecPauliHamil calculates Trace( pauliHamil * qureg ) */
223 matRef = refHamil * matRef;
224 qreal tr = 0;
225 for (size_t i=0; i<matRef.size(); i++)
226 tr += real(matRef[i][i]);
227 // (get real, since we start in a non-Hermitian state, hence diagonal isn't real)
228
229 qreal res = calcExpecPauliHamil(mat, hamil, matWork);
230 REQUIRE( res == Approx(tr).margin(1E2*REAL_EPS) );
231 }
232
233 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
234 }
235 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
236
237 SECTION( "pauli codes" ) {
238
239 int numTerms = 3;
240 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS, numTerms);
241
242 // make one pauli code wrong
243 hamil.pauliCodes[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTerms*NUM_QUBITS) )] = (pauliOpType) GENERATE( -1, 4 );
244 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliHamil(vec, hamil, vecWork), Contains("Invalid Pauli code") );
245
246 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
247 }
248 SECTION( "workspace type" ) {
249
250 int numTerms = 1;
251 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS, numTerms);
252
253 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliHamil(vec, hamil, mat), Contains("Registers must both be state-vectors or both be density matrices") );
254 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliHamil(mat, hamil, vec), Contains("Registers must both be state-vectors or both be density matrices") );
255
256 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
257 }
258 SECTION( "workspace dimensions" ) {
259
260 int numTerms = 1;
261 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS, numTerms);
262
263 Qureg vec2 = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS + 1, QUEST_ENV);
264 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliHamil(vec, hamil, vec2), Contains("Dimensions") && Contains("don't match") );
265 destroyQureg(vec2, QUEST_ENV);
266
267 Qureg mat2 = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS + 1, QUEST_ENV);
268 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliHamil(mat, hamil, mat2), Contains("Dimensions") && Contains("don't match") );
269 destroyQureg(mat2, QUEST_ENV);
270
271 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
272 }
273 SECTION( "matching hamiltonian qubits" ) {
274
275 int numTerms = 1;
276 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS + 1, numTerms);
277
278 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliHamil(vec, hamil, vecWork), Contains("same number of qubits") );
279 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliHamil(mat, hamil, matWork), Contains("same number of qubits") );
280
281 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
282 }
283 }
284 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
285 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
286 destroyQureg(vecWork, QUEST_ENV);
287 destroyQureg(matWork, QUEST_ENV);
288}
calcExpecPauliHamil
qreal calcExpecPauliHamil(Qureg qureg, PauliHamil hamil, Qureg workspace)
Computes the expected value of qureg under Hermitian operator hamil.
Definition: QuEST.c:1315

References calcExpecPauliHamil(), createDensityQureg(), createPauliHamil(), createQureg(), destroyPauliHamil(), destroyQureg(), initDebugState(), NUM_QUBITS, PauliHamil::pauliCodes, qcomp, qreal, QUEST_ENV, setRandomPauliSum(), toQMatrix(), and toQVector().

◆ TEST_CASE() [27/136]

TEST_CASE ( "calcExpecPauliProd"  ,
""  [calculations] 
)
See also
calcExpecPauliProd
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 296 of file test_calculations.cpp.

296 {
297
298 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
299 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
300 initDebugState(vec);
301 initDebugState(mat);
302 QVector vecRef = toQVector(vec);
303 QMatrix matRef = toQMatrix(mat);
304
305 Qureg vecWork = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
306 Qureg matWork = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
307
308 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
309
310 int numTargs = GENERATE( range(1,NUM_QUBITS+1) );
311 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
312
313 /* it's too expensive to try ALL Pauli sequences, via
314 * pauliOpType* paulis = GENERATE_COPY( pauliseqs(numTargs) );.
315 * Furthermore, take(10, pauliseqs(numTargs)) will try the same pauli codes.
316 * Hence, we instead opt to repeatedlyrandomly generate pauliseqs
317 */
318 GENERATE( range(0,10) ); // gen 10 random pauli-codes for every targs
319 VLA(pauliOpType, paulis, numTargs);
320 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++)
321 paulis[i] = (pauliOpType) getRandomInt(0,4);
322
323 // produce a numTargs-big matrix 'pauliProd' by pauli-matrix tensoring
324 QMatrix iMatr{{1,0},{0,1}};
325 QMatrix xMatr{{0,1},{1,0}};
326 QMatrix yMatr{{0,-qcomp(0,1)},{qcomp(0,1),0}};
327 QMatrix zMatr{{1,0},{0,-1}};
328 QMatrix pauliProd{{1}};
329 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++) {
330 QMatrix fac;
331 if (paulis[i] == PAULI_I) fac = iMatr;
332 if (paulis[i] == PAULI_X) fac = xMatr;
333 if (paulis[i] == PAULI_Y) fac = yMatr;
334 if (paulis[i] == PAULI_Z) fac = zMatr;
335 pauliProd = getKroneckerProduct(fac, pauliProd);
336 }
337
338 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
339
340 /* calcExpecPauliProd calculates <qureg|pauliProd|qureg> */
341
342 QVector prodRef = vecRef;
343 applyReferenceOp(prodRef, targs, numTargs, pauliProd);
344 qcomp prod = 0;
345 for (size_t i=0; i<vecRef.size(); i++)
346 prod += conj(vecRef[i]) * prodRef[i];
347 REQUIRE( imag(prod) == Approx(0).margin(REAL_EPS) );
348
349 qreal res = calcExpecPauliProd(vec, targs, paulis, numTargs, vecWork);
350 REQUIRE( res == Approx(real(prod)).margin(REAL_EPS) );
351 }
352 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
353
354 /* calcExpecPauliProd calculates Trace( pauliProd * qureg ) */
355
356 // produce (pauliProd * mat)
357 QMatrix fullOp = getFullOperatorMatrix(NULL, 0, targs, numTargs, pauliProd, NUM_QUBITS);
358 matRef = fullOp * matRef;
359
360 // compute real(trace(pauliProd * mat))
361 qreal tr = 0;
362 for (size_t i=0; i<matRef.size(); i++)
363 tr += real(matRef[i][i]);
364 // (get real, since we start in a non-Hermitian state, hence diagonal isn't real)
365
366 qreal res = calcExpecPauliProd(mat, targs, paulis, numTargs, matWork);
367 REQUIRE( res == Approx(tr).margin(10*REAL_EPS) );
368 }
369 }
370 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
371
372 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
373
374 int numTargs = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
375 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliProd(vec, NULL, NULL, numTargs, vecWork), Contains("Invalid number of target") );
376 }
377 SECTION( "target indices" ) {
378
379 int numTargs = 3;
380 int targs[3] = {0, 1, 2};
381
382 // make one index wrong
383 targs[GENERATE( range(0,3) )] = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
384 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliProd(vec, targs, NULL, numTargs, vecWork), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
385 }
386 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
387
388 int numTargs = 3;
389 int targs[3] = {0, 1, 1};
390 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliProd(vec, targs, NULL, numTargs, vecWork), Contains("target qubits must be unique") );
391 }
392 SECTION( "pauli codes" ) {
393
394 int numTargs = 3;
395 int targs[3] = {0, 1, 2};
396 pauliOpType codes[3] = {PAULI_X, PAULI_Y, PAULI_Z};
397
398 // make one pauli wrong
399 codes[GENERATE( range(0,3) )] = (pauliOpType) GENERATE( -1, 4 );
400 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliProd(vec, targs, codes, numTargs, vecWork), Contains("Invalid Pauli code") );
401 }
402 SECTION( "workspace type" ) {
403
404 int numTargs = 1;
405 int targs[1] = {0};
406 pauliOpType codes[1] = {PAULI_I};
407
408 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliProd(vec, targs, codes, numTargs, matWork), Contains("Registers must both be state-vectors or both be density matrices") );
409 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliProd(mat, targs, codes, numTargs, vecWork), Contains("Registers must both be state-vectors or both be density matrices") );
410 }
411 SECTION( "workspace dimensions" ) {
412
413 int numTargs = 1;
414 int targs[1] = {0};
415 pauliOpType codes[1] = {PAULI_I};
416
417 Qureg vec2 = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS + 1, QUEST_ENV);
418 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliProd(vec, targs, codes, numTargs, vec2), Contains("Dimensions") && Contains("don't match") );
419 destroyQureg(vec2, QUEST_ENV);
420
421 Qureg mat2 = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS + 1, QUEST_ENV);
422 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliProd(mat, targs, codes, numTargs, mat2), Contains("Dimensions") && Contains("don't match") );
423 destroyQureg(mat2, QUEST_ENV);
424 }
425 }
426 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
427 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
428 destroyQureg(vecWork, QUEST_ENV);
429 destroyQureg(matWork, QUEST_ENV);
430}

QMatrix getFullOperatorMatrix(int *ctrls, int numCtrls, int *targs, int numTargs, QMatrix op, int numQubits)
Takes a 2^numTargs-by-2^numTargs matrix op and a returns a 2^numQubits-by-2^numQubits matrix where op...

References applyReferenceOp(), calcExpecPauliProd(), createDensityQureg(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), getFullOperatorMatrix(), getKroneckerProduct(), getRandomInt(), initDebugState(), NUM_QUBITS, PAULI_I, PAULI_X, PAULI_Y, PAULI_Z, qcomp, qreal, QUEST_ENV, sublists(), toQMatrix(), toQVector(), and VLA.

TEST_CASE ( "calcExpecPauliSum"  ,
""  [calculations] 
)
See also
calcExpecPauliSum
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 438 of file test_calculations.cpp.

438 {
439
440 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
441 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
442 initDebugState(vec);
443 initDebugState(mat);
444 QVector vecRef = toQVector(vec);
445 QMatrix matRef = toQMatrix(mat);
446
447 Qureg vecWork = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
448 Qureg matWork = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
449
450 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
451
452 int numSumTerms = GENERATE( 1, 2, 10, 15 );
453
454 /* it's too expensive to try every possible Pauli configuration, so
455 * we'll try 10 random codes, and for each, random coefficients
456 */
457 GENERATE( range(0,10) );
458 int totNumCodes = numSumTerms*NUM_QUBITS;
459 VLA(pauliOpType, paulis, totNumCodes);
460 VLA(qreal, coeffs, numSumTerms);
461 setRandomPauliSum(coeffs, paulis, NUM_QUBITS, numSumTerms);
462
463 // produce a numTargs-big matrix 'pauliSum' by pauli-matrix tensoring and summing
464 QMatrix pauliSum = toQMatrix(coeffs, paulis, NUM_QUBITS, numSumTerms);
465
466 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
467
468 /* calcExpecPauliSum calculates <qureg|pauliSum|qureg> */
469
470 QVector sumRef = pauliSum * vecRef;
471 qcomp prod = 0;
472 for (size_t i=0; i<vecRef.size(); i++)
473 prod += conj(vecRef[i]) * sumRef[i];
474 REQUIRE( imag(prod) == Approx(0).margin(10*REAL_EPS) );
475
476 qreal res = calcExpecPauliSum(vec, paulis, coeffs, numSumTerms, vecWork);
477 REQUIRE( res == Approx(real(prod)).margin(10*REAL_EPS) );
478 }
479 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
480
481 /* calcExpecPauliSum calculates Trace( pauliSum * qureg ) */
482 matRef = pauliSum * matRef;
483 qreal tr = 0;
484 for (size_t i=0; i<matRef.size(); i++)
485 tr += real(matRef[i][i]);
486 // (get real, since we start in a non-Hermitian state, hence diagonal isn't real)
487
488 qreal res = calcExpecPauliSum(mat, paulis, coeffs, numSumTerms, matWork);
489 REQUIRE( res == Approx(tr).margin(1E2*REAL_EPS) );
490 }
491 }
492 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
493
494 SECTION( "number of sum terms" ) {
495
496 int numSumTerms = GENERATE( -1, 0 );
497 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliSum(vec, NULL, NULL, numSumTerms, vecWork), Contains("Invalid number of terms in the Pauli sum") );
498 }
499 SECTION( "pauli codes" ) {
500
501 // make valid params
502 int numSumTerms = 3;
503 VLA(qreal, coeffs, numSumTerms);
504 VLA(pauliOpType, codes, numSumTerms*NUM_QUBITS);
505 for (int i=0; i<numSumTerms*NUM_QUBITS; i++)
506 codes[i] = PAULI_I;
507
508 // make one pauli wrong
509 codes[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numSumTerms*NUM_QUBITS) )] = (pauliOpType) GENERATE( -1, 4 );
510 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliSum(vec, codes, coeffs, numSumTerms, vecWork), Contains("Invalid Pauli code") );
511 }
512 SECTION( "workspace type" ) {
513
514 // make valid params
515 int numSumTerms = 1;
516 qreal coeffs[1] = {0};
517 pauliOpType codes[NUM_QUBITS];
518 for (int i=0; i<NUM_QUBITS; i++)
519 codes[i] = PAULI_I;
520
521 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliSum(vec, codes, coeffs, numSumTerms, mat), Contains("Registers must both be state-vectors or both be density matrices") );
522 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliSum(mat, codes, coeffs, numSumTerms, vec), Contains("Registers must both be state-vectors or both be density matrices") );
523 }
524 SECTION( "workspace dimensions" ) {
525
526 // make valid params
527 int numSumTerms = 1;
528 qreal coeffs[1] = {0};
529 pauliOpType codes[NUM_QUBITS];
530 for (int i=0; i<NUM_QUBITS; i++)
531 codes[i] = PAULI_I;
532
533 Qureg vec2 = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS + 1, QUEST_ENV);
534 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliSum(vec, codes, coeffs, numSumTerms, vec2), Contains("Dimensions") && Contains("don't match") );
535 destroyQureg(vec2, QUEST_ENV);
536
537 Qureg mat2 = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS + 1, QUEST_ENV);
538 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcExpecPauliSum(mat, codes, coeffs, numSumTerms, mat2), Contains("Dimensions") && Contains("don't match") );
539 destroyQureg(mat2, QUEST_ENV);
540 }
541 }
542 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
543 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
544 destroyQureg(vecWork, QUEST_ENV);
545 destroyQureg(matWork, QUEST_ENV);
546}
calcExpecPauliSum
qreal calcExpecPauliSum(Qureg qureg, enum pauliOpType *allPauliCodes, qreal *termCoeffs, int numSumTerms, Qureg workspace)
Computes the expected value of a sum of products of Pauli operators.
Definition: QuEST.c:1306

References calcExpecPauliSum(), createDensityQureg(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), initDebugState(), NUM_QUBITS, PAULI_I, qcomp, qreal, QUEST_ENV, setRandomPauliSum(), toQMatrix(), toQVector(), and VLA.

◆ TEST_CASE() [29/136]

TEST_CASE ( "calcFidelity"  ,
""  [calculations] 
)
See also
calcFidelity
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 554 of file test_calculations.cpp.

554 {
555
556 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
557 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
558 Qureg pure = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
559
560 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
561
562 // repeat the below random tests 10 times
563 GENERATE( range(0,10) );
564
565 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
566
567 /* calcFidelity computes |<vec|pure>|^2 */
568
569 SECTION( "normalised" ) {
570
571 // random L2 vectors
572 QVector vecRef = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
573 QVector pureRef = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
574 toQureg(vec, vecRef);
575 toQureg(pure, pureRef);
576
577 // |<vec|vec>|^2 = |1|^2 = 1
578 REQUIRE( calcFidelity(vec,vec) == Approx(1) );
579
580 // |<vec|pure>|^2 = |sum_j conj(vec_j) * pure_j|^2
581 qcomp dotProd = 0;
582 for (size_t i=0; i<vecRef.size(); i++)
583 dotProd += conj(vecRef[i]) * pureRef[i];
584 qreal refFid = pow(abs(dotProd), 2);
585
586 REQUIRE( calcFidelity(vec,pure) == Approx(refFid) );
587 }
588 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
589
590 // random unnormalised vectors
591 QVector vecRef = getRandomQVector(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
592 QVector pureRef = getRandomQVector(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
593 toQureg(vec, vecRef);
594 toQureg(pure, pureRef);
595
596 // Let nv be magnitude of vec, hence |unit-vec> = 1/sqrt(nv)|vec>
597 qreal nv = 0;
598 for (size_t i=0; i<vecRef.size(); i++)
599 nv += pow(abs(vecRef[i]), 2);
600 // then <vec|vec> = sqrt(nv)*sqrt(nv) <unit-vec|unit-vec> = nv,
601 // hence |<vec|vec>|^2 = nv*nv
602 REQUIRE( calcFidelity(vec,vec) == Approx( nv*nv ) );
603
604 qcomp dotProd = 0;
605 for (size_t i=0; i<vecRef.size(); i++)
606 dotProd += conj(vecRef[i]) * pureRef[i];
607 qreal refFid = pow(abs(dotProd), 2);
608
609 REQUIRE( calcFidelity(vec,pure) == Approx(refFid) );
610 }
611 }
612 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
613
614 /* calcFidelity computes <pure|mat|pure> */
615
616 SECTION( "pure" ) {
617
618 QVector pureRef = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
619 toQureg(pure, pureRef);
620
621 // test when density matrix is the same pure state
622 QMatrix matRef = getKetBra(pureRef, pureRef);
623 toQureg(mat, matRef);
624 REQUIRE( calcFidelity(mat,pure) == Approx(1) );
625
626 // test when density matrix is a random pure state
627 QVector r1 = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
628 matRef = getKetBra(r1, r1); // actually pure |r1><r1|
629 toQureg(mat, matRef);
630
631 // <pure|r1><r1|pure> = |<r1|pure>|^2 = |sum_j conj(r1_j) * pure_j|^2
632 qcomp dotProd = 0;
633 for (size_t i=0; i<r1.size(); i++)
634 dotProd += conj(r1[i]) * pureRef[i];
635 qreal refFid = pow(abs(dotProd), 2);
636
637 REQUIRE( calcFidelity(mat,pure) == Approx(refFid) );
638 }
639 SECTION( "mixed" ) {
640
641 QVector pureRef = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
642 toQureg(pure, pureRef);
643
644 // test when density matrix is mixed
645 QMatrix matRef = getRandomDensityMatrix(NUM_QUBITS);
646 toQureg(mat, matRef);
647
648 // <pure|mat|pure> = <pure| (Mat|pure>)
649 QVector rhs = matRef * pureRef;
650 qcomp dotProd = 0;
651 for (size_t i=0; i<rhs.size(); i++)
652 dotProd += conj(pureRef[i]) * rhs[i];
653
654 REQUIRE( imag(dotProd) == Approx(0).margin(REAL_EPS) );
655 REQUIRE( calcFidelity(mat,pure) == Approx(real(dotProd)) );
656 }
657 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
658
659 // test when both density matrix and pure state are unnormalised
660 QVector pureRef = getRandomQVector(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
661 QMatrix matRef = getRandomQMatrix(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
662 toQureg(pure, pureRef);
663 toQureg(mat, matRef);
664
665 // real[ <pure|mat|pure> ] = real[ <pure| (Mat|pure>) ]
666 QVector rhs = matRef * pureRef;
667 qcomp dotProd = 0;
668 for (size_t i=0; i<rhs.size(); i++)
669 dotProd += conj(pureRef[i]) * rhs[i];
670
671 REQUIRE( calcFidelity(mat,pure) == Approx(real(dotProd)) );
672 }
673 }
674 }
675 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
676
677 SECTION( "dimensions" ) {
678
679 // two state-vectors
680 Qureg vec2 = createQureg(vec.numQubitsRepresented + 1, QUEST_ENV);
681 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcFidelity(vec2,vec), Contains("Dimensions") && Contains("don't match") );
682 destroyQureg(vec2, QUEST_ENV);
683
684 // density-matrix and state-vector
685 Qureg mat2 = createDensityQureg(vec.numQubitsRepresented + 1, QUEST_ENV);
686 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcFidelity(mat2,vec), Contains("Dimensions") && Contains("don't match") );
687 destroyQureg(mat2, QUEST_ENV);
688 }
689 SECTION( "density-matrices" ) {
690
691 // two mixed statess
692 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcFidelity(mat,mat), Contains("Second argument must be a state-vector") );
693 }
694 }
695 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
696 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
697 destroyQureg(pure, QUEST_ENV);
698}
Qureg::numQubitsRepresented
int numQubitsRepresented
The number of qubits represented in either the state-vector or density matrix.
Definition: QuEST.h:348

References calcFidelity(), createDensityQureg(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), getKetBra(), getRandomDensityMatrix(), getRandomQMatrix(), getRandomQVector(), getRandomStateVector(), NUM_QUBITS, Qureg::numQubitsRepresented, qcomp, qreal, QUEST_ENV, and toQureg().

◆ TEST_CASE() [30/136]

TEST_CASE ( "calcHilbertSchmidtDistance"  ,
""  [calculations] 
)
See also
calcHilbertSchmidtDistance
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 706 of file test_calculations.cpp.

706 {
707
708 Qureg mat1 = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
709 Qureg mat2 = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
710
711 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
712
713 // perform these random tests 10 times
714 GENERATE( range(0,10) );
715
716 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
717
718 SECTION( "pure" ) {
719
720 // create random |r1><r1| and |r2><r2| states
721 QVector r1 = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
722 QMatrix m1 = getKetBra(r1,r1);
723 toQureg(mat1, m1);
724 QVector r2 = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
725 QMatrix m2 = getKetBra(r2,r2);
726 toQureg(mat2, m2);
727
728 // Tr{ (a-b)(a-b)^dagger } = sum_{ij} |a_{ij} - b_{ij}|^2
729 qreal tr = 0;
730 for (size_t i=0; i<m1.size(); i++)
731 for (size_t j=0; j<m1.size(); j++)
732 tr += pow(abs(m1[i][j] - m2[i][j]), 2);
733
734 qreal res = calcHilbertSchmidtDistance(mat1, mat2);
735 REQUIRE( res == Approx(sqrt(tr)) );
736
737 }
738 SECTION( "normalised" ) {
739
740 QMatrix ref1 = getRandomDensityMatrix(NUM_QUBITS);
741 QMatrix ref2 = getRandomDensityMatrix(NUM_QUBITS);
742 toQureg(mat1, ref1);
743 toQureg(mat2, ref2);
744
745 // Tr{ (a-b)(a-b)^dagger } = sum_{ij} |a_{ij} - b_{ij}|^2
746 qreal tr = 0;
747 for (size_t i=0; i<ref1.size(); i++)
748 for (size_t j=0; j<ref1.size(); j++)
749 tr += pow(abs(ref1[i][j] - ref2[i][j]), 2);
750
751 qreal res = calcHilbertSchmidtDistance(mat1, mat2);
752 REQUIRE( res == Approx(sqrt(tr)) );
753 }
754 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
755
756 // mat1 and mat2 are both random matrices
757 QMatrix ref1 = getRandomQMatrix(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
758 QMatrix ref2 = getRandomQMatrix(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
759 toQureg(mat1, ref1);
760 toQureg(mat2, ref2);
761
762 // Tr{ (a-b)(a-b)^dagger } = sum_{ij} |a_{ij} - b_{ij}|^2
763 qreal tr = 0;
764 for (size_t i=0; i<ref1.size(); i++)
765 for (size_t j=0; j<ref1.size(); j++)
766 tr += pow(abs(ref1[i][j] - ref2[i][j]), 2);
767
768 qreal res = calcHilbertSchmidtDistance(mat1, mat2);
769 REQUIRE( res == Approx(sqrt(tr)) );
770 }
771 }
772 }
773 SECTION( "input validation") {
774
775 SECTION( "dimensions" ) {
776
777 Qureg mat3 = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS + 1, QUEST_ENV);
778 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcHilbertSchmidtDistance(mat1,mat3), Contains("Dimensions") && Contains("don't match") );
779 destroyQureg(mat3, QUEST_ENV);
780 }
781 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
782
783 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
784
785 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcHilbertSchmidtDistance(vec,mat1), Contains("valid only for density matrices") );
786 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcHilbertSchmidtDistance(mat1,vec), Contains("valid only for density matrices") );
787 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcHilbertSchmidtDistance(vec,vec), Contains("valid only for density matrices") );
788
789 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
790 }
791 }
792 destroyQureg(mat1, QUEST_ENV);
793 destroyQureg(mat2, QUEST_ENV);
794}
calcHilbertSchmidtDistance
qreal calcHilbertSchmidtDistance(Qureg a, Qureg b)
Computes the Hilbert Schmidt distance between two density matrices a and b, defined as the Frobenius ...
Definition: QuEST.c:1333

References calcHilbertSchmidtDistance(), createDensityQureg(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), getKetBra(), getRandomDensityMatrix(), getRandomQMatrix(), getRandomStateVector(), NUM_QUBITS, qreal, QUEST_ENV, and toQureg().

TEST_CASE ( "calcInnerProduct"  ,
""  [calculations] 
)
See also
calcInnerProduct
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 802 of file test_calculations.cpp.

802 {
803
804 Qureg vec1 = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
805 Qureg vec2 = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
806
807 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
808
809 // perform these random tests 10 times
810 GENERATE( range(0,10) );
811
812 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
813
814 SECTION( "normalised" ) {
815
816 // <r1|r2> = sum_j conj(r1_j) * r2_j
817 QVector r1 = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
818 QVector r2 = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
819 qcomp prod = 0;
820 for (size_t i=0; i<r1.size(); i++)
821 prod += conj(r1[i]) * r2[i];
822
823 toQureg(vec1, r1);
824 toQureg(vec2, r2);
825 Complex res = calcInnerProduct(vec1,vec2);
826
827 REQUIRE( res.real == Approx(real(prod)) );
828 REQUIRE( res.imag == Approx(imag(prod)) );
829 }
830 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
831
832 // <r1|r2> = sum_j conj(r1_j) * r2_j
833 QVector r1 = getRandomQVector(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
834 QVector r2 = getRandomQVector(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
835 qcomp prod = 0;
836 for (size_t i=0; i<r1.size(); i++)
837 prod += conj(r1[i]) * r2[i];
838
839 toQureg(vec1, r1);
840 toQureg(vec2, r2);
841 Complex res = calcInnerProduct(vec1,vec2);
842
843 REQUIRE( res.real == Approx(real(prod)) );
844 REQUIRE( res.imag == Approx(imag(prod)) );
845 }
846 }
847 }
848 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
849
850 SECTION( "dimensions" ) {
851
852 Qureg vec3 = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS + 1, QUEST_ENV);
853 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcInnerProduct(vec1,vec3), Contains("Dimensions") && Contains("don't match") );
854 destroyQureg(vec3, QUEST_ENV);
855 }
856 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
857
858 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
859
860 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcInnerProduct(vec1,mat), Contains("valid only for state-vectors") );
861 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcInnerProduct(mat,vec1), Contains("valid only for state-vectors") );
862 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcInnerProduct(mat,mat), Contains("valid only for state-vectors") );
863
864 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
865 }
866 }
867 destroyQureg(vec1, QUEST_ENV);
868 destroyQureg(vec2, QUEST_ENV);
869}

Complex calcInnerProduct(Qureg bra, Qureg ket)
Computes the inner product of two equal-size state vectors, given by.

◆ TEST_CASE() [32/136]

TEST_CASE ( "calcProbOfAllOutcomes"  ,
""  [calculations] 
)
See also
calcProbOfAllOutcomes
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 877 of file test_calculations.cpp.

877 {
878
879 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
880 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
881
882 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
883
884 // generate all possible qubit arrangements
885 int numQubits = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,NUM_QUBITS+1) );
886 int* qubits = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numQubits) );
887
888 int numOutcomes = 1<<numQubits;
889 VLA(qreal, probs, numOutcomes);
890 QVector refProbs = QVector(numOutcomes);
891
892 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
893
894 SECTION( "normalised" ) {
895
896 QVector ref = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
897 toQureg(vec, ref);
898
899 // prob is sum of |amp|^2 of basis states which encode outcome
900 for (size_t i=0; i<ref.size(); i++) {
901 int outcome = 0;
902 for (int q=0; q<numQubits; q++) {
903 int bit = (i >> qubits[q]) & 1;
904 outcome += bit * (1 << q);
905 }
906 refProbs[outcome] += pow(abs(ref[i]), 2);
907 }
908
909 calcProbOfAllOutcomes(probs, vec, qubits, numQubits);
910 REQUIRE( areEqual(refProbs, probs) );
911 }
912 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
913
914 QVector ref = getRandomQVector(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
915 toQureg(vec, ref);
916
917 // prob is sum of |amp|^2 of basis states which encode outcome
918 for (size_t i=0; i<ref.size(); i++) {
919 int outcome = 0;
920 for (int q=0; q<numQubits; q++) {
921 int bit = (i >> qubits[q]) & 1;
922 outcome += bit * (1 << q);
923 }
924 refProbs[outcome] += pow(abs(ref[i]), 2);
925 }
926
927 calcProbOfAllOutcomes(probs, vec, qubits, numQubits);
928 REQUIRE( areEqual(refProbs, probs) );
929 }
930 }
931 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
932
933 SECTION( "normalised" ) {
934
935 QMatrix ref = getRandomDensityMatrix(NUM_QUBITS);
936 toQureg(mat, ref);
937
938 // prob is sum of diagonals which encode outcome
939 for (size_t i=0; i<ref.size(); i++) {
940 int outcome = 0;
941 for (int q=0; q<numQubits; q++) {
942 int bit = (i >> qubits[q]) & 1;
943 outcome += bit * (1 << q);
944 }
945 refProbs[outcome] += real(ref[i][i]);
946 }
947
948 calcProbOfAllOutcomes(probs, mat, qubits, numQubits);
949 REQUIRE( areEqual(refProbs, probs) );
950 }
951 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
952
953 QMatrix ref = getRandomQMatrix(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
954 toQureg(mat, ref);
955
956 // prob is sum of diagonals which encode outcome
957 for (size_t i=0; i<ref.size(); i++) {
958 int outcome = 0;
959 for (int q=0; q<numQubits; q++) {
960 int bit = (i >> qubits[q]) & 1;
961 outcome += bit * (1 << q);
962 }
963 refProbs[outcome] += real(ref[i][i]);
964 }
965
966 calcProbOfAllOutcomes(probs, mat, qubits, numQubits);
967 REQUIRE( areEqual(refProbs, probs) );
968 }
969 }
970 }
971 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
972
973 int numQubits = 3;
974 int qubits[] = {0, 1, 2};
975 qreal probs[8];
976
977 SECTION( "number of qubits" ) {
978
979 numQubits = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
980 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcProbOfAllOutcomes(probs, mat, qubits, numQubits), Contains("Invalid number of target qubits") );
981 }
982 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
983
984 qubits[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numQubits))] = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
985 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcProbOfAllOutcomes(probs, mat, qubits, numQubits), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
986 }
987 SECTION( "repetition of qubits" ) {
988
989 qubits[GENERATE_COPY(1,2)] = qubits[0];
990 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcProbOfAllOutcomes(probs, mat, qubits, numQubits), Contains("qubits must be unique") );
991 }
992 }
993 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
994 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
995}
calcProbOfAllOutcomes
void calcProbOfAllOutcomes(qreal *retProbs, Qureg qureg, int *qubits, int numQubits)
Populates outcomeProbs with the probabilities of every outcome of the sub-register contained in qubit...
Definition: QuEST.c:1272

References areEqual(), calcProbOfAllOutcomes(), createDensityQureg(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), getRandomDensityMatrix(), getRandomQMatrix(), getRandomQVector(), getRandomStateVector(), NUM_QUBITS, qreal, QUEST_ENV, sublists(), toQureg(), and VLA.

◆ TEST_CASE() [33/136]

TEST_CASE ( "calcProbOfOutcome"  ,
""  [calculations] 
)
See also
calcProbOfOutcome
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 1004 of file test_calculations.cpp.

1004 {
1005
1006 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
1007 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
1008
1009 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1010
1011 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
1012 int outcome = GENERATE( 0, 1 );
1013
1014 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1015
1016 SECTION( "normalised" ) {
1017
1018 QVector ref = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
1019 toQureg(vec, ref);
1020
1021 // prob is sum of |amp|^2 of amplitudes where target bit is outcome
1022 qreal prob = 0;
1023 for (size_t ind=0; ind<ref.size(); ind++) {
1024 int bit = (ind >> target) & 1; // target-th bit
1025 if (bit == outcome)
1026 prob += pow(abs(ref[ind]), 2);
1027 }
1028
1029 REQUIRE( calcProbOfOutcome(vec, target, outcome) == Approx(prob) );
1030 }
1031 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
1032
1033 QVector ref = getRandomQVector(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
1034 toQureg(vec, ref);
1035
1036 // prob is (sum of |amp|^2 of amplitudes where target bit is zero)
1037 // or 1 - (this) if outcome == 1
1038 qreal prob = 0;
1039 for (size_t ind=0; ind<ref.size(); ind++) {
1040 int bit = (ind >> target) & 1; // target-th bit
1041 if (bit == 0)
1042 prob += pow(abs(ref[ind]), 2);
1043 }
1044 if (outcome == 1)
1045 prob = 1 - prob;
1046
1047 REQUIRE( calcProbOfOutcome(vec, target, outcome) == Approx(prob) );
1048 }
1049 }
1050 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1051
1052 SECTION( "pure" ) {
1053
1054 // set mat to a random |r><r|
1055 QVector ref = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
1056 toQureg(mat, getKetBra(ref, ref));
1057
1058 // calc prob of the state-vector
1059 qreal prob = 0;
1060 for (size_t ind=0; ind<ref.size(); ind++) {
1061 int bit = (ind >> target) & 1; // target-th bit
1062 if (bit == outcome)
1063 prob += pow(abs(ref[ind]), 2);
1064 }
1065
1066 REQUIRE( calcProbOfOutcome(mat, target, outcome) == Approx(prob) );
1067 }
1068 SECTION( "mixed" ) {
1069
1070 QMatrix ref = getRandomDensityMatrix(NUM_QUBITS);
1071 toQureg(mat, ref);
1072
1073 // prob is sum of diagonal amps (should be real) where target bit is outcome
1074 qcomp tr = 0;
1075 for (size_t ind=0; ind<ref.size(); ind++) {
1076 int bit = (ind >> target) & 1; // target-th bit
1077 if (bit == outcome)
1078 tr += ref[ind][ind];
1079 }
1080 REQUIRE( imag(tr) == Approx(0).margin(REAL_EPS) );
1081
1082 REQUIRE( calcProbOfOutcome(mat, target, outcome) == Approx(real(tr)) );
1083 }
1084 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
1085
1086 QMatrix ref = getRandomQMatrix(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
1087 toQureg(mat, ref);
1088
1089 // prob is (sum of real of diagonal amps where target bit is outcome)
1090 // or 1 - (this) if outcome == 1
1091 qreal tr = 0;
1092 for (size_t ind=0; ind<ref.size(); ind++) {
1093 int bit = (ind >> target) & 1; // target-th bit
1094 if (bit == 0)
1095 tr += real(ref[ind][ind]);
1096 }
1097 if (outcome == 1)
1098 tr = 1 - tr;
1099
1100 REQUIRE( calcProbOfOutcome(mat, target, outcome) == Approx(tr) );
1101 }
1102 }
1103 }
1104 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1105
1106 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
1107
1108 int target = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
1109 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcProbOfOutcome(vec, target, 0), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
1110 }
1111 SECTION( "outcome value" ) {
1112
1113 int outcome = GENERATE( -1, 2 );
1114 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcProbOfOutcome(vec, 0, outcome), Contains("Invalid measurement outcome") );
1115 }
1116 }
1117 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
1118 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
1119}
calcProbOfOutcome
qreal calcProbOfOutcome(Qureg qureg, int measureQubit, int outcome)
Gives the probability of a specified qubit being measured in the given outcome (0 or 1).
Definition: QuEST.c:1262

References calcProbOfOutcome(), createDensityQureg(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), getKetBra(), getRandomDensityMatrix(), getRandomQMatrix(), getRandomQVector(), getRandomStateVector(), NUM_QUBITS, qcomp, qreal, QUEST_ENV, and toQureg().

◆ TEST_CASE() [34/136]

TEST_CASE ( "calcPurity"  ,
""  [calculations] 
)
See also
calcPurity
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 1127 of file test_calculations.cpp.

1127 {
1128
1129 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
1130
1131 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1132
1133 // perform the following random tests 10 times
1134 GENERATE( range(1,10) );
1135
1136 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1137
1138 SECTION( "pure" ) {
1139
1140 // pure states have unity purity
1141 initZeroState(mat);
1142 REQUIRE( calcPurity(mat) == 1 );
1143
1144 // (try also a pure random L2-vector)
1145 QVector r1 = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS); // |r>
1146 QMatrix m1 = getKetBra(r1, r1); // |r><r|
1147 toQureg(mat, m1);
1148 REQUIRE( calcPurity(mat) == Approx(1) );
1149
1150 }
1151 SECTION( "mixed" ) {
1152
1153 // mixed states have 1/2^N < purity < 1
1154 QMatrix ref = getRandomDensityMatrix(NUM_QUBITS);
1155 toQureg(mat, ref);
1156 qreal purity = calcPurity(mat);
1157 REQUIRE( purity < 1 );
1158 REQUIRE( purity >= 1/pow(2.,NUM_QUBITS) );
1159
1160 // compare to Tr(rho^2)
1161 QMatrix prod = ref*ref;
1162 qreal tr = 0;
1163 for (size_t i=0; i<prod.size(); i++)
1164 tr += real(prod[i][i]);
1165 REQUIRE( purity == Approx(tr) );
1166 }
1167 SECTION( "unnormalised" ) {
1168
1169 // unphysical states give sum_{ij} |rho_ij|^2
1170 QMatrix ref = getRandomQMatrix(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
1171 qreal tot = 0;
1172 for (size_t i=0; i<ref.size(); i++)
1173 for (size_t j=0; j<ref.size(); j++)
1174 tot += pow(abs(ref[i][j]), 2);
1175
1176 toQureg(mat, ref);
1177 REQUIRE( calcPurity(mat) == Approx(tot) );
1178 }
1179 }
1180 }
1181 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1182
1183 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1184
1185 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
1186 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( calcPurity(vec), Contains("valid only for density matrices") );
1187 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
1188 }
1189 }
1190 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
1191}
calcPurity
qreal calcPurity(Qureg qureg)
Calculates the purity of a density matrix, by the trace of the density matrix squared.
Definition: QuEST.c:1281

TEST_CASE ( "calcTotalProb"  ,
""  [calculations] 
)
See also
calcTotalProb
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 1199 of file test_calculations.cpp.

1199 {
1200
1201 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
1202 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
1203
1204 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1205
1206 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1207
1208 // normalised: prob(vec) = 1
1209 initPlusState(vec);
1210 REQUIRE( calcTotalProb(vec) == Approx(1) );
1211
1212 // zero norm: prob(vec) = 0
1213 initBlankState(vec);
1214 REQUIRE( calcTotalProb(vec) == 0 );
1215
1216 // random L2 state: prob(vec) = 1
1217 toQureg(vec, getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS));
1218 REQUIRE( calcTotalProb(vec) == Approx(1) );
1219
1220 // unnormalised: prob(vec) = sum_i |vec_i|^2
1221 initDebugState(vec);
1222 QVector ref = toQVector(vec);
1223 qreal refProb = 0;
1224 for (size_t i=0; i<ref.size(); i++)
1225 refProb += pow(abs(ref[i]), 2);
1226 REQUIRE( calcTotalProb(vec) == Approx(refProb) );
1227 }
1228 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1229
1230 // normalised: prob(mat) = 1
1231 initPlusState(mat);
1232 REQUIRE( calcTotalProb(mat) == Approx(1) );
1233
1234 // zero norm: prob(mat) = 0
1235 initBlankState(mat);
1236 REQUIRE( calcTotalProb(mat) == 0 );
1237
1238 // random density matrix: prob(mat) = 1
1239 toQureg(mat, getRandomDensityMatrix(NUM_QUBITS));
1240 REQUIRE( calcTotalProb(mat) == Approx(1) );
1241
1242 // unnormalised: prob(mat) = sum_i real(mat_{ii})
1243 initDebugState(mat);
1244 QMatrix ref = toQMatrix(mat);
1245 qreal refProb = 0;
1246 for (size_t i=0; i<ref.size(); i++)
1247 refProb += real(ref[i][i]);
1248 REQUIRE( calcTotalProb(mat) == Approx(refProb) );
1249 }
1250 }
1251 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1252
1253 // no validation
1254 SUCCEED();
1255 }
1256 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
1257 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
1258}
calcTotalProb
qreal calcTotalProb(Qureg qureg)
A debugging function which calculates the probability of the qubits in qureg being in any state,...
Definition: QuEST.c:1239

void initBlankState(Qureg qureg)
