TEST_CASE ( "cloneQureg"  ,
""  [state_initialisations] 
)
See also
cloneQureg
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 15 of file test_state_initialisations.cpp.

15 {
16
17 Qureg vec1 = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
18 Qureg mat1 = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
19
20 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
21
22 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
23
24 Qureg vec2 = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
25
26 // make sure states start differently
27 initDebugState(vec1);
28 initBlankState(vec2);
29 REQUIRE( !areEqual(vec1, vec2) );
30
31 // make sure vec2 is changed
32 QVector copy1 = toQVector(vec1);
33 cloneQureg(vec2, vec1);
34 REQUIRE( areEqual(vec1, vec2) );
35
36 // make sure vec1 unaffected
37 REQUIRE( areEqual(vec1, copy1) );
38
39 destroyQureg(vec2, QUEST_ENV);
40 }
41 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
42
43 Qureg mat2 = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
44
45 // make sure states start differently
46 initDebugState(mat1);
47 initBlankState(mat2);
48 REQUIRE( !areEqual(mat1, mat2) );
49
50 // make sure vec2 is changed
51 QMatrix copy1 = toQMatrix(mat1);
52 cloneQureg(mat2, mat1);
53 REQUIRE( areEqual(mat1, mat2) );
54
55 // make sure vec1 unaffected
56 REQUIRE( areEqual(mat1, copy1) );
57
58 destroyQureg(mat2, QUEST_ENV);
59 }
60 }
61 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
62
63 SECTION( "qureg type" ) {
64
65 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( cloneQureg(mat1, vec1), Contains("both be state-vectors") && Contains("density matrices") );
66 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( cloneQureg(vec1, mat1), Contains("both be state-vectors") && Contains("density matrices") );
67 }
68 SECTION( "qureg dimensions" ) {
69
70 Qureg vec3 = createQureg(vec1.numQubitsRepresented + 1, QUEST_ENV);
71 Qureg mat3 = createDensityQureg(mat1.numQubitsRepresented + 1, QUEST_ENV);
72
73 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( cloneQureg(vec1, vec3), Contains("Dimensions") && Contains("don't match") );
74 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( cloneQureg(mat1, mat3), Contains("Dimensions") && Contains("don't match") );
75
76 destroyQureg(vec3, QUEST_ENV);
77 destroyQureg(mat3, QUEST_ENV);
78 }
79 }
80 destroyQureg(vec1, QUEST_ENV);
81 destroyQureg(mat1, QUEST_ENV);
82}
cloneQureg
void cloneQureg(Qureg targetQureg, Qureg copyQureg)
Overwrite the amplitudes of targetQureg with those from copyQureg.
Definition: QuEST.c:164

References areEqual(), cloneQureg(), createDensityQureg(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), initBlankState(), initDebugState(), NUM_QUBITS, Qureg::numQubitsRepresented, QUEST_ENV, toQMatrix(), and toQVector().

◆ TEST_CASE() [37/136]

TEST_CASE ( "collapseToOutcome"  ,
""  [gates] 
)
See also
collapseToOutcome
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 15 of file test_gates.cpp.

15 {
16
17 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
18 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
19
20 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
21
22 int qubit = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
23 int outcome = GENERATE( 0, 1 );
24
25 // repeat these random tests 10 times on every qubit, and for both outcomes
26 GENERATE( range(0,10) );
27
28 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
29
30 // use a random L2 state for every qubit & outcome
31 QVector vecRef = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
32 toQureg(vec, vecRef);
33
34 // calculate prob of outcome
35 qreal prob = 0;
36 for (size_t ind=0; ind<vecRef.size(); ind++) {
37 int bit = (ind >> qubit) & 1; // target-th bit
38 if (bit == outcome)
39 prob += pow(abs(vecRef[ind]), 2);
40 }
41
42 // renormalise by the outcome prob
43 for (size_t ind=0; ind<vecRef.size(); ind++) {
44 int bit = (ind >> qubit) & 1; // target-th bit
45 if (bit == outcome)
46 vecRef[ind] /= sqrt(prob);
47 else
48 vecRef[ind] = 0;
49 }
50
51 qreal res = collapseToOutcome(vec, qubit, outcome);
52 REQUIRE( res == Approx(prob) );
53 REQUIRE( areEqual(vec, vecRef) );
54 }
55 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
56
57 // use a random density matrix for every qubit & outcome
58 QMatrix matRef = getRandomDensityMatrix(NUM_QUBITS);
59 toQureg(mat, matRef);
60
61 // prob is sum of diagonal amps (should be real) where target bit is outcome
62 qcomp tr = 0;
63 for (size_t ind=0; ind<matRef.size(); ind++) {
64 int bit = (ind >> qubit) & 1; // qubit-th bit
65 if (bit == outcome)
66 tr += matRef[ind][ind];
67 }
68 REQUIRE( imag(tr) == Approx(0).margin(REAL_EPS) );
69 qreal prob = real(tr);
70
71 // renorm (/prob) every |*outcome*><*outcome*| state, zeroing all others
72 for (size_t r=0; r<matRef.size(); r++) {
73 for (size_t c=0; c<matRef.size(); c++) {
74 int ketBit = (c >> qubit) & 1;
75 int braBit = (r >> qubit) & 1;
76
77 if (ketBit == outcome && braBit == outcome)
78 matRef[r][c] /= prob;
79 else
80 matRef[r][c] = 0;
81 }
82 }
83
84 qreal res = collapseToOutcome(mat, qubit, outcome);
85 REQUIRE( res == Approx(prob) );
86 REQUIRE( areEqual(mat, matRef) );
87 }
88 }
89 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
90
91 SECTION( "qubit index" ) {
92
93 int qubit = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
94 int outcome = 0;
95 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( collapseToOutcome(mat, qubit, outcome), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
96 }
97 SECTION( "outcome value" ) {
98
99 int qubit = 0;
100 int outcome = GENERATE( -1, 2 );
101 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( collapseToOutcome(mat, qubit, outcome), Contains("Invalid measurement outcome") );
102 }
103 SECTION( "outcome probability" ) {
104
105 initZeroState(vec);
106 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( collapseToOutcome(vec, 0, 1), Contains("Can't collapse to state with zero probability") );
107 initClassicalState(vec, 1);
108 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( collapseToOutcome(vec, 0, 0), Contains("Can't collapse to state with zero probability") );
109 }
110 }
111 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
112 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
113}
initClassicalState
void initClassicalState(Qureg qureg, long long int stateInd)
Initialise qureg into the classical state (also known as a "computational basis state") with index st...
Definition: QuEST.c:134
collapseToOutcome
qreal collapseToOutcome(Qureg qureg, int measureQubit, int outcome)
Updates qureg to be consistent with measuring measureQubit in the given outcome (0 or 1),...
Definition: QuEST.c:994

References areEqual(), collapseToOutcome(), createDensityQureg(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), getRandomDensityMatrix(), getRandomStateVector(), initClassicalState(), initZeroState(), NUM_QUBITS, qcomp, qreal, QUEST_ENV, and toQureg().

◆ TEST_CASE() [38/136]

TEST_CASE ( "compactUnitary"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
compactUnitary
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 46 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

46 {
47
48 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
49
50 qcomp a = getRandomReal(-1,1) * expI(getRandomReal(0,2*M_PI));
51 qcomp b = sqrt(1-abs(a)*abs(a)) * expI(getRandomReal(0,2*M_PI));
52 Complex alpha; alpha.real = real(a); alpha.imag = imag(a);
53 Complex beta; beta.real = real(b); beta.imag = imag(b);
54 QMatrix op = toQMatrix(alpha, beta);
55
56 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
57
58 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
59
60 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
61
62 compactUnitary(quregVec, target, alpha, beta);
63 applyReferenceOp(refVec, target, op);
64 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
65 }
66 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
67
68 compactUnitary(quregMatr, target, alpha, beta);
69 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, target, op);
70 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
71 }
72 }
73 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
74
75 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
76
77 int target = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
78 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( compactUnitary(quregVec, target, alpha, beta), Contains("Invalid target") );
79 }
80 SECTION( "unitarity" ) {
81
82 // unitary when |alpha|^2 + |beta|^2 = 1
83 alpha.real=1; alpha.imag=2;
84 beta.real=3; beta.imag=4;
85 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( compactUnitary(quregVec, 0, alpha, beta), Contains("unitary") );
86 }
87 }
88 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
89}
compactUnitary
void compactUnitary(Qureg qureg, int targetQubit, Complex alpha, Complex beta)
Apply a single-qubit unitary parameterised by two given complex scalars.
Definition: QuEST.c:412

#define PREPARE_TEST(quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr)
Prepares the needed data structures for unit testing unitaries.

Destroys the data structures made by PREPARE_TEST.

TEST_CASE ( "controlledCompactUnitary"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
controlledCompactUnitary
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 217 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

217 {
218
219 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
220
221 qcomp a = getRandomReal(-1,1) * expI(getRandomReal(0,2*M_PI));
222 qcomp b = sqrt(1-abs(a)*abs(a)) * expI(getRandomReal(0,2*M_PI));
223 Complex alpha; alpha.real = real(a); alpha.imag = imag(a);
224 Complex beta; beta.real = real(b); beta.imag = imag(b);
225 QMatrix op = toQMatrix(alpha, beta);
226
227 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
228
229 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
230 int control = GENERATE_COPY( filter([=](int c){ return c!=target; }, range(0,NUM_QUBITS)) );
231
232 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
233
234 controlledCompactUnitary(quregVec, control, target, alpha, beta);
235 applyReferenceOp(refVec, control, target, op);
236 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
237 }
238 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
239
240 controlledCompactUnitary(quregMatr, control, target, alpha, beta);
241 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, control, target, op);
242 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
243 }
244 }
245 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
246
247 SECTION( "control and target collision" ) {
248
249 int qb = 0;
250 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledCompactUnitary(quregVec, qb, qb, alpha, beta), Contains("Control") && Contains("target") );
251 }
252 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
253
254 int qb = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
255 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledCompactUnitary(quregVec, qb, 0, alpha, beta), Contains("Invalid control") );
256 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledCompactUnitary(quregVec, 0, qb, alpha, beta), Contains("Invalid target") );
257 }
258 SECTION( "unitarity" ) {
259
260 // unitary when |a|^2 + |b^2 = 1
261 alpha.real=1; alpha.imag=2;
262 beta.real=3; beta.imag=4;
263 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledCompactUnitary(quregVec, 0, 1, alpha, beta), Contains("unitary") );
264 }
265 }
266 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
267}

◆ TEST_CASE() [40/136]

TEST_CASE ( "controlledMultiQubitUnitary"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
controlledMultiQubitUnitary
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 275 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

275 {
276
277 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
278
279 // figure out max-num targs (inclusive) allowed by hardware backend
280 int maxNumTargs = calcLog2(quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk);
281 if (maxNumTargs >= NUM_QUBITS)
282 maxNumTargs = NUM_QUBITS - 1; // make space for control qubit
283
284 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
285
286 // generate all possible qubit arrangements
287 int ctrl = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
288 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumTargs+1) );
289 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs, ctrl) );
290
291 // for each qubit arrangement, use a new random unitary
292 QMatrix op = getRandomUnitary(numTargs);
293 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs);
294 toComplexMatrixN(op, matr);
295
296 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
297
298 controlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrl, targs, numTargs, matr);
299 applyReferenceOp(refVec, ctrl, targs, numTargs, op);
300 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
301 }
302 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
303
304 controlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregMatr, ctrl, targs, numTargs, matr);
305 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, ctrl, targs, numTargs, op);
306 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
307 }
308 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
309 }
310 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
311
312 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
313
314 // there cannot be more targets than qubits in register
315 // (numTargs=NUM_QUBITS is caught elsewhere, because that implies ctrl is invalid)
316 int numTargs = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
317 int targs[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
318 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(NUM_QUBITS+1); // prevent seg-fault
319 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, 0, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("Invalid number of target"));
320 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
321 }
322 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
323
324 int ctrl = 0;
325 int numTargs = 3;
326 int targs[] = {1,2,2};
327 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
328
329 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrl, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("target") && Contains("unique"));
330 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
331 }
332 SECTION( "control and target collision" ) {
333
334 int numTargs = 3;
335 int targs[] = {0,1,2};
336 int ctrl = targs[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTargs) )];
337 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
338
339 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrl, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("Control") && Contains("target"));
340 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
341 }
342 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
343
344 int ctrl = 0;
345 int numTargs = 3;
346 int targs[] = {1,2,3};
347 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
348
349 int inv = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
350 ctrl = inv;
351 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrl, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("Invalid control") );
352
353 ctrl = 0; // restore valid ctrl
354 targs[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTargs) )] = inv; // make invalid target
355 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrl, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
356
357 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
358 }
359 SECTION( "unitarity" ) {
360
361 int ctrl = 0;
362 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumTargs+1) );
363 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs); // initially zero, hence not-unitary
364
365 VLA(int, targs, numTargs);
366 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++)
367 targs[i] = i+1;
368
369 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrl, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("unitary") );
370 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
371 }
372 SECTION( "unitary creation" ) {
373
374 int numTargs = 3;
375 int targs[] = {1,2,3};
376
377 /* compilers don't auto-initialise to NULL; the below circumstance
378 * only really occurs when 'malloc' returns NULL in createComplexMatrixN,
379 * which actually triggers its own validation. Hence this test is useless
380 * currently.
381 */
382 ComplexMatrixN matr;
383 matr.real = NULL;
384 matr.imag = NULL;
385 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, 0, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("created") );
386 }
387 SECTION( "unitary dimensions" ) {
388
389 int ctrl = 0;
390 int targs[2] = {1,2};
391 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(3);
392
393 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrl, targs, 2, matr), Contains("matrix size"));
394 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
395 }
396 SECTION( "unitary fits in node" ) {
397
398 // pretend we have a very limited distributed memory (judged by matr size)
399 quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk = 1;
400 int qb[] = {1,2};
401 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(2); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
402 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, 0, qb, 2, matr), Contains("targets too many qubits"));
403 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
404 }
405 }
406 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
407}
controlledMultiQubitUnitary
void controlledMultiQubitUnitary(Qureg qureg, int ctrl, int *targs, int numTargs, ComplexMatrixN u)
Apply a general controlled multi-qubit unitary (including a global phase factor).
Definition: QuEST.c:321

TEST_CASE ( "controlledPhaseShift"  ,

controlledPhaseShift

Definition at line 553 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

553 {
554
555 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
556 qreal param = getRandomReal(-2*M_PI, 2*M_PI);
557 QMatrix op{{1,0},{0,expI(param)}};
558
559 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
560
561 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );

564 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {

575 }

582 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledPhaseShift(quregVec, qb, qb, param), Contains("Control") && Contains("target") );
583 }
584 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
585
586 int qb = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
587 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledPhaseShift(quregVec, qb, 0, param), Contains("Invalid control") );
588 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledPhaseShift(quregVec, 0, qb, param), Contains("Invalid target") );
589 }
590 }
591 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
592}
controlledPhaseShift
void controlledPhaseShift(Qureg qureg, int idQubit1, int idQubit2, qreal angle)
Introduce a phase factor on state of qubits idQubit1 and idQubit2.
Definition: QuEST.c:506

References applyReferenceOp(), areEqual(), CLEANUP_TEST, controlledPhaseShift(), expI(), getRandomReal(), M_PI, NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, and qreal.

◆ TEST_CASE() [45/136]

TEST_CASE ( "controlledRotateAroundAxis"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
controlledRotateAroundAxis
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 600 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

600 {
601
602 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
603
604 // each test will use a random parameter and axis vector
605 qreal param = getRandomReal(-4*M_PI, 4*M_PI);
606 Vector vec;
607 vec.x=getRandomReal(-1,1);
608 vec.y=getRandomReal(-1,1);
609 vec.z=getRandomReal(-1,1);
610
611 // Rn(a) = cos(a/2)I - i sin(a/2) n . paulivector
612 // (pg 24 of vcpc.univie.ac.at/~ian/hotlist/qc/talks/bloch-sphere-rotations.pdf)
613 qreal c = cos(param/2);
614 qreal s = sin(param/2);
615 qreal m = sqrt(vec.x*vec.x + vec.y*vec.y + vec.z*vec.z);
616 QMatrix op{{c - qcomp(0,1)*vec.z*s/m, -(vec.y + qcomp(0,1)*vec.x)*s/m},
617 {(vec.y - qcomp(0,1)*vec.x)*s/m, c + qcomp(0,1)*vec.z*s/m}};
618
619 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
620
621 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
622 int control = GENERATE_COPY( filter([=](int c){ return c!=target; }, range(0,NUM_QUBITS)) );
623
624 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
625
626 controlledRotateAroundAxis(quregVec, control, target, param, vec);
627 applyReferenceOp(refVec, control, target, op);
628 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
629 }
630 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
631
632 controlledRotateAroundAxis(quregMatr, control, target, param, vec);
633 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, control, target, op);
634 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
635 }
636 }
637 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
638
639 SECTION( "control and target collision" ) {
640
641 int qb = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
642 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledRotateAroundAxis(quregVec, qb, qb, param, vec), Contains("Control") && Contains("target") );
643 }
644 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
645
646 int qb = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
647 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledRotateAroundAxis(quregVec, qb, 0, param, vec), Contains("Invalid control") );
648 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledRotateAroundAxis(quregVec, 0, qb, param, vec), Contains("Invalid target") );
649 }
650 SECTION( "zero rotation axis" ) {
651
652 vec.x=0; vec.y=0; vec.z=0;
653 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledRotateAroundAxis(quregVec, 0, 1, param, vec), Contains("Invalid axis") && Contains("zero") );
654 }
655 }
656 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
657}

TEST_CASE ( "controlledTwoQubitUnitary"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
controlledTwoQubitUnitary
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 808 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

808 {
809
810 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
811
812 // in distributed mode, each node must be able to fit all amps modified by unitary
813 REQUIRE( quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk >= 4 );
814
815 // every test will use a unique random matrix
816 QMatrix op = getRandomUnitary(2);
817 ComplexMatrix4 matr = toComplexMatrix4(op);
818
819 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
820
821 int targ1 = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
822 int targ2 = GENERATE_COPY( filter([=](int t){ return t!=targ1; }, range(0,NUM_QUBITS)) );
823 int control = GENERATE_COPY( filter([=](int c){ return c!=targ1 && c!=targ2; }, range(0,NUM_QUBITS)) );
824
825 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
826
827 controlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, control, targ1, targ2, matr);
828 applyReferenceOp(refVec, control, targ1, targ2, op);
829 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
830 }
831 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
832
833 controlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregMatr, control, targ1, targ2, matr);
834 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, control, targ1, targ2, op);
835 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
836 }
837 }
838 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
839
840 SECTION( "repetition of targets" ) {
841 int targ = 0;
842 int ctrl = 1;
843 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrl, targ, targ, matr), Contains("target") && Contains("unique") );
844 }
845 SECTION( "control and target collision" ) {
846
847 int targ1 = 1;
848 int targ2 = 2;
849 int ctrl = GENERATE( 1,2 ); // catch2 bug; can't do GENERATE_COPY( targ1, targ2 )
850 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrl, targ1, targ2, matr), Contains("Control") && Contains("target") );
851 }
852 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
853
854 // valid config
855 int ctrl = 0;
856 int targ1 = 1;
857 int targ2 = 2;
858
859 int qb = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
860 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, qb, targ1, targ2, matr), Contains("Invalid control") );
861 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrl, qb, targ2, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
862 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrl, targ1, qb, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
863 }
864 SECTION( "unitarity" ) {
865
866 matr.real[0][0] = 0; // break matr unitarity
867 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, 0, 1, 2, matr), Contains("unitary") );
868 }
869 SECTION( "unitary fits in node" ) {
870
871 // pretend we have a very limited distributed memory
872 quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk = 1;
873 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( controlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, 0, 1, 2, matr), Contains("targets too many qubits"));
874 }
875 }
876 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
877}

TEST_CASE ( "createCloneQureg"  ,
""  [data_structures] 
)
See also
createCloneQureg
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 64 of file test_data_structures.cpp.

64 {
65
66 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
67
68 Qureg a = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
69 Qureg b = createCloneQureg(a, QUEST_ENV);
70
71 // check properties are the same
72 REQUIRE( b.isDensityMatrix == a.isDensityMatrix );
73 REQUIRE( b.numQubitsRepresented == a.numQubitsRepresented );
74 REQUIRE( b.numQubitsInStateVec == a.numQubitsInStateVec );
75 REQUIRE( b.numAmpsPerChunk == a.numAmpsPerChunk );
76 REQUIRE( b.numAmpsTotal == a.numAmpsTotal );
77
78 // check state-vector is the same (works for GPU and distributed)
79 REQUIRE( areEqual(a, b) );
80
81 destroyQureg(a, QUEST_ENV);
82 destroyQureg(b, QUEST_ENV);
83 }
84 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
85
86 Qureg a = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
87 Qureg b = createCloneQureg(a, QUEST_ENV);
88
89 // check properties are the same
90 REQUIRE( b.isDensityMatrix == a.isDensityMatrix );
91 REQUIRE( b.numQubitsRepresented == a.numQubitsRepresented );
92 REQUIRE( b.numQubitsInStateVec == a.numQubitsInStateVec );
93 REQUIRE( b.numAmpsPerChunk == a.numAmpsPerChunk );
94 REQUIRE( b.numAmpsTotal == a.numAmpsTotal );
95
96 // check state-vector is the same (works for GPU and distributed)
97 REQUIRE( areEqual(a, b) );
98
99 destroyQureg(a, QUEST_ENV);
100 destroyQureg(b, QUEST_ENV);
101 }
102}

110 {

112 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
113
114 int numQb = GENERATE( range(1,10+1) );
115 ComplexMatrixN m = createComplexMatrixN(numQb);
116

◆ TEST_CASE() [53/136]

TEST_CASE ( "createDensityQureg"  ,
""  [data_structures] 
)
See also
createDensityQureg
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 138 of file test_data_structures.cpp.

138 {
139
140 // must be at least one amplitude per node
141 int minNumQb = calcLog2(QUEST_ENV.numRanks) - 1; // density matrix has 2*numQb in state-vec
142 if (minNumQb <= 0)
143 minNumQb = 1;
144
145 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
146
147 // try 10 valid number of qubits
148 int numQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(minNumQb, minNumQb+10) );
149 Qureg reg = createDensityQureg(numQb, QUEST_ENV);
150
151 // ensure elems (CPU and/or GPU) are created, and reg begins in |0><0|
152 QMatrix ref = getZeroMatrix(1<<numQb);
153 ref[0][0] = 1; // |0><0|
154 REQUIRE( areEqual(reg, ref) );
155
156 destroyQureg(reg, QUEST_ENV);
157 }
158 SECTION( "input validation") {
159
160 SECTION( "number of qubits" ) {
161
162 int numQb = GENERATE( -1, 0 );
163 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createDensityQureg(numQb, QUEST_ENV), Contains("Invalid number of qubits") );
164 }
165 SECTION( "number of amplitudes" ) {
166
167 // use local QuESTEnv to safely modify
168 QuESTEnv env = QUEST_ENV;
169
170 // too many amplitudes to store in type
171 int maxQb = (int) calcLog2(SIZE_MAX) / 2;
172 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createDensityQureg(maxQb+1, env), Contains("Too many qubits") && Contains("size_t type") );
173
174 /* n-qubit density matrix contains 2^(2n) amplitudes
175 * so can be spread between at most 2^(2n) ranks
176 */
177 /* env.numRanks is an int, so maxQb must be capped at 16 for this
178 * test to avoid an integer overflow when storing 2**(2*minQb) in it
179 */
180 maxQb = maxQb > 16 ? 16 : maxQb;
181 int minQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(3,maxQb) );
182 env.numRanks = (int) pow(2, 2*minQb);
183 int numQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,minQb) );
184 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createDensityQureg(numQb, env), Contains("Too few qubits") );
185 }
186 SECTION( "available memory" ) {
187
188 /* there is no reliable way to force the malloc statements to
189 * fail, and hence trigger the matrixInit validation */
190 SUCCEED( );
191 }
192 }
193}
QuESTEnv
Information about the environment the program is running in.
Definition: QuEST.h:384
QuESTEnv::numRanks
int numRanks
Definition: QuEST.h:386

References areEqual(), calcLog2(), createDensityQureg(), destroyQureg(), getZeroMatrix(), QuESTEnv::numRanks, and QUEST_ENV.

◆ TEST_CASE() [54/136]

TEST_CASE ( "createDiagonalOp"  ,
""  [data_structures] 
)
See also
createDiagonalOp
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 201 of file test_data_structures.cpp.

201 {
202
203 // must be at least one amplitude per node
204 int minNumQb = calcLog2(QUEST_ENV.numRanks);
205 if (minNumQb == 0)
206 minNumQb = 1;
207
208 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
209
210 // try 10 valid number of qubits
211 int numQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(minNumQb, minNumQb+10) );
212 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOp(numQb, QUEST_ENV);
213
214 // check properties are correct
215 REQUIRE( op.numQubits == numQb );
216 REQUIRE( op.chunkId == QUEST_ENV.rank );
217 REQUIRE( op.numChunks == QUEST_ENV.numRanks );
218 REQUIRE( op.numElemsPerChunk == (1LL << numQb) / QUEST_ENV.numRanks );
219 REQUIRE( op.real != NULL );
220 REQUIRE( op.imag != NULL );
221
222 // check all elements in CPU are zero
223 REQUIRE( areEqual(toQVector(op), QVector(1LL << numQb)) );
224
225 // (no concise way to check this for GPU)
226
227 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
228 }
229 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
230
231 SECTION( "number of qubits" ) {
232
233 int numQb = GENERATE( -1, 0 );
234 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createDiagonalOp(numQb, QUEST_ENV), Contains("Invalid number of qubits") );
235 }
236 SECTION( "number of elements" ) {
237
238 // use local QuESTEnv to safely modify
239 QuESTEnv env = QUEST_ENV;
240
241 // too many amplitudes to store in type
242 int maxQb = (int) calcLog2(SIZE_MAX);
243 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createDiagonalOp(maxQb+1, env), Contains("Too many qubits") && Contains("size_t type") );
244
245 /* env.numRanks is an int, so maxQb must be capped at 32 for this
246 * test to avoid an integer overflow when storing 2**minQb in it
247 */
248 maxQb = maxQb > 32 ? 32 : maxQb;
249 // too few amplitudes to distribute
250 int minQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(2,maxQb) );
251 env.numRanks = (int) pow(2, minQb);
252 int numQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,minQb) );
253 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createDiagonalOp(numQb, env), Contains("Too few qubits") && Contains("distributed"));
254 }
255 SECTION( "available memory" ) {
256
257 /* there is no reliable way to force the malloc statements to
258 * fail, and hence trigger the diagonalOpInit validation */
259 SUCCEED( );
260 }
261 }
262}
DiagonalOp::numQubits
int numQubits
The number of qubits this operator can act on (informing its size)
Definition: QuEST.h:302
DiagonalOp::chunkId
int chunkId
The position of the chunk of the operator held by this process in the full operator.
Definition: QuEST.h:308
DiagonalOp::numChunks
int numChunks
The number of nodes between which the elements of this operator are split.
Definition: QuEST.h:306
QuESTEnv::rank
int rank
Definition: QuEST.h:385

◆ TEST_CASE() [55/136]

TEST_CASE ( "createDiagonalOpFromPauliHamilFile"  ,
""  [data_structures] 
)
See also
createDiagonalOpFromPauliHamilFile
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 270 of file test_data_structures.cpp.

270 {
271
272 // files created & populated during the test, and deleted afterward
273 char fnPrefix[] = "temp_createDiagonalOpFromPauliHamilFile";
274 char fn[100];
275
276 // each test uses a unique filename (managed by master node), to avoid file IO locks
277 // (it's safe for sub-test to overwrite this, since after each test, all files
278 // with prefix fnPrefix are deleted)
279 setUniqueFilename(fn, fnPrefix);
280
281 // diagonal op must have at least one amplitude per node
282 int minNumQb = calcLog2(QUEST_ENV.numRanks);
283 if (minNumQb == 0)
284 minNumQb = 1;
285
286 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
287
288 SECTION( "general" ) {
289
290 // try several Pauli Hamiltonian sizes
291 int numQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(minNumQb, 6+minNumQb) );
292 int numTerms = GENERATE_COPY( 1, minNumQb, 10*minNumQb );
293
294 // create a PauliHamil with random elements
295 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(numQb, numTerms);
296 setRandomDiagPauliHamil(hamil);
297
298 // write the Hamiltonian to file (with trailing whitespace, and trailing newline)
299 if (QUEST_ENV.rank == 0) {
300 FILE* file = fopen(fn, "w");
301 int i=0;
302 for (int n=0; n<numTerms; n++) {
303 fprintf(file, REAL_STRING_FORMAT, hamil.termCoeffs[n]);
304 fprintf(file, " ");
305 for (int q=0; q<numQb; q++)
306 fprintf(file, "%d ", (int) hamil.pauliCodes[i++]);
307 fprintf(file, "\n");
308 }
309 fprintf(file, "\n");
310 fclose(file);
311 }
312 syncQuESTEnv(QUEST_ENV);
313
314 // load the file as a diagonal operator, and compare
315 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOpFromPauliHamilFile(fn, QUEST_ENV);
316 REQUIRE( areEqual(toQMatrix(op), toQMatrix(hamil)) );
317
318 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
319 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
320 }
321 SECTION( "edge cases" ) {
322
323 // prepare a valid single-term diagonal Pauli Hamiltonian
324 qreal coeffs[] = {.1};
325 VLA(pauliOpType, codes, minNumQb);
326 for (int q=0; q<minNumQb; q++)
327 codes[q] = (q%2)? PAULI_I : PAULI_Z;
328
329 QMatrix ref = toQMatrix(coeffs, codes, minNumQb, 1);
330
331 // prepare basic encoding string
332 string line = to_string(coeffs[0]) + " ";
333 for (int q=0; q<minNumQb; q++)
334 line += to_string(codes[q]) + ((q<minNumQb-1)? " ":"");
335
336 SECTION( "no trailing newline or space" ) {
337
338 writeToFileSynch(fn, line);
339
340 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOpFromPauliHamilFile(fn, QUEST_ENV);
341 REQUIRE( areEqual(ref, toQMatrix(op)) );
342
343 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
344 }
345 SECTION( "trailing newlines" ) {
346
347 writeToFileSynch(fn, line + "\n\n\n");
348
349 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOpFromPauliHamilFile(fn, QUEST_ENV);
350 REQUIRE( areEqual(ref, toQMatrix(op)) );
351
352 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
353 }
354 SECTION( "trailing spaces" ) {
355
356 writeToFileSynch(fn, line + " ");
357
358 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOpFromPauliHamilFile(fn, QUEST_ENV);
359 REQUIRE( areEqual(ref, toQMatrix(op)) );
360
361 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
362 }
363 }
364 }
365 SECTION( "input validation") {
366
367 SECTION( "number of qubits" ) {
368
369 writeToFileSynch(fn, ".1 "); // 0 qubits
370 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createDiagonalOpFromPauliHamilFile(fn, QUEST_ENV), Contains("The number of qubits") && Contains("strictly positive"));
371 }
372 SECTION( "number of elements" ) {
373
374 // too many amplitudes to store in type
375 int maxQb = (int) calcLog2(SIZE_MAX);
376
377 // encode one more qubit than legal to file
378 string line = ".1 ";
379 for (int q=0; q<(maxQb+1); q++)
380 line += "3 "; // trailing space ok
381 writeToFileSynch(fn, line);
382
383 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createDiagonalOpFromPauliHamilFile(fn, QUEST_ENV), Contains("Too many qubits") && Contains("size_t type") );
384
385 // use local QuESTEnv to safely modify
386 QuESTEnv env = QUEST_ENV;
387
388 // too few elements to distribute
389 /* env.numRanks is an int, so maxQb must be capped at 32 for this
390 * test to avoid an integer overflow when storing 2**minQb in it
391 */
392 maxQb = maxQb > 32 ? 32 : maxQb;
393 int minQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(2,maxQb) );
394 env.numRanks = (int) pow(2, minQb);
395 int numQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,minQb) );
396
397 line = ".1 ";
398 for (int q=0; q<numQb; q++)
399 line += "3 "; // trailing space ok
400 setUniqueFilename(fn, fnPrefix);
401 writeToFileSynch(fn, line);
402
403 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createDiagonalOpFromPauliHamilFile(fn, env), Contains("Too few qubits") && Contains("distributed") );
404 }
405 SECTION( "coefficient type" ) {
406
407 writeToFileSynch(fn, "notanumber 1 2 3");
408 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createDiagonalOpFromPauliHamilFile(fn, QUEST_ENV), Contains("Failed to parse") && Contains("coefficient"));
409 }
410 SECTION( "pauli code" ) {
411
412 writeToFileSynch(fn, ".1 0 3 2"); // final is invalid Y
413 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createDiagonalOpFromPauliHamilFile(fn, QUEST_ENV), Contains("contained operators other than PAULI_Z and PAULI_I"));
414
415 setUniqueFilename(fn, fnPrefix);
416 writeToFileSynch(fn, ".1 0 1 3"); // second is invalid X
417 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createDiagonalOpFromPauliHamilFile(fn, QUEST_ENV), Contains("contained operators other than PAULI_Z and PAULI_I"));
418
419 setUniqueFilename(fn, fnPrefix);
420 writeToFileSynch(fn, ".1 0 1 4"); // final is invalid Pauli code
421 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createDiagonalOpFromPauliHamilFile(fn, QUEST_ENV), Contains("invalid pauli code"));
422
423 setUniqueFilename(fn, fnPrefix);
424 writeToFileSynch(fn, ".1 3 0 notanumber"); // final is invalid type
425 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createDiagonalOpFromPauliHamilFile(fn, QUEST_ENV), Contains("Failed to parse the next expected Pauli code"));
426 }
427 }
428
429 // delete all files created above
430 deleteFilesWithPrefixSynch(fnPrefix);
431}

TEST_CASE ( "createPauliHamil"  ,
""  [data_structures] 
)
See also
createPauliHamil
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 439 of file test_data_structures.cpp.

439 {
440
441 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
442
443 int numQb = GENERATE( range(1,5) );
444 int numTerms = GENERATE( range(1,5) );
445 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(numQb, numTerms);
446
447 // check fields are correct
448 REQUIRE( hamil.numQubits == numQb );
449 REQUIRE( hamil.numSumTerms == numTerms );
450
451 // check all Pauli codes are identity
452 int numPaulis = numQb * numTerms;
453 for (int i=0; i<numPaulis; i++) {
454 REQUIRE( hamil.pauliCodes[i] == PAULI_I );
455 }
456
457 // check all term coefficients can be written to (no seg fault)
458 for (int j=0; j<numTerms; j++) {
459 hamil.termCoeffs[j] = 1;
460 REQUIRE( hamil.termCoeffs[j] == 1 );
461 }
462
463 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
464 }
465 SECTION( "input validation") {
466
467 SECTION( "number of qubits" ) {
468
469 int numQb = GENERATE( -1, 0 );
470 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createPauliHamil(numQb, 1), Contains("The number of qubits and terms in the PauliHamil must be strictly positive.") );
471 }
472 SECTION( "number of terms" ) {
473
474 int numTerms = GENERATE( -1, 0 );
475 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createPauliHamil(1, numTerms), Contains("The number of qubits and terms in the PauliHamil must be strictly positive.") );
476 }
477 }
478}

int numQubits
The number of qubits informing the Hilbert dimension of the Hamiltonian.

TEST_CASE ( "createPauliHamilFromFile"  ,
""  [data_structures] 
)
See also
createPauliHamilFromFile
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 486 of file test_data_structures.cpp.

486 {
487
488 // files created & populated during the test, and deleted afterward
489 char fnPrefix[] = "temp_createPauliHamilFromFile";
490 char fn[100];
491
492 // each test uses a unique filename (managed by master node), to avoid file IO locks
493 // (it's safe for sub-test to overwrite this, since after each test, all files
494 // with prefix fnPrefix are deleted)
495 setUniqueFilename(fn, fnPrefix);
496
497 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
498
499 SECTION( "general" ) {
500
501 // for several sizes...
502 int numQb = GENERATE( 1, 5, 10, 15 );
503 int numTerms = GENERATE( 1, 10, 30 );
504 int numPaulis = numQb*numTerms;
505
506 // create a PauliHamil with random elements
507 VLA(qreal, coeffs, numTerms);
508 VLA(pauliOpType, paulis, numPaulis);
509 setRandomPauliSum(coeffs, paulis, numQb, numTerms);
510
511 // write the Hamiltonian to file (with trailing whitespace, and trailing newline)
512 if (QUEST_ENV.rank == 0) {
513 FILE* file = fopen(fn, "w");
514 int i=0;
515 for (int n=0; n<numTerms; n++) {
516 fprintf(file, REAL_STRING_FORMAT, coeffs[n]);
517 fprintf(file, " ");
518 for (int q=0; q<numQb; q++)
519 fprintf(file, "%d ", (int) paulis[i++]);
520 fprintf(file, "\n");
521 }
522 fprintf(file, "\n");
523 fclose(file);
524 }
525 syncQuESTEnv(QUEST_ENV);
526
527 // load the file as a PauliHamil
528 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamilFromFile(fn);
529
530 // check fields agree
531 REQUIRE( hamil.numQubits == numQb );
532 REQUIRE( hamil.numSumTerms == numTerms );
533
534 // check elements agree
535 int j=0;
536 for (int n=0; n<numTerms; n++) {
537 REQUIRE( absReal(hamil.termCoeffs[n] - coeffs[n]) <= REAL_EPS );
538 for (int q=0; q<numQb; q++) {
539 REQUIRE( hamil.pauliCodes[j] == paulis[j] );
540 j++;
541 }
542 }
543
544 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
545 }
546 SECTION( "edge cases" ) {
547
548 SECTION( "no trailing newline or space" ) {
549
550 writeToFileSynch(fn, ".1 1 0 1");
551
552 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamilFromFile(fn);
553 REQUIRE( hamil.numSumTerms == 1 );
554 REQUIRE( hamil.numQubits == 3 );
555
556 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
557 }
558 SECTION( "trailing newlines" ) {
559
560 writeToFileSynch(fn, ".1 1 0 1\n\n\n");
561
562 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamilFromFile(fn);
563 REQUIRE( hamil.numSumTerms == 1 );
564 REQUIRE( hamil.numQubits == 3 );
565
566 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
567 }
568 SECTION( "trailing spaces" ) {
569
570 writeToFileSynch(fn, ".1 1 0 1 ");
571
572 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamilFromFile(fn);
573 REQUIRE( hamil.numSumTerms == 1 );
574 REQUIRE( hamil.numQubits == 3 );
575
576 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
577 }
578 }
579 }
580 SECTION( "input validation") {
581
582 SECTION( "number of qubits" ) {
583
584 writeToFileSynch(fn, ".1 ");
585
586 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createPauliHamilFromFile(fn), Contains("The number of qubits") && Contains("strictly positive"));
587 }
588 SECTION( "coefficient type" ) {
589
590 writeToFileSynch(fn, "notanumber 1 2 3");
591
592 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createPauliHamilFromFile(fn), Contains("Failed to parse") && Contains("coefficient"));
593 }
594 SECTION( "pauli code" ) {
595
596 writeToFileSynch(fn, ".1 1 2 4"); // invalid int
597
598 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createPauliHamilFromFile(fn), Contains("invalid pauli code"));
599
600 setUniqueFilename(fn, fnPrefix);
601 writeToFileSynch(fn, ".1 1 2 notanumber"); // invalid type
602
603 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createPauliHamilFromFile(fn), Contains("Failed to parse the next expected Pauli code"));
604 }
605 }
606
607 // cleanup temp files
608 deleteFilesWithPrefixSynch(fn);
609}

PauliHamil createPauliHamilFromFile(char *fn)
Creates a PauliHamil instance, a real-weighted sum of products of Pauli operators,...
Definition: QuEST.c:1546

TEST_CASE ( "createQureg"  ,
""  [data_structures] 
)
See also
createQureg
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 629 of file test_data_structures.cpp.

629 {
630
631 // must be at least one amplitude per node
632 int minNumQb = calcLog2(QUEST_ENV.numRanks);
633 if (minNumQb == 0)
634 minNumQb = 1;
635
636 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
637
638 // try 10 valid number of qubits
639 int numQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(minNumQb, minNumQb+10) );
640 Qureg reg = createQureg(numQb, QUEST_ENV);
641
642 // ensure elems (CPU and/or GPU) are created, and reg begins in |0>
643 QVector ref = QVector(1<<numQb);
644 ref[0] = 1; // |0>
645 REQUIRE( areEqual(reg, ref) );
646
647 destroyQureg(reg, QUEST_ENV);
648 }
649 SECTION( "input validation") {
650
651 SECTION( "number of qubits" ) {
652

654 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createQureg(numQb, QUEST_ENV), Contains("Invalid number of qubits") );
655 }
656 SECTION( "number of amplitudes" ) {
657
658 // use local QuESTEnv to safely modify
659 QuESTEnv env = QUEST_ENV;
660
661 // too many amplitudes to store in type
662 int maxQb = (int) calcLog2(SIZE_MAX);
663 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createQureg(maxQb+1, env), Contains("Too many qubits") && Contains("size_t type") );
664
665 // too few amplitudes to distribute
666 /* env.numRanks is an int, so maxQb must be capped at 32 for this
667 * test to avoid an integer overflow when storing 2**minQb in it
668 */
669 maxQb = maxQb > 32 ? 32 : maxQb;
670 int minQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(2,maxQb) );
671 env.numRanks = (int) pow(2, minQb);
672 int numQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,minQb) );
673 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( createQureg(numQb, env), Contains("Too few qubits") );
674 }
675 SECTION( "available memory" ) {
676
677 /* there is no reliable way to force the malloc statements to
678 * fail, and hence trigger the matrixInit validation */
679 SUCCEED( );
680 }
681 }

)

690 {
691
692 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
693
694 int numQb = GENERATE( range(1,10+1) );
695 SubDiagonalOp op = createSubDiagonalOp(numQb);
696
697 // ensure elems are created and initialised to 0
698 REQUIRE( areEqual(toQMatrix(op), getZeroMatrix(1<<numQb)) );
699

701 }

TEST_CASE ( "destroyComplexMatrixN"  ,
""  [data_structures] 
)
See also
destroyComplexMatrixN
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 721 of file test_data_structures.cpp.

721 {
722
723 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
724
725 /* there is no meaningful way to test this */
726 SUCCEED( );
727 }
728 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
729
730 SECTION( "matrix not created" ) {
731
732 /* this is an artificial test case since nothing in the QuEST API
733 * automatically sets un-initialised ComplexMatrixN fields to
734 * the NULL pointer.
735 */
736 ComplexMatrixN m;
737 m.real = NULL;
738
739 /* the error message is also somewhat unrelated, but oh well
740 */
741 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( destroyComplexMatrixN(m), Contains("The ComplexMatrixN was not successfully created") );
742 }
743 }

""  [data_structures]

destroyPauliHamil
Author

Definition at line 764 of file test_data_structures.cpp.

764 {
765
766 /* there is no meaningful way to test this.
767 * We e.g. cannot check that the pointers are NULL because
768 * they are not updated; this function passes the struct by value,
769 * not by reference. We also cannot reliably monitor the
770 * memory used in the heap at runtime.
771 */
772 SUCCEED( );
773}

◆ TEST_CASE() [65/136]

Definition at line 793 of file test_data_structures.cpp.

793 {
794
795 /* there is no meaningful way to test this.
796 * We e.g. cannot check that the pointers are NULL because
797 * they are not updated; this function passes the struct by value,
798 * not by reference. We also cannot reliably monitor the
799 * memory used in the heap at runtime.
800 */
801 SUCCEED( );

◆ TEST_CASE() [67/136]

TEST_CASE ( "diagonalUnitary"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
diagonalUnitary
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 97 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

97 {
98
99 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
100
101 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
102
103 // generate all possible targets
104 int numTargs = GENERATE( range(1,NUM_QUBITS+1) );
105 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
106
107 // initialise a random unitary diagonal op
108 SubDiagonalOp op = createSubDiagonalOp(numTargs);
109 for (long long int i=0; i<op.numElems; i++) {
110 qcomp elem = getRandomComplex();
111 elem /= abs(elem);
112 op.real[i] = real(elem);
113 op.imag[i] = imag(elem);
114 }
115 QMatrix opMatr = toQMatrix(op);
116
117 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
118
119 diagonalUnitary(quregVec, targs, numTargs, op);
120 applyReferenceOp(refVec, targs, numTargs, opMatr);
121 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
122 }
123 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
124
125 diagonalUnitary(quregMatr, targs, numTargs, op);
126 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, targs, numTargs, opMatr);
127 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 100*REAL_EPS) );
128 }
129
130 destroySubDiagonalOp(op);
131 }
132 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
133
134 SECTION( "diagonal dimension" ) {
135
136 int numTargs = 3;
137 SubDiagonalOp op = createSubDiagonalOp(numTargs);
138
139 int badNumTargs = GENERATE_COPY( numTargs-1, numTargs+1 );
140 int badTargs[NUM_QUBITS+1];
141
142 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( diagonalUnitary(quregVec, badTargs, badNumTargs, op), Contains("incompatible dimension") );
143 destroySubDiagonalOp(op);
144 }
145 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
146
147 // make too many targets (which are otherwise valid)
148 SubDiagonalOp badOp = createSubDiagonalOp(NUM_QUBITS + 1);
149 int targs[NUM_QUBITS + 1];
150 for (int t=0; t<badOp.numQubits; t++)
151 targs[t] = t;
152 for (int i=0; i<badOp.numElems; i++)
153 badOp.real[i] = 1;
154
155 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( diagonalUnitary(quregVec, targs, badOp.numQubits, badOp), Contains("Invalid number of target qubits") );
156 destroySubDiagonalOp(badOp);
157 }
158 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
159
160 // make a valid unitary diagonal op
161 SubDiagonalOp op = createSubDiagonalOp(3);
162 for (int i=0; i<op.numElems; i++)
163 op.real[i] = 1;
164
165 // make a repetition in the target list
166 int targs[] = {2,1,2};
167
168 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( diagonalUnitary(quregVec, targs, op.numQubits, op), Contains("target qubits must be unique") );
169 destroySubDiagonalOp(op);
170 }
171 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
172
173 // make a valid unitary diagonal op
174 SubDiagonalOp op = createSubDiagonalOp(3);
175 for (int i=0; i<op.numElems; i++)
176 op.real[i] = 1;
177
178 int targs[] = {0,1,2};
179
180 // make each target in-turn invalid
181 int badIndex = GENERATE( range(0,3) );
182 int badValue = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
183 targs[badIndex] = badValue;
184
185 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( diagonalUnitary(quregVec, targs, op.numQubits, op), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
186 destroySubDiagonalOp(op);
187 }
188 SECTION( "unitarity" ) {
189
190 // make a valid unitary diagonal op
191 SubDiagonalOp op = createSubDiagonalOp(3);
192 int targs[] = {0,1,2};
193 for (int i=0; i<op.numElems; i++)
194 op.real[i] = 1;
195
196 // break unitarity via reals
197 op.real[2] = -.1;
198 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( diagonalUnitary(quregVec, targs, op.numQubits, op), Contains("unitary") );
199
200 // restore reals and break unitarity via imag
201 op.real[2] = 1;
202 op.imag[3] = -3.5;
203 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( diagonalUnitary(quregVec, targs, op.numQubits, op), Contains("unitary") );
204
205 destroySubDiagonalOp(op);
206 }
207 }
208 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
209}
diagonalUnitary
void diagonalUnitary(Qureg qureg, int *qubits, int numQubits, SubDiagonalOp op)
Apply a many-qubit unitary specified as a diagonal matrix upon a specific set of qubits of a quantum ...
Definition: QuEST.c:910

References applyReferenceOp(), areEqual(), createSubDiagonalOp(), destroySubDiagonalOp(), diagonalUnitary(), getRandomComplex(), SubDiagonalOp::imag, NUM_QUBITS, SubDiagonalOp::numElems, SubDiagonalOp::numQubits, PREPARE_TEST, qcomp, SubDiagonalOp::real, sublists(), and toQMatrix().

getNumQubits

Tyson Jones

1416 {
1417
1418 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1419
1420 // test >= NUM_QUBITS so as not to limit distribution size
1421 int numQb = GENERATE( range(NUM_QUBITS, NUM_QUBITS+10) );
1422
1423 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1424
1425 Qureg vec = createQureg(numQb, QUEST_ENV);
1426 REQUIRE( getNumQubits(vec) == numQb );
1427 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
1428 }
1429 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1430
1431 // density matrices use square as much memory; we must be careful not to seg-fault!
1432 if (2*numQb > 25)
1433 numQb = 13; // max size
1434
1435 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(numQb, QUEST_ENV);
1436 REQUIRE( getNumQubits(mat) == numQb );
1437 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
1438 }
1439 }
1440 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1441
1442 // no validation
1443 SUCCEED();
1444 }
1445}

TEST_CASE ( "hadamard"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)

hadamard
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 937 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

937 {
938
939 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
940 qreal a = 1/sqrt(2);
941 QMatrix op{{a,a},{a,-a}};
942
943 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
944
945 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
946
947 SECTION( "state-vector ") {
948
949 hadamard(quregVec, target);
950 applyReferenceOp(refVec, target, op);
951 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
952 }
953 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
954
955 hadamard(quregMatr, target);

958 }
959 }

966 }

◆ TEST_CASE() [81/136]

TEST_CASE ( "initDiagonalOp"  ,
""  [data_structures] 
)
See also
initDiagonalOp
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 834 of file test_data_structures.cpp.

834 {
835
836 // must be at least one amplitude per node
837 int minNumQb = calcLog2(QUEST_ENV.numRanks);
838 if (minNumQb == 0)
839 minNumQb = 1;
840
841 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
842
843 // try 10 valid number of qubits
844 int numQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(minNumQb, minNumQb+10) );
845 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOp(numQb, QUEST_ENV);
846
847 long long int len = (1LL << numQb);
848 VLA(qreal, reals, len);
849 VLA(qreal, imags, len);
850 long long int n;
851 for (n=0; n<len; n++) {
852 reals[n] = (qreal) n;
853 imags[n] = (qreal) -2*n; // (n - 2n i)
854 }
855 initDiagonalOp(op, reals, imags);
856
857 // check that op.real and op.imag were modified...
858 REQUIRE( areEqual(toQVector(op), reals, imags) );
859
860 // and also that GPU real and imag were modified
861 // via if it modifies an all-unity state-vec correctly
862 Qureg qureg = createQureg(numQb, QUEST_ENV);
863 for (long long int i=0; i<qureg.numAmpsPerChunk; i++) {
864 qureg.stateVec.real[i] = 1;
865 qureg.stateVec.imag[i] = 1;
866 }
867 copyStateToGPU(qureg);
868
869 QVector prodRef = toQMatrix(op) * toQVector(qureg);
870
871 // (n - 2n i) * (1 + 1i) = 3n - n*i
872 applyDiagonalOp(qureg, op);
873 copyStateFromGPU(qureg);
874 QVector result = toQVector(qureg);
875 REQUIRE( areEqual(prodRef, result) );
876
877 destroyQureg(qureg, QUEST_ENV);
878 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
879 }
880}

Definition: QuEST_cpu.c:43

TEST_CASE ( "initDiagonalOpFromPauliHamil"  ,
""  [data_structures] 
)
See also
initDiagonalOpFromPauliHamil
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 888 of file test_data_structures.cpp.

888 {
889
890 // distributed diagonal op must contain at least one amplitude per node
891 int minNumQb = calcLog2(QUEST_ENV.numRanks);
892 if (minNumQb == 0)
893 minNumQb = 1;
894
895 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
896
897 // try (at most) 10 valid number of qubits (even for validation)
898 int numQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(minNumQb, min(10,minNumQb+10)) );
899 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOp(numQb, QUEST_ENV);
900
901 // try several sized random all-Z Hamiltonians
902 int numTerms = GENERATE_COPY( 1, numQb, 5*numQb );
903 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(numQb, numTerms);
904 setRandomDiagPauliHamil(hamil);
905
906 initDiagonalOpFromPauliHamil(op, hamil);
907 REQUIRE( areEqual(toQMatrix(op), toQMatrix(hamil)) );
908
909 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
910 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
911 }
912 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
913
914 SECTION( "hamiltonian parameters" ) {
915
916 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOp(minNumQb, QUEST_ENV);
917 PauliHamil hamil;
918
919 hamil.numQubits = GENERATE( -1, 0 );
920 hamil.numSumTerms = 1;
921 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( initDiagonalOpFromPauliHamil(op, hamil), Contains("number of qubits") && Contains("strictly positive") );
922
923 hamil.numQubits = minNumQb;
924 hamil.numSumTerms = GENERATE( -1, 0 );
925 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( initDiagonalOpFromPauliHamil(op, hamil), Contains("terms") && Contains("strictly positive") );
926
927 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
928 }
929 SECTION( "mismatching dimensions" ) {
930
931 int numQbA = minNumQb+1;
932 int numQbB = GENERATE_COPY( numQbA-1, numQbA+1 );
933
934 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOp(numQbA, QUEST_ENV);
935 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(numQbB, 1);
936
937 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( initDiagonalOpFromPauliHamil(op, hamil), Contains("Pauli Hamiltonian and diagonal operator have different, incompatible dimensions") );
938
939 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
940 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
941 }
942 SECTION( "pauli codes" ) {
943
944 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOp(minNumQb, QUEST_ENV);
945 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(minNumQb, 5); // all I
946
947 // make only one code invalid
948 int numCodes = minNumQb * hamil.numSumTerms;
949 int ind = GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numCodes) );
950 hamil.pauliCodes[ind] = GENERATE( PAULI_X, PAULI_Y );
951
952 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( initDiagonalOpFromPauliHamil(op, hamil), Contains("contained operators other than PAULI_Z and PAULI_I") );
953
954 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
955 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
956 }
957 }
958}

TEST_CASE ( "initPauliHamil"  ,
""  [data_structures]

966 {
967
968 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
969
970 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(3, 2);
971
972 qreal coeffs[] = {-5, 5};
973 enum pauliOpType codes[] = {
974 PAULI_X, PAULI_Y, PAULI_Z,
975 PAULI_Z, PAULI_Y, PAULI_X};
976 initPauliHamil(hamil, coeffs, codes);
977
978 // check everything written correctly
979 for (int t=0; t<2; t++) {
980 REQUIRE( coeffs[t] == hamil.termCoeffs[t] );
981 for (int q=0; q<3; q++) {
982 int ind = 3*t+q;
983 REQUIRE( codes[ind] == hamil.pauliCodes[ind] );
984 }
985 }
986
987 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
988 }
989 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
990
991 SECTION( "parameters" ) {
992
993 // parameters checked before codes, so safe to leave un-initialised
994 qreal coeffs[1];
995 enum pauliOpType codes[1];
996 PauliHamil hamil;
997
998 hamil.numQubits = GENERATE( -1, 0 );
999 hamil.numSumTerms = 1;
1000 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( initPauliHamil(hamil, coeffs, codes), Contains("number of qubits") && Contains("strictly positive") );
1001
1002 hamil.numQubits = 1;
1003 hamil.numSumTerms = GENERATE( -1, 0 );
1004 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( initPauliHamil(hamil, coeffs, codes), Contains("terms") && Contains("strictly positive") );
1005 }
1006 SECTION( "Pauli codes" ) {
1007
1008 int numQb = 3;
1009 int numTerms = 2;
1010 int numCodes = numQb * numTerms;
1011 VLA(qreal, coeffs, numTerms);
1012 VLA(pauliOpType, codes, numCodes);
1013
1014 // make only one code invalid
1015 for (int i=0; i<numCodes; i++)
1016 codes[i] = PAULI_I;
1017 codes[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numCodes) )] = (pauliOpType) GENERATE( -1, 4 );
1018
1019 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(numQb, numTerms);
1020 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( initPauliHamil(hamil, coeffs, codes), Contains("Invalid Pauli code") );
1021 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
1022 }
1023 }
1024}

TEST_CASE ( "initPlusState"  ,
""  [state_initialisations] 
)
See also
initPlusState
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 166 of file test_state_initialisations.cpp.

166 {
167
168 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
169 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
170
171 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
172
173 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
174
175 // |+> = 1/sqrt(N^2) sum_i |i>
176 // = 1/sqrt(N^2) {1, ..., 1}
177 initPlusState(vec);
178 QVector vecRef = QVector(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
179 for (size_t i=0; i<vecRef.size(); i++)
180 vecRef[i] = 1./sqrt(pow(2,NUM_QUBITS));
181 REQUIRE( areEqual(vec, vecRef) );
182 }
183 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
184
185 // |+><+| = 1/sqrt(N^2) sum_i |i> 1/sqrt(N^2) sum_j <j|
186 // = 1/(N^2) sum_{ij} |i><j|
187 // = 1/(N^2) {{1, ..., 1}, ...}
188 initPlusState(mat);
189 QMatrix matRef = getZeroMatrix(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
190 for (size_t i=0; i<matRef.size(); i++)
191 for (size_t j=0; j<matRef.size(); j++)
192 matRef[i][j] = 1./pow(2, NUM_QUBITS);
193 REQUIRE( areEqual(mat, matRef) );
194 }
195 }
196 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
197
198 // no user validation
199 SUCCEED( );
200 }
201 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
202 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
203}

References areEqual(), createDensityQureg(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), getZeroMatrix(), initPlusState(), NUM_QUBITS, and QUEST_ENV.

◆ TEST_CASE() [85/136]

TEST_CASE ( "initPureState"  ,
""  [state_initialisations] 
)
See also
initPureState
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 211 of file test_state_initialisations.cpp.

211 {
212
213 Qureg vec1 = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
214 Qureg mat1 = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
215
216 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
217
218 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
219
220 /* state-vector version just performs cloneQureg */
221
222 Qureg vec2 = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
223
224 // make sure states start differently
225 initDebugState(vec1);
226 initBlankState(vec2);
227 REQUIRE( !areEqual(vec1, vec2) );
228
229 // make sure vec2 is overwritten with vec1
230 QVector copy1 = toQVector(vec1);
231 initPureState(vec2, vec1);
232 REQUIRE( areEqual(vec1, vec2) );
233
234 // make sure vec1 was not modified
235 REQUIRE( areEqual(vec1, copy1) );
236
237 destroyQureg(vec2, QUEST_ENV);
238 }
239 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
240
241 /* density matrix version initialises matrix in |pure><pure| */
242
243 initDebugState(vec1); // |vec1> = sum_i a_i |i>
244 QVector copy1 = toQVector(vec1);
245
246 // make sure mat1 is modified correctly
247 initBlankState(mat1);
248 initPureState(mat1, vec1); // mat1 = |vec1><vec1| = sum_{ij} a_i a_j* |i><j|
249
250 QMatrix matRef = getZeroMatrix(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
251 for (size_t i=0; i<matRef.size(); i++)
252 for (size_t j=0; j<matRef.size(); j++)
253 matRef[i][j] = copy1[i] * conj(copy1[j]);
254 REQUIRE( areEqual(mat1, matRef) );
255
256 // make sure vec1 was not modified
257 REQUIRE( areEqual(vec1, copy1) );
258 }
259 }
260 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
261
262 SECTION( "qureg types" ) {
263
264 // density matrix as second arg is illegal (regardless of first arg)
265 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( initPureState(vec1, mat1), Contains("Second argument must be a state-vector") );
266 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( initPureState(mat1, mat1), Contains("Second argument must be a state-vector") );
267 }
268 SECTION( "qureg dimensions" ) {
269
270 Qureg vec2 = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS + 1, QUEST_ENV);
271 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( initPureState(vec1, vec2), Contains("Dimensions") && Contains("don't match") );
272 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( initPureState(mat1, vec2), Contains("Dimensions") && Contains("don't match") );
273 destroyQureg(vec2, QUEST_ENV);
274 }
275 }
276 destroyQureg(vec1, QUEST_ENV);
277 destroyQureg(mat1, QUEST_ENV);
278}

TEST_CASE ( "initStateFromAmps"  ,
""  [state_initialisations] 
)
See also
initStateFromAmps
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 286 of file test_state_initialisations.cpp.

286 {
287
288 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
289 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
290
291 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
292
293 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
294
295 // create random (unnormalised) vector
296 QVector vecRef = getRandomQVector(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
297
298 VLA(qreal, ampsRe, vec.numAmpsTotal);
299 VLA(qreal, ampsIm, vec.numAmpsTotal);
300 for (size_t i=0; i<vecRef.size(); i++) {
301 ampsRe[i] = real(vecRef[i]);
302 ampsIm[i] = imag(vecRef[i]);
303 }
304
305 initStateFromAmps(vec, ampsRe, ampsIm);
306 REQUIRE( areEqual(vec, vecRef) );
307 }
308 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
309
310 // create random (unnormalised) matrix
311 QMatrix matRef = getRandomQMatrix(1<<NUM_QUBITS);
312
313 VLA(qreal, ampsRe, mat.numAmpsTotal);
314 VLA(qreal, ampsIm, mat.numAmpsTotal);
315
316 // populate column-wise
317 long long int i=0;
318 for (size_t c=0; c<matRef.size(); c++) {
319 for (size_t r=0; r<matRef.size(); r++) {
320 ampsRe[i] = real(matRef[r][c]);
321 ampsIm[i] = imag(matRef[r][c]);
322 i++;
323 }
324 }
325
326 initStateFromAmps(mat, ampsRe, ampsIm);
327 REQUIRE( areEqual(mat, matRef) );
328 }
329 }
330 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
331 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
332}

void initStateFromAmps(Qureg qureg, qreal *reals, qreal *imags)

◆ TEST_CASE() [88/136]

TEST_CASE ( "measure"  ,
""  [gates] 
)
See also
measure
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 121 of file test_gates.cpp.

121 {
122
123 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
124 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
125
126 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
127
128 int qubit = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
129
130 // repeat these random tests 10 times on every qubit
131 GENERATE( range(0,10) );
132
133 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
134
135 QVector vecRef = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
136 toQureg(vec, vecRef);
137
138 int outcome = measure(vec, qubit);
139 REQUIRE( (outcome == 0 || outcome == 1) );
140
141 // calculate prob of this outcome
142 qreal prob = 0;
143 for (size_t ind=0; ind<vecRef.size(); ind++) {
144 int bit = (ind >> qubit) & 1; // target-th bit
145 if (bit == outcome)
146 prob += pow(abs(vecRef[ind]), 2);
147 }
148
149 REQUIRE( prob > REAL_EPS );
150
151 // renormalise by the outcome prob
152 for (size_t ind=0; ind<vecRef.size(); ind++) {
153 int bit = (ind >> qubit) & 1; // target-th bit
154 if (bit == outcome)
155 vecRef[ind] /= sqrt(prob);
156 else
157 vecRef[ind] = 0;
158 }
159 REQUIRE( areEqual(vec, vecRef) );
160 }
161 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
162
163 QMatrix matRef = getRandomDensityMatrix(NUM_QUBITS);
164 toQureg(mat, matRef);
165
166 int outcome = measure(mat, qubit);
167 REQUIRE( (outcome == 0 || outcome == 1) );
168
169 // compute prob of this outcome
170 qreal prob = 0;
171 for (size_t ind=0; ind<matRef.size(); ind++) {
172 int bit = (ind >> qubit) & 1; // qubit-th bit
173 if (bit == outcome)
174 prob += real(matRef[ind][ind]);
175 }
176
177 REQUIRE( prob > REAL_EPS );
178
179 // renorm (/prob) every |*outcome*><*outcome*| state, zeroing all others
180 for (size_t r=0; r<matRef.size(); r++) {
181 for (size_t c=0; c<matRef.size(); c++) {
182 int ketBit = (c >> qubit) & 1;
183 int braBit = (r >> qubit) & 1;
184
185 if (ketBit == outcome && braBit == outcome)
186 matRef[r][c] /= prob;
187 else
188 matRef[r][c] = 0;
189 }
190 }
191
192 REQUIRE( areEqual(mat, matRef) );
193 }
194 }
195 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
196
197 SECTION( "qubit index" ) {
198
199 int qubit = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
200 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( measure(vec, qubit), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
201 }
202 }
203 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
204 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
205}
measure
int measure(Qureg qureg, int measureQubit)
Measures a single qubit, collapsing it randomly to 0 or 1.
Definition: QuEST.c:1026

References areEqual(), createDensityQureg(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), getRandomDensityMatrix(), getRandomStateVector(), measure(), NUM_QUBITS, qreal, QUEST_ENV, and toQureg().

◆ TEST_CASE() [89/136]

TEST_CASE ( "measureWithStats"  ,
""  [gates] 
)
See also
measureWithStats
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 213 of file test_gates.cpp.

213 {
214
215 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
216 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
217
218 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
219
220 int qubit = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
221
222 // repeat these random tests 10 times on every qubit
223 GENERATE( range(0,10) );
224
225 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
226
227 QVector vecRef = getRandomStateVector(NUM_QUBITS);
228 toQureg(vec, vecRef);
229
230 qreal res;
231 int outcome = measureWithStats(vec, qubit, &res);
232 REQUIRE( (outcome == 0 || outcome == 1) );
233
234 // calculate prob of this outcome
235 qreal prob = 0;
236 for (size_t ind=0; ind<vecRef.size(); ind++) {
237 int bit = (ind >> qubit) & 1; // target-th bit
238 if (bit == outcome)
239 prob += pow(abs(vecRef[ind]), 2);
240 }
241
242 REQUIRE( prob == Approx(res) );
243
244 // renormalise by the outcome prob
245 for (size_t ind=0; ind<vecRef.size(); ind++) {
246 int bit = (ind >> qubit) & 1; // target-th bit
247 if (bit == outcome)
248 vecRef[ind] /= sqrt(prob);
249 else
250 vecRef[ind] = 0;
251 }
252 REQUIRE( areEqual(vec, vecRef) );
253 }
254 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
255
256 QMatrix matRef = getRandomDensityMatrix(NUM_QUBITS);
257 toQureg(mat, matRef);
258
259 qreal res;
260 int outcome = measureWithStats(mat, qubit, &res);
261 REQUIRE( (outcome == 0 || outcome == 1) );
262
263 // compute prob of this outcome
264 qreal prob = 0;
265 for (size_t ind=0; ind<matRef.size(); ind++) {
266 int bit = (ind >> qubit) & 1; // qubit-th bit
267 if (bit == outcome)
268 prob += real(matRef[ind][ind]);
269 }
270
271 REQUIRE( prob == Approx(res) );
272
273 // renorm (/prob) every |*outcome*><*outcome*| state, zeroing all others
274 for (size_t r=0; r<matRef.size(); r++) {
275 for (size_t c=0; c<matRef.size(); c++) {
276 int ketBit = (c >> qubit) & 1;
277 int braBit = (r >> qubit) & 1;
278
279 if (ketBit == outcome && braBit == outcome)
280 matRef[r][c] /= prob;
281 else
282 matRef[r][c] = 0;
283 }
284 }
285
286 REQUIRE( areEqual(mat, matRef) );
287 }
288 }
289 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
290
291 SECTION( "qubit index" ) {
292
293 int qubit = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
294 qreal res;
295 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( measureWithStats(vec, qubit, &res), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
296 }
297 }
298 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
299 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
300}
measureWithStats
int measureWithStats(Qureg qureg, int measureQubit, qreal *outcomeProb)
Measures a single qubit, collapsing it randomly to 0 or 1, and additionally gives the probability of ...
Definition: QuEST.c:1013

References areEqual(), createDensityQureg(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), getRandomDensityMatrix(), getRandomStateVector(), measureWithStats(), NUM_QUBITS, qreal, QUEST_ENV, and toQureg().

◆ TEST_CASE() [90/136]

TEST_CASE ( "mixDamping"  ,
""  [decoherence] 
)
See also
mixDamping
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 23 of file test_decoherence.cpp.

23 {
24
25 PREPARE_TEST(qureg, ref);
26
27 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
28
29 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
30 qreal prob = getRandomReal(0, 1);
31 mixDamping(qureg, target, prob);
32
33 // ref -> kraus0 ref kraus0^dagger + kraus1 ref kraus1^dagger
34 QMatrix kraus0{{1,0},{0,sqrt(1-prob)}};
35 QMatrix rho0 = ref;
36 applyReferenceOp(rho0, target, kraus0);
37 QMatrix kraus1{{0,sqrt(prob)},{0,0}};
38 QMatrix rho1 = ref;
39 applyReferenceOp(rho1, target, kraus1);
40 ref = rho0 + rho1;
41
42 REQUIRE( areEqual(qureg, ref) );
43 }
44 SECTION( "validation ") {
45
46 SECTION( "qubit index" ) {
47
48 int target = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
49 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDamping(qureg, target, 0), Contains("Invalid target") );
50
51 }
52 SECTION( "probability" ) {
53
54 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDamping(qureg, 0, -.1), Contains("Probabilities") );
55 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDamping(qureg, 0, 1.1), Contains("Probabilities") );
56 }
57 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
58
59 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
60 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDamping(vec, 0, 0), Contains("density matrices") );
61 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
62 }
63 }
64 destroyQureg(qureg, QUEST_ENV);
65}
mixDamping

Mixes a density matrix qureg to induce single-qubit amplitude damping (decay to 0 state).

Prepares a density matrix in the debug state, and the reference QMatrix.

TEST_CASE ( "mixDensityMatrix"  ,
""  [decoherence] 
)
See also
mixDensityMatrix
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 73 of file test_decoherence.cpp.

73 {
74
75 Qureg qureg1 = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
76 Qureg qureg2 = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
77 initDebugState(qureg1);
78 initDebugState(qureg2);
79 QMatrix ref1 = toQMatrix(qureg1);
80 QMatrix ref2 = toQMatrix(qureg2);
81
82 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
83
84 // test p in {0, 1} and 10 random values in (0,1)
85 qreal prob = GENERATE( 0., 1., take(10, random(0.,1.)) );
86 mixDensityMatrix(qureg1, prob, qureg2);
87
88 // ensure target qureg modified correctly
89 ref1 = (1-prob)*ref1 + (prob)*ref2;
90 REQUIRE( areEqual(qureg1, ref1) );
91
92 // enure other qureg was not modified
93 REQUIRE( areEqual(qureg2, ref2) );
94 }
95 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
96
97 SECTION( "probabilities") {
98
99 qreal prob = GENERATE( -0.1, 1.1 );
100 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDensityMatrix(qureg1, prob, qureg2), Contains("Probabilities") );
101 }
102 SECTION( "density matrices" ) {
103
104 // one is statevec
105 Qureg state1 = createQureg(qureg1.numQubitsRepresented, QUEST_ENV);
106 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDensityMatrix(qureg1, 0, state1), Contains("density matrices") );
107 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDensityMatrix(state1, 0, qureg1), Contains("density matrices") );
108
109 // both are statevec
110 Qureg state2 = createQureg(qureg1.numQubitsRepresented, QUEST_ENV);
111 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDensityMatrix(state1, 0, state2), Contains("density matrices") );
112
113 destroyQureg(state1, QUEST_ENV);
114 destroyQureg(state2, QUEST_ENV);
115 }
116 SECTION( "matching dimensions" ) {
117
118 Qureg qureg3 = createDensityQureg(1 + qureg1.numQubitsRepresented, QUEST_ENV);
119 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDensityMatrix(qureg1, 0, qureg3), Contains("Dimensions") );
120 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDensityMatrix(qureg3, 0, qureg1), Contains("Dimensions") );
121 destroyQureg(qureg3, QUEST_ENV);
122 }
123 }
124 destroyQureg(qureg1, QUEST_ENV);
125 destroyQureg(qureg2, QUEST_ENV);
126}

TEST_CASE ( "mixDephasing"  ,
""  [decoherence] 
)
See also
mixDephasing
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 134 of file test_decoherence.cpp.

134 {
135
136 PREPARE_TEST(qureg, ref);
137
138 SECTION( "correctness " ) {
139
140 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
141 qreal prob = getRandomReal(0, 1/2.);
142 mixDephasing(qureg, target, prob);
143
144 // ref -> (1 - prob) ref + prob Z ref Z
145 QMatrix phaseRef = ref;
146 applyReferenceOp(phaseRef, target, QMatrix{{1,0},{0,-1}}); // Z ref Z
147 ref = ((1 - prob) * ref) + (prob * phaseRef);
148
149 REQUIRE( areEqual(qureg, ref) );
150 }
151 SECTION( "validation ") {
152
153 SECTION( "qubit index" ) {
154
155 int target = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
156 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDephasing(qureg, target, 0), Contains("Invalid target") );
157
158 }
159 SECTION( "probability" ) {
160
161 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDephasing(qureg, 0, -.1), Contains("Probabilities") );
162 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDephasing(qureg, 0, .6), Contains("probability") && Contains("cannot exceed 1/2") );
163 }
164 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
165
166 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
167 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDephasing(vec, 0, 0), Contains("density matrices") );
168 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
169 }
170 }
171 destroyQureg(qureg, QUEST_ENV);
172}

TEST_CASE ( "mixDepolarising"  ,
""  [decoherence] 
)
See also
mixDepolarising
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 180 of file test_decoherence.cpp.

180 {
181
182 PREPARE_TEST(qureg, ref);
183
184 SECTION( "correctness " ) {
185
186 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
187 qreal prob = getRandomReal(0, 3/4.);
188 mixDepolarising(qureg, target, prob);
189
190 QMatrix xRef = ref;
191 applyReferenceOp(xRef, target, QMatrix{{0,1},{1,0}}); // X ref X
192 QMatrix yRef = ref;
193 applyReferenceOp(yRef, target, QMatrix{{0,-qcomp(0,1)},{qcomp(0,1),0}}); // Y ref Y
194 QMatrix zRef = ref;
195 applyReferenceOp(zRef, target, QMatrix{{1,0},{0,-1}}); // Z ref Z
196 ref = ((1 - prob) * ref) + ((prob/3.) * ( xRef + yRef + zRef));
197
198 REQUIRE( areEqual(qureg, ref) );
199 }
200 SECTION( "validation ") {
201
202 SECTION( "qubit index" ) {
203
204 int target = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
205 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDepolarising(qureg, target, 0), Contains("Invalid target") );
206
207 }
208 SECTION( "probability" ) {
209
210 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDepolarising(qureg, 0, -.1), Contains("Probabilities") );
211 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDepolarising(qureg, 0, .76), Contains("probability") && Contains("cannot exceed 3/4") );
212 }
213 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
214
215 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
216 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixDepolarising(vec, 0, 0), Contains("density matrices") );
217 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
218 }
219 }
220 destroyQureg(qureg, QUEST_ENV);
221}

TEST_CASE ( "mixKrausMap"  ,
""  [decoherence] 
)
See also
mixKrausMap
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 525 of file test_decoherence.cpp.

525 {
526
527 PREPARE_TEST(qureg, ref);
528
529 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
530
531 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
532 int numOps = GENERATE( range(1,5) ); // max 4 inclusive
533 std::vector<QMatrix> matrs = getRandomKrausMap(1, numOps);
534
535 VLA(ComplexMatrix2, ops, numOps);
536 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
537 ops[i] = toComplexMatrix2(matrs[i]);
538 mixKrausMap(qureg, target, ops, numOps);
539
540 // set ref -> K_i ref K_i^dagger
541 VLA(QMatrix, matrRefs, numOps);
542 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++) {
543 matrRefs[i] = ref;
544 applyReferenceOp(matrRefs[i], target, matrs[i]);
545 }
546 ref = getZeroMatrix(ref.size());
547 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
548 ref += matrRefs[i];
549
550 REQUIRE( areEqual(qureg, ref, 10*REAL_EPS) );
551 }
552 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
553
554 SECTION( "number of operators" ) {
555
556 int numOps = GENERATE( 0, 5 );
557 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixKrausMap(qureg, 0, NULL, numOps), Contains("operators") );
558 }
559 SECTION( "trace preserving" ) {
560
561 // valid Kraus map
562 int numOps = GENERATE( range(1,5) ); // max 4 inclusive
563 std::vector<QMatrix> matrs = getRandomKrausMap(1, numOps);
564 VLA(ComplexMatrix2, ops, numOps);
565 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
566 ops[i] = toComplexMatrix2(matrs[i]);
567
568 // make invalid
569 ops[GENERATE_REF( range(0,numOps) )].real[0][0] = 0;
570 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixKrausMap(qureg, 0, ops, numOps), Contains("trace preserving") );
571
572 }
573 SECTION( "qubit index" ) {
574
575 int target = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
576 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixKrausMap(qureg, target, NULL, 1), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
577 }
578 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
579
580 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
581 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixKrausMap(vec, 0, NULL, 1), Contains("density matrices") );
582 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
583 }
584 SECTION( "operators fit in node" ) {
585
586 qureg.numAmpsPerChunk = 3; // min 4
587 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixKrausMap(qureg, 0, NULL, 1), Contains("targets too many qubits") );
588 }
589 }
590 destroyQureg(qureg, QUEST_ENV);
591}
mixKrausMap
void mixKrausMap(Qureg qureg, int target, ComplexMatrix2 *ops, int numOps)
Apply a general single-qubit Kraus map to a density matrix, as specified by at most four Kraus operat...

getRandomKrausMap
std::vector< QMatrix > getRandomKrausMap(int numQb, int numOps)
Returns a random Kraus map of #numOps 2^numQb-by-2^numQb operators, from an undisclosed distribution.
Definition: utilities.cpp:579

References applyReferenceOp(), areEqual(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), getRandomKrausMap(), getZeroMatrix(), mixKrausMap(), NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, QUEST_ENV, ComplexMatrix2::real, toComplexMatrix2(), and VLA.
