TEST_CASE ( "mixMultiQubitKrausMap"  ,
""  [decoherence] 
)
See also
mixMultiQubitKrausMap
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 229 of file test_decoherence.cpp.

229 {
230
231 PREPARE_TEST(qureg, ref);
232
233 // figure out max-num (inclusive) targs allowed by hardware backend
234 // (each node must contain as 2^(2*numTargs) amps)
235 int maxNumTargs = calcLog2(qureg.numAmpsPerChunk) / 2;
236
237 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
238
239 /* note that this function incurs a stack overhead when numTargs < 4,
240 * and a heap overhead when numTargs >= 4
241 */
242
243 // try every size (qubit wise) map
244 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumTargs+1) ); // inclusive upper bound
245
246 // previously, we tried every unique set of targets, via:
247 // int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
248 // alas, this is too slow for CI, so we instead try a fixed number of random sets:
249 GENERATE( range(0, 10) );
250 VLA(int, targs, numTargs);
251 setRandomTargets(targs, numTargs, NUM_QUBITS);
252
253 // try the min and max number of operators, and 2 random numbers
254 // (there are way too many to try all!)
255 int maxNumOps = (2*numTargs)*(2*numTargs);
256 int numOps = GENERATE_COPY( 1, maxNumOps, take(2,random(1,maxNumOps)) );
257
258 // use a new random map
259 std::vector<QMatrix> matrs = getRandomKrausMap(numTargs, numOps);
260
261 // create map in QuEST datatypes
262 VLA(ComplexMatrixN, ops, numOps);
263 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++) {
264 ops[i] = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs);
265 toComplexMatrixN(matrs[i], ops[i]);
266 }
267
268 mixMultiQubitKrausMap(qureg, targs, numTargs, ops, numOps);
269
270 // set ref -> K_i ref K_i^dagger
271 VLA(QMatrix, matrRefs, numOps);
272 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++) {
273 matrRefs[i] = ref;
274 applyReferenceOp(matrRefs[i], targs, numTargs, matrs[i]);
275 }
276 ref = getZeroMatrix(ref.size());
277 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
278 ref += matrRefs[i];
279
280 REQUIRE( areEqual(qureg, ref, 1E2*REAL_EPS) );
281
282 // cleanup QuEST datatypes
283 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
284 destroyComplexMatrixN(ops[i]);
285 }
286 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
287
288 SECTION( "repetition of target" ) {
289
290 // make valid targets
291 int targs[NUM_QUBITS];
292 for (int i=0; i<NUM_QUBITS; i++)
293 targs[i] = i;
294
295 // duplicate one
296 int badInd = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
297 int copyInd = GENERATE_COPY( filter([=](int i){ return i!=badInd; }, range(0,NUM_QUBITS)) );
298 targs[badInd] = targs[copyInd];
299
300 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixMultiQubitKrausMap(qureg, targs, NUM_QUBITS, NULL, 1), Contains("target qubits") && Contains("unique") );
301 }
302 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
303
304 // make valid targets
305 int targs[NUM_QUBITS];
306 for (int i=0; i<NUM_QUBITS; i++)
307 targs[i] = i;
308
309 // make one invalid
310 targs[GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) )] = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
311
312 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixMultiQubitKrausMap(qureg, targs, NUM_QUBITS, NULL, 1), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
313 }
314 SECTION( "number of operators" ) {
315
316 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumTargs+1) );
317 int maxNumOps = (2*numTargs)*(2*numTargs);
318 int numOps = GENERATE_REF( -1, 0, maxNumOps + 1 );
319
320 // make valid targets to avoid triggering target validation
321 VLA(int, targs, numTargs);
322 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++)
323 targs[i] = i;
324 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixMultiQubitKrausMap(qureg, targs, numTargs, NULL, numOps), Contains("operators may be specified") );
325 }
326 SECTION( "initialisation of operators" ) {
327
328 /* compilers don't auto-initialise to NULL; the below circumstance
329 * only really occurs when 'malloc' returns NULL in createComplexMatrixN,
330 * which actually triggers its own validation. Hence this test is useless
331 * currently.
332 */
333
334 int numTargs = NUM_QUBITS;
335 int numOps = (2*numTargs)*(2*numTargs);
336
337 // no need to initialise ops, but set their attribs correct to avoid triggering other validation
338 VLA(ComplexMatrixN, ops, numOps);
339 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
340 ops[i].numQubits = numTargs;
341
342 // make one of the max-ops explicitly NULL
343 ops[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTargs) )].real = NULL;
344
345 // make valid targets to avoid triggering target validation
346 VLA(int, targs, numTargs);
347 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++)
348 targs[i] = i;
349
350 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixMultiQubitKrausMap(qureg, targs, numTargs, ops, numOps), Contains("ComplexMatrixN") && Contains("created") );
351 }
352 SECTION( "dimension of operators" ) {
353
354 // make valid (dimension-wise) max-qubits Kraus map
355 int numTargs = NUM_QUBITS;
356 int numOps = (2*numTargs)*(2*numTargs);
357 VLA(ComplexMatrixN, ops, numOps);
358 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
359 ops[i] = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs);
360
361 // make one have wrong-dimensions
362 int badInd = GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTargs) );
363 destroyComplexMatrixN(ops[badInd]);
364 ops[badInd] = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs - 1);
365
366 // make valid targets to avoid triggering target validation
367 VLA(int, targs, numTargs);
368 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++)
369 targs[i] = i;
370
371 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixMultiQubitKrausMap(qureg, targs, numTargs, ops, numOps), Contains("same number of qubits") );
372
373 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
374 destroyComplexMatrixN(ops[i]);
375 }
376 SECTION( "trace preserving" ) {
377
378 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumTargs+1) );
379 int maxNumOps = (2*numTargs) * (2*numTargs);
380 int numOps = GENERATE_COPY( 1, 2, maxNumOps );
381
382 // generate a valid map
383 std::vector<QMatrix> matrs = getRandomKrausMap(numTargs, numOps);
384 VLA(ComplexMatrixN, ops, numOps);
385 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++) {
386 ops[i] = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs);
387 toComplexMatrixN(matrs[i], ops[i]);
388 }
389
390 // make only one invalid
391 ops[GENERATE_REF( range(0,numOps) )].real[0][0] = 0;
392
393 // make valid targets to avoid triggering target validation
394 VLA(int, targs, numTargs);
395 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++)
396 targs[i] = i;
397
398 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixMultiQubitKrausMap(qureg, targs, numTargs, ops, numOps), Contains("trace preserving") );
399
400 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
401 destroyComplexMatrixN(ops[i]);
402 }
403 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
404
405 Qureg statevec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
406
407 // make valid targets to avoid triggering target validation
408 int targs[NUM_QUBITS];
409 for (int i=0; i<NUM_QUBITS; i++)
410 targs[i] = i;
411
412 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixMultiQubitKrausMap(statevec, targs, NUM_QUBITS, NULL, 1), Contains("valid only for density matrices") );
413 destroyQureg(statevec, QUEST_ENV);
414
415 }
416 SECTION( "operator fits in node" ) {
417
418 // each node requires (2 numTargs)^2 amplitudes
419 int minAmps = (2*NUM_QUBITS) * (2*NUM_QUBITS);
420
421 // make valid targets to avoid triggering target validation
422 int targs[NUM_QUBITS];
423 for (int i=0; i<NUM_QUBITS; i++)
424 targs[i] = i;
425
426 // make a simple Identity map
427 ComplexMatrixN ops[] = {createComplexMatrixN(NUM_QUBITS)};
428 for (int i=0; i<(1<<NUM_QUBITS); i++)
429 ops[0].real[i][i] = 1;
430
431 // fake a smaller qureg
432 qureg.numAmpsPerChunk = minAmps - 1;
433 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixMultiQubitKrausMap(qureg, targs, NUM_QUBITS, ops, 1), Contains("targets too many qubits") && Contains("cannot all fit") );
434
435 destroyComplexMatrixN(ops[0]);
436 }
437 }
438 destroyQureg(qureg, QUEST_ENV);
439}
mixMultiQubitKrausMap
void mixMultiQubitKrausMap(Qureg qureg, int *targets, int numTargets, ComplexMatrixN *ops, int numOps)
Apply a general N-qubit Kraus map to a density matrix, as specified by at most (2N)^2 Kraus operators...
Definition: QuEST.c:1430

TEST_CASE ( "mixNonTPKrausMap"  ,
""  [decoherence] 
)
See also
mixNonTPKrausMap
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 599 of file test_decoherence.cpp.

599 {
600
601 PREPARE_TEST(qureg, ref);
602
603 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
604
605 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
606 int numOps = GENERATE( range(1,5) ); // max 4 inclusive
607
608 // map consists of unconstrained 2x2 random matrices
609 std::vector<QMatrix> matrs;
610 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
611 matrs.push_back(getRandomQMatrix(2));
612
613 VLA(ComplexMatrix2, ops, numOps);
614 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
615 ops[i] = toComplexMatrix2(matrs[i]);
616 mixNonTPKrausMap(qureg, target, ops, numOps);
617
618 // set ref -> K_i ref K_i^dagger
619 VLA(QMatrix, matrRefs, numOps);
620 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++) {
621 matrRefs[i] = ref;
622 applyReferenceOp(matrRefs[i], target, matrs[i]);
623 }
624 ref = getZeroMatrix(ref.size());
625 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
626 ref += matrRefs[i];
627
628 REQUIRE( areEqual(qureg, ref, 1E2*REAL_EPS) );
629 }
630 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
631
632 SECTION( "number of operators" ) {
633
634 int numOps = GENERATE( 0, 5 );
635 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPKrausMap(qureg, 0, NULL, numOps), Contains("operators") );
636 }
637 SECTION( "qubit index" ) {
638
639 int target = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
640 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPKrausMap(qureg, target, NULL, 1), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
641 }
642 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
643
644 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
645 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPKrausMap(vec, 0, NULL, 1), Contains("density matrices") );
646 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
647 }
648 SECTION( "operators fit in node" ) {
649
650 qureg.numAmpsPerChunk = 3; // min 4
651 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPKrausMap(qureg, 0, NULL, 1), Contains("targets too many qubits") );
652 }
653 }
654 destroyQureg(qureg, QUEST_ENV);
655}

TEST_CASE ( "mixNonTPMultiQubitKrausMap"  ,
""  [decoherence] 
)
See also
mixNonTPMultiQubitKrausMap
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 663 of file test_decoherence.cpp.

663 {
664
665 PREPARE_TEST(qureg, ref);
666
667 // figure out max-num (inclusive) targs allowed by hardware backend
668 // (each node must contain as 2^(2*numTargs) amps)
669 int maxNumTargs = calcLog2(qureg.numAmpsPerChunk) / 2;
670
671 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
672
673 /* note that this function incurs a stack overhead when numTargs < 4,
674 * and a heap overhead when numTargs >= 4
675 */
676
677 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumTargs+1) ); // inclusive upper bound
678
679 // previously, we tried every unique set of targets, via:
680 // int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
681 // alas, this is too slow for CI, so we instead try a fixed number of random sets:
682 GENERATE( range(0, 10) );
683 VLA(int, targs, numTargs);
684 setRandomTargets(targs, numTargs, NUM_QUBITS);
685
686 // try the min and max number of operators, and 2 random numbers
687 // (there are way too many to try all!)
688 int maxNumOps = (2*numTargs)*(2*numTargs);
689 int numOps = GENERATE_COPY( 1, maxNumOps, take(2,random(1,maxNumOps)) );
690
691 // use a new random map, of unconstrained random (2^numTargs x 2^numTargs) matrices
692 std::vector<QMatrix> matrs;
693 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
694 matrs.push_back(getRandomQMatrix(1 << numTargs));
695
696 // create map in QuEST datatypes
697 VLA(ComplexMatrixN, ops, numOps);
698 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++) {
699 ops[i] = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs);
700 toComplexMatrixN(matrs[i], ops[i]);
701 }
702
703 mixNonTPMultiQubitKrausMap(qureg, targs, numTargs, ops, numOps);
704
705 // set ref -> K_i ref K_i^dagger
706 VLA(QMatrix, matrRefs, numOps);
707 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++) {
708 matrRefs[i] = ref;
709 applyReferenceOp(matrRefs[i], targs, numTargs, matrs[i]);
710 }
711 ref = getZeroMatrix(ref.size());
712 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
713 ref += matrRefs[i];
714
715 REQUIRE( areEqual(qureg, ref, 1E5*REAL_EPS) );
716
717 // cleanup QuEST datatypes
718 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
719 destroyComplexMatrixN(ops[i]);
720 }
721 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
722
723 SECTION( "repetition of target" ) {
724
725 // make valid targets
726 int targs[NUM_QUBITS];
727 for (int i=0; i<NUM_QUBITS; i++)
728 targs[i] = i;
729
730 // duplicate one
731 int badInd = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
732 int copyInd = GENERATE_COPY( filter([=](int i){ return i!=badInd; }, range(0,NUM_QUBITS)) );
733 targs[badInd] = targs[copyInd];
734
735 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPMultiQubitKrausMap(qureg, targs, NUM_QUBITS, NULL, 1), Contains("target qubits") && Contains("unique") );
736 }
737 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
738
739 // make valid targets
740 int targs[NUM_QUBITS];
741 for (int i=0; i<NUM_QUBITS; i++)
742 targs[i] = i;
743
744 // make one invalid
745 targs[GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) )] = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
746
747 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPMultiQubitKrausMap(qureg, targs, NUM_QUBITS, NULL, 1), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
748 }
749 SECTION( "number of operators" ) {
750
751 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumTargs+1) );
752 int maxNumOps = (2*numTargs)*(2*numTargs);
753 int numOps = GENERATE_REF( -1, 0, maxNumOps + 1 );
754
755 // make valid targets to avoid triggering target validation
756 VLA(int, targs, numTargs);
757 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++)
758 targs[i] = i;
759 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPMultiQubitKrausMap(qureg, targs, numTargs, NULL, numOps), Contains("operators may be specified") );
760 }
761 SECTION( "initialisation of operators" ) {
762
763 /* compilers don't auto-initialise to NULL; the below circumstance
764 * only really occurs when 'malloc' returns NULL in createComplexMatrixN,
765 * which actually triggers its own validation. Hence this test is useless
766 * currently.
767 */
768
769 int numTargs = NUM_QUBITS;
770 int numOps = (2*numTargs)*(2*numTargs);
771
772 // no need to initialise ops, but set their attribs correct to avoid triggering other validation
773 VLA(ComplexMatrixN, ops, numOps);
774 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
775 ops[i].numQubits = numTargs;
776
777 // make one of the max-ops explicitly NULL
778 ops[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTargs) )].real = NULL;
779
780 // make valid targets to avoid triggering target validation
781 VLA(int, targs, numTargs);
782 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++)
783 targs[i] = i;
784
785 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPMultiQubitKrausMap(qureg, targs, numTargs, ops, numOps), Contains("ComplexMatrixN") && Contains("created") );
786 }
787 SECTION( "dimension of operators" ) {
788
789 // make valid (dimension-wise) max-qubits Kraus map
790 int numTargs = NUM_QUBITS;
791 int numOps = (2*numTargs)*(2*numTargs);
792 VLA(ComplexMatrixN, ops, numOps);
793 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
794 ops[i] = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs);
795
796 // make one have wrong-dimensions
797 int badInd = GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTargs) );
798 destroyComplexMatrixN(ops[badInd]);
799 ops[badInd] = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs - 1);
800
801 // make valid targets to avoid triggering target validation
802 VLA(int, targs, numTargs);
803 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++)
804 targs[i] = i;
805
806 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPMultiQubitKrausMap(qureg, targs, numTargs, ops, numOps), Contains("same number of qubits") );
807
808 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
809 destroyComplexMatrixN(ops[i]);
810 }
811 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
812
813 Qureg statevec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
814
815 // make valid targets to avoid triggering target validation
816 int targs[NUM_QUBITS];
817 for (int i=0; i<NUM_QUBITS; i++)
818 targs[i] = i;
819
820 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPMultiQubitKrausMap(statevec, targs, NUM_QUBITS, NULL, 1), Contains("valid only for density matrices") );
821 destroyQureg(statevec, QUEST_ENV);
822
823 }
824 SECTION( "operator fits in node" ) {
825
826 // each node requires (2 numTargs)^2 amplitudes
827 int minAmps = (2*NUM_QUBITS) * (2*NUM_QUBITS);
828
829 // make valid targets to avoid triggering target validation
830 int targs[NUM_QUBITS];
831 for (int i=0; i<NUM_QUBITS; i++)
832 targs[i] = i;
833
834 // make a simple Identity map
835 ComplexMatrixN ops[] = {createComplexMatrixN(NUM_QUBITS)};
836 for (int i=0; i<(1<<NUM_QUBITS); i++)
837 ops[0].real[i][i] = 1;
838
839 // fake a smaller qureg
840 qureg.numAmpsPerChunk = minAmps - 1;
841 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPMultiQubitKrausMap(qureg, targs, NUM_QUBITS, ops, 1), Contains("targets too many qubits") && Contains("cannot all fit") );
842
843 destroyComplexMatrixN(ops[0]);
844 }
845 }
846 destroyQureg(qureg, QUEST_ENV);
847}
mixNonTPMultiQubitKrausMap

Apply a general N-qubit non-trace-preserving Kraus map to a density matrix, as specified by at most (...

TEST_CASE ( "mixNonTPTwoQubitKrausMap"  ,

Definition at line 855 of file test_decoherence.cpp.

855 {
856
857 PREPARE_TEST(qureg, ref);
858
859 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
860
861 int targ1 = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
862 int targ2 = GENERATE_COPY( filter([=](int t){ return t!=targ1; }, range(0,NUM_QUBITS)) );
863 int numOps = GENERATE( range(1,17) ); // max 16 inclusive
864
865 // map consists of unconstrained 4x4 random matrices
866 std::vector<QMatrix> matrs;
867 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
868 matrs.push_back(getRandomQMatrix(4));
869
870 VLA(ComplexMatrix4, ops, numOps);
871 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
872 ops[i] = toComplexMatrix4(matrs[i]);
873 mixNonTPTwoQubitKrausMap(qureg, targ1, targ2, ops, numOps);
874
875 // set ref -> K_i ref K_i^dagger
876 int targs[2] = {targ1, targ2};
877 VLA(QMatrix, matrRefs, numOps);
878 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++) {
879 matrRefs[i] = ref;
880 applyReferenceOp(matrRefs[i], targs, 2, matrs[i]);
881 }
882 ref = getZeroMatrix(ref.size());
883 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
884 ref += matrRefs[i];
885
886 REQUIRE( areEqual(qureg, ref, 1E4*REAL_EPS) );
887 }
888 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
889
890 SECTION( "number of operators" ) {
891
892 int numOps = GENERATE( 0, 17 );
893 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPTwoQubitKrausMap(qureg, 0,1, NULL, numOps), Contains("operators") );
894 }
895 SECTION( "target collision" ) {
896
897 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
898 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPTwoQubitKrausMap(qureg, target, target, NULL, 1), Contains("target qubits") && Contains("unique") );
899 }
900 SECTION( "qubit index" ) {
901
902 int target = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
903 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPTwoQubitKrausMap(qureg, 0,target, NULL, 1), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
904 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPTwoQubitKrausMap(qureg, target,0, NULL, 1), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
905 }
906 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
907
908 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
909 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPTwoQubitKrausMap(vec, 0,1, NULL, 1), Contains("density matrices") );
910 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
911 }
912 SECTION( "operators fit in node" ) {
913
914 qureg.numAmpsPerChunk = 15; // min 16
915 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixNonTPTwoQubitKrausMap(qureg, 0,1, NULL, 1), Contains("targets too many qubits") );
916 }
917 }
918 destroyQureg(qureg, QUEST_ENV);
919}

TEST_CASE ( "mixPauli"  ,
""  [decoherence] 
)
See also
mixPauli
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 447 of file test_decoherence.cpp.

447 {
448
449 PREPARE_TEST(qureg, ref);
450
451 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
452
453 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
454
455 // randomly generate valid pauli-error probabilities
456 qreal probs[3];
457 qreal max0 = 1/2.; // satisfies p1 < 1 - py
458 probs[0] = getRandomReal(0, max0);
459 qreal max1 = (max0 - probs[0])/2.; // p2 can use half of p1's "unused space"
460 probs[1] = getRandomReal(0, max1);
461 qreal max2 = (max1 - probs[1])/2.; // p3 can use half of p2's "unused space"
462 probs[2] = getRandomReal(0, max2);
463
464 // uniformly randomly assign probs (bound to target)
465 int inds[3] = {0,1,2};
466 std::shuffle(inds,inds+3, std::default_random_engine(1E5 * target));
467 qreal probX = probs[inds[0]]; // seed:target shows no variation
468 qreal probY = probs[inds[1]];
469 qreal probZ = probs[inds[2]];
470
471 mixPauli(qureg, target, probX, probY, probZ);
472
473 QMatrix xRef = ref;
474 applyReferenceOp(xRef, target, QMatrix{{0,1},{1,0}}); // X ref X
475 QMatrix yRef = ref;
476 applyReferenceOp(yRef, target, QMatrix{{0,-qcomp(0,1)},{qcomp(0,1),0}}); // Y ref Y
477 QMatrix zRef = ref;
478 applyReferenceOp(zRef, target, QMatrix{{1,0},{0,-1}}); // Z ref Z
479 ref = ((1 - probX - probY - probZ) * ref) +
480 (probX * xRef) + (probY * yRef) + (probZ * zRef);
481
482 REQUIRE( areEqual(qureg, ref) );
483 }
484 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
485
486 SECTION( "qubit index" ) {
487
488 int target = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
489 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixPauli(qureg, target, 0, 0, 0), Contains("Invalid target") );
490
491 }
492 SECTION( "probability" ) {
493
494 int target = 0;
495
496 // probs clearly must be in [0, 1]
497 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixPauli(qureg, target, -.1, 0, 0), Contains("Probabilities") );
498 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixPauli(qureg, target, 0, -.1, 0), Contains("Probabilities") );
499 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixPauli(qureg, target, 0, 0, -.1), Contains("Probabilities") );
500
501 // max single-non-zero-prob is 0.5
502 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixPauli(qureg, target, .6, 0, 0), Contains("cannot exceed the probability") );
503 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixPauli(qureg, target, 0, .6, 0), Contains("cannot exceed the probability") );
504 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixPauli(qureg, target, 0, 0, .6), Contains("cannot exceed the probability") );
505
506 // must satisfy px, py, pz < 1 - px - py - pz
507 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixPauli(qureg, target, .3, .3, .3), Contains("cannot exceed the probability") );
508 }
509 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
510
511 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
512 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixPauli(vec, 0, 0, 0, 0), Contains("density matrices") );
513 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
514 }
515 }
516 destroyQureg(qureg, QUEST_ENV);
517}
mixPauli
void mixPauli(Qureg qureg, int qubit, qreal probX, qreal probY, qreal probZ)
Mixes a density matrix qureg to induce general single-qubit Pauli noise.
Definition: QuEST.c:1399

References applyReferenceOp(), areEqual(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), getRandomReal(), mixPauli(), NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, qcomp, qreal, and QUEST_ENV.

◆ TEST_CASE() [100/136]

TEST_CASE ( "mixTwoQubitDephasing"  ,
""  [decoherence] 
)
See also
mixTwoQubitDephasing
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 927 of file test_decoherence.cpp.

927 {
928
929 PREPARE_TEST(qureg, ref);
930
931 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
932
933 int targ1 = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
934 int targ2 = GENERATE_COPY( filter([=](int t){ return t!=targ1; }, range(0,NUM_QUBITS)) );
935 qreal prob = getRandomReal(0, 3/4.);
936
937 mixTwoQubitDephasing(qureg, targ1, targ2, prob);
938
939 // ref -> (1 - prob) ref + prob/3 (Z1 ref Z1 + Z2 ref Z2 + Z1 Z2 ref Z1 Z2)
940 QMatrix zMatr{{1,0},{0,-1}};
941 QMatrix z1Ref = ref;
942 applyReferenceOp(z1Ref, targ1, zMatr); // Z1 ref Z1
943 QMatrix z2Ref = ref;
944 applyReferenceOp(z2Ref, targ2, zMatr); // Z2 ref Z2
945 QMatrix z1z2Ref = ref;
946 applyReferenceOp(z1z2Ref, targ1, zMatr);
947 applyReferenceOp(z1z2Ref, targ2, zMatr); // Z1 Z2 ref Z1 Z2
948 ref = ((1 - prob) * ref) + (prob/3.) * (z1Ref + z2Ref + z1z2Ref);
949
950 REQUIRE( areEqual(qureg, ref) );
951 }
952 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
953
954 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
955
956 int targ = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
957 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitDephasing(qureg, 0, targ, 0), Contains("Invalid target") );
958 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitDephasing(qureg, targ, 0, 0), Contains("Invalid target") );
959 }
960 SECTION( "target collision" ) {
961
962 int targ = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
963 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitDephasing(qureg, targ, targ, 0), Contains("target") && Contains("unique") );
964 }
965 SECTION( "probability" ) {
966
967 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitDephasing(qureg, 0, 1, -.1), Contains("Probabilities") );
968 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitDephasing(qureg, 0, 1, 3/4. + .01), Contains("probability") && Contains("cannot exceed 3/4") );
969 }
970 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
971
972 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
973 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitDephasing(vec, 0, 1, 0), Contains("density matrices") );
974 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
975 }
976 }
977 destroyQureg(qureg, QUEST_ENV);
978}
mixTwoQubitDephasing
void mixTwoQubitDephasing(Qureg qureg, int qubit1, int qubit2, qreal prob)
Mixes a density matrix qureg to induce two-qubit dephasing noise.
Definition: QuEST.c:1356

References applyReferenceOp(), areEqual(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), getRandomReal(), mixTwoQubitDephasing(), NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, qreal, and QUEST_ENV.

◆ TEST_CASE() [101/136]

TEST_CASE ( "mixTwoQubitDepolarising"  ,
""  [decoherence] 
)
See also
mixTwoQubitDepolarising
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 986 of file test_decoherence.cpp.

986 {
987
988 PREPARE_TEST(qureg, ref);
989
990 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
991
992 int targ1 = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
993 int targ2 = GENERATE_COPY( filter([=](int t){ return t!=targ1; }, range(0,NUM_QUBITS)) );
994 qreal prob = getRandomReal(0, 15/16.);
995
996 mixTwoQubitDepolarising(qureg, targ1, targ2, prob);
997
998 QMatrix paulis[4] = {
999 QMatrix{{1,0},{0,1}}, // I
1000 QMatrix{{0,1},{1,0}}, // X
1001 QMatrix{{0,-qcomp(0,1)},{qcomp(0,1),0}}, // Y
1002 QMatrix{{1,0},{0,-1}} // Z
1003 };
1004
1005 int targs[2] = {targ1, targ2};
1006 QMatrix refInit = ref;
1007 ref = (1 - (16/15.)*prob) * ref;
1008 for (int i=0; i<4; i++) {
1009 for (int j=0; j<4; j++) {
1010 QMatrix term = refInit;
1011 applyReferenceOp(term, targs, 2,
1012 getKroneckerProduct(paulis[i], paulis[j]));
1013 ref += (prob/15.) * term;
1014 }
1015 }
1016
1017 REQUIRE( areEqual(qureg, ref, 1E4*REAL_EPS) );
1018 }
1019 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1020
1021 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
1022
1023 int targ = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
1024 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitDepolarising(qureg, 0, targ, 0), Contains("Invalid target") );
1025 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitDepolarising(qureg, targ, 0, 0), Contains("Invalid target") );
1026 }
1027 SECTION( "target collision" ) {
1028
1029 int targ = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
1030 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitDepolarising(qureg, targ, targ, 0), Contains("target") && Contains("unique") );
1031 }
1032 SECTION( "probability" ) {
1033
1034 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitDepolarising(qureg, 0, 1, -.1), Contains("Probabilities") );
1035 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitDepolarising(qureg, 0, 1, 15/16. + .01), Contains("probability") && Contains("cannot exceed 15/16") );
1036 }
1037 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1038
1039 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
1040 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitDepolarising(vec, 0, 1, 0), Contains("density matrices") );
1041 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
1042 }
1043 }
1044 destroyQureg(qureg, QUEST_ENV);
1045}
mixTwoQubitDepolarising
void mixTwoQubitDepolarising(Qureg qureg, int qubit1, int qubit2, qreal prob)
Mixes a density matrix qureg to induce two-qubit homogeneous depolarising noise.
Definition: QuEST.c:1387

References applyReferenceOp(), areEqual(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), getKroneckerProduct(), getRandomReal(), mixTwoQubitDepolarising(), NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, qcomp, qreal, and QUEST_ENV.

◆ TEST_CASE() [102/136]

TEST_CASE ( "mixTwoQubitKrausMap"  ,
""  [decoherence] 
)
See also
mixTwoQubitKrausMap
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 1053 of file test_decoherence.cpp.

1053 {
1054
1055 PREPARE_TEST(qureg, ref);
1056
1057 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1058
1059 int targ1 = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
1060 int targ2 = GENERATE_COPY( filter([=](int t){ return t!=targ1; }, range(0,NUM_QUBITS)) );
1061 int numOps = GENERATE( range(1,17) ); // max 16 inclusive
1062 std::vector<QMatrix> matrs = getRandomKrausMap(2, numOps);
1063
1064 VLA(ComplexMatrix4, ops, numOps);
1065 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
1066 ops[i] = toComplexMatrix4(matrs[i]);
1067 mixTwoQubitKrausMap(qureg, targ1, targ2, ops, numOps);
1068
1069 // set ref -> K_i ref K_i^dagger
1070 int targs[2] = {targ1, targ2};
1071 VLA(QMatrix, matrRefs, numOps);
1072 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++) {
1073 matrRefs[i] = ref;
1074 applyReferenceOp(matrRefs[i], targs, 2, matrs[i]);
1075 }
1076 ref = getZeroMatrix(ref.size());
1077 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
1078 ref += matrRefs[i];
1079
1080 REQUIRE( areEqual(qureg, ref, 10*REAL_EPS) );
1081 }
1082 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1083
1084 SECTION( "number of operators" ) {
1085
1086 int numOps = GENERATE( 0, 17 );
1087 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitKrausMap(qureg, 0,1, NULL, numOps), Contains("operators") );
1088 }
1089 SECTION( "trace preserving" ) {
1090
1091 // valid Kraus map
1092 int numOps = GENERATE( range(1,16) );
1093 std::vector<QMatrix> matrs = getRandomKrausMap(2, numOps);
1094 VLA(ComplexMatrix4, ops, numOps);
1095 for (int i=0; i<numOps; i++)
1096 ops[i] = toComplexMatrix4(matrs[i]);
1097
1098 // make only one of the ops at a time invalid
1099 ops[GENERATE_REF( range(0,numOps) )].real[0][0] = 0;
1100 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitKrausMap(qureg, 0,1, ops, numOps), Contains("trace preserving") );
1101 }
1102 SECTION( "target collision" ) {
1103
1104 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
1105 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitKrausMap(qureg, target, target, NULL, 1), Contains("target qubits") && Contains("unique") );
1106 }
1107 SECTION( "qubit index" ) {
1108
1109 int target = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
1110 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitKrausMap(qureg, 0,target, NULL, 1), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
1111 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitKrausMap(qureg, target,0, NULL, 1), Contains("Invalid target qubit") );
1112 }
1113 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1114
1115 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
1116 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitKrausMap(vec, 0,1, NULL, 1), Contains("density matrices") );
1117 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
1118 }
1119 SECTION( "operators fit in node" ) {
1120
1121 qureg.numAmpsPerChunk = 15; // min 16
1122 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( mixTwoQubitKrausMap(qureg, 0,1, NULL, 1), Contains("targets too many qubits") );
1123 }
1124 }
1125 destroyQureg(qureg, QUEST_ENV);
1126}

Apply a general two-qubit Kraus map to a density matrix, as specified by at most sixteen Kraus operat...

TEST_CASE ( "multiControlledMultiQubitNot"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
multiControlledMultiQubitNot
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 977 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

977 {
978
979 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
980
981 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
982
983 // try all possible numbers of targets and controls
984 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,NUM_QUBITS) ); // leave space for 1 ctrl
985 int maxNumCtrls = NUM_QUBITS - numTargs;
986 int numCtrls = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumCtrls+1) );
987
988 // generate all possible valid qubit arrangements
989 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
990 int* ctrls = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numCtrls, targs, numTargs) );
991
992 // for each qubit arrangement, use a new random unitary
993 QMatrix notOp{{0, 1},{1,0}};
994
995 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
996
997 multiControlledMultiQubitNot(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs);
998 for (int t=0; t<numTargs; t++)
999 applyReferenceOp(refVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs[t], notOp);
1000
1001 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
1002 }
1003 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1004
1005 multiControlledMultiQubitNot(quregMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs);
1006 for (int t=0; t<numTargs; t++)
1007 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, targs[t], notOp);
1008
1009 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr) );
1010 }
1011 }
1012 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1013
1014 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
1015
1016 // there cannot be more targets than qubits in register
1017 // (numTargs=NUM_QUBITS is caught elsewhere, because that implies ctrls are invalid)
1018 int numTargs = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
1019 int targs[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
1020 int ctrls[] = {0};
1021 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitNot(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, numTargs), Contains("Invalid number of target"));
1022 }
1023 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
1024
1025 int ctrls[] = {0};
1026 int numTargs = 3;
1027 int targs[] = {1,2,2};
1028 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitNot(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, numTargs), Contains("target") && Contains("unique"));
1029 }
1030 SECTION( "number of controls" ) {
1031
1032 int numCtrls = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
1033 int ctrls[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // avoids seg-fault if validation not triggered
1034 int targs[1] = {0};
1035 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitNot(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, 1), Contains("Invalid number of control"));
1036 }
1037 SECTION( "repetition in controls" ) {
1038
1039 int ctrls[] = {0,1,1};
1040 int targs[] = {3};
1041 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitNot(quregVec, ctrls, 3, targs, 1), Contains("control") && Contains("unique"));
1042 }
1043 SECTION( "control and target collision" ) {
1044
1045 int ctrls[] = {0,1,2};
1046 int targs[] = {3,1,4};
1047 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitNot(quregVec, ctrls, 3, targs, 3), Contains("Control") && Contains("target") && Contains("disjoint"));
1048 }
1049 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
1050
1051 // valid inds
1052 int numQb = 2;
1053 int qb1[2] = {0,1};
1054 int qb2[2] = {2,3};
1055
1056 // make qb1 invalid
1057 int inv = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
1058 qb1[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numQb))] = inv;
1059
1060 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitNot(quregVec, qb1, numQb, qb2, numQb), Contains("Invalid control") );
1061 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitNot(quregVec, qb2, numQb, qb1, numQb), Contains("Invalid target") );
1062 }
1063 }
1064 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
1065}

1073 {
1074
1075 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
1076
1077 // figure out max-num targs (inclusive) allowed by hardware backend
1078 int maxNumTargs = calcLog2(quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk);
1079 if (maxNumTargs >= NUM_QUBITS)
1080 maxNumTargs = NUM_QUBITS - 1; // leave room for min-number of control qubits
1081
1082 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1083
1084 // try all possible numbers of targets and controls
1085 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumTargs+1) );
1086 int maxNumCtrls = NUM_QUBITS - numTargs;
1087 int numCtrls = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumCtrls+1) );
1088
1089 // generate all possible valid qubit arrangements
1090 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
1091 int* ctrls = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numCtrls, targs, numTargs) );
1092
1093 // for each qubit arrangement, use a new random unitary
1094 QMatrix op = getRandomUnitary(numTargs);
1095 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs);
1096 toComplexMatrixN(op, matr);
1097
1098 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1099
1100 multiControlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, matr);
1101 applyReferenceOp(refVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, op);
1102 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
1103 }
1104 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1105
1106 multiControlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, matr);
1107 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, op);
1108 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
1109 }
1110 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1111 }
1112 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1113
1114 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
1115
1116 // there cannot be more targets than qubits in register
1117 // (numTargs=NUM_QUBITS is caught elsewhere, because that implies ctrls are invalid)
1118 int numTargs = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
1119 int targs[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
1120 int ctrls[] = {0};
1121 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(NUM_QUBITS+1); // prevent seg-fault
1122 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(NUM_QUBITS+1), matr); // ensure unitary
1123
1124 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("Invalid number of target"));
1125 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1126 }
1127 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
1128
1129 int ctrls[] = {0};
1130 int numTargs = 3;
1131 int targs[] = {1,2,2};
1132 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
1133 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(numTargs), matr); // ensure unitary
1134
1135 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("target") && Contains("unique"));
1136 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1137 }
1138 SECTION( "number of controls" ) {
1139
1140 int numCtrls = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
1141 int ctrls[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // avoids seg-fault if validation not triggered
1142 int targs[1] = {0};
1143 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(1);
1144 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(1), matr); // ensure unitary
1145
1146 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, 1, matr), Contains("Invalid number of control"));
1147 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1148 }
1149 SECTION( "repetition in controls" ) {
1150
1151 int ctrls[] = {0,1,1};
1152 int targs[] = {3};
1153 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(1);
1154 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(1), matr); // ensure unitary
1155
1156 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, 3, targs, 1, matr), Contains("control") && Contains("unique"));
1157 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1158 }
1159 SECTION( "control and target collision" ) {
1160
1161 int ctrls[] = {0,1,2};
1162 int targs[] = {3,1,4};
1163 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(3);
1164 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(3), matr); // ensure unitary
1165
1166 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, 3, targs, 3, matr), Contains("Control") && Contains("target") && Contains("disjoint"));
1167 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1168 }
1169 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
1170
1171 // valid inds
1172 int numQb = 2;
1173 int qb1[2] = {0,1};
1174 int qb2[2] = {2,3};
1175 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numQb);
1176 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(numQb), matr); // ensure unitary
1177
1178 // make qb1 invalid
1179 int inv = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
1180 qb1[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numQb))] = inv;
1181
1182 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, qb1, numQb, qb2, numQb, matr), Contains("Invalid control") );
1183 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, qb2, numQb, qb1, numQb, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
1184 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1185 }
1186 SECTION( "unitarity" ) {
1187
1188 int ctrls[1] = {0};
1189 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumTargs+1) );
1190 VLA(int, targs, numTargs);
1191 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++)
1192 targs[i] = i+1;
1193
1194 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs); // initially zero, hence not-unitary
1195 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("unitary") );
1196 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1197 }
1198 SECTION( "unitary creation" ) {
1199
1200 int ctrls[1] = {0};
1201 int targs[3] = {1,2,3};
1202
1203 /* compilers don't auto-initialise to NULL; the below circumstance
1204 * only really occurs when 'malloc' returns NULL in createComplexMatrixN,
1205 * which actually triggers its own validation. Hence this test is useless
1206 * currently.
1207 */
1208 ComplexMatrixN matr;
1209 matr.real = NULL;
1210 matr.imag = NULL;
1211 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, 3, matr), Contains("created") );
1212 }
1213 SECTION( "unitary dimensions" ) {
1214
1215 int ctrls[1] = {0};
1216 int targs[2] = {1,2};
1217 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(3); // intentionally wrong size
1218 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(3), matr); // ensure unitary
1219
1220 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, 2, matr), Contains("matrix size"));
1221 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1222 }
1223 SECTION( "unitary fits in node" ) {
1224
1225 // pretend we have a very limited distributed memory (judged by matr size)
1226 quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk = 1;
1227 int ctrls[1] = {0};
1228 int targs[2] = {1,2};
1229 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(2);
1230 toComplexMatrixN(getRandomUnitary(2), matr); // ensure unitary
1231
1232 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, 1, targs, 2, matr), Contains("targets too many qubits"));
1233 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1234 }
1235 }
1236 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
1237}
multiControlledMultiQubitUnitary
void multiControlledMultiQubitUnitary(Qureg qureg, int *ctrls, int numCtrls, int *targs, int numTargs, ComplexMatrixN u)
Apply a general multi-controlled multi-qubit unitary (including a global phase factor).

◆ TEST_CASE() [105/136]

TEST_CASE ( "multiControlledMultiRotatePauli"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
multiControlledMultiRotatePauli
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 1245 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

1245 {
1246
1247 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
1248 qreal param = getRandomReal(-4*M_PI, 4*M_PI);
1249
1250 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1251
1252 // try all possible numbers of targets and controls
1253 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,NUM_QUBITS) ); // leave space for min 1 control qubit
1254 int maxNumCtrls = NUM_QUBITS - numTargs;
1255 int numCtrls = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumCtrls+1) );
1256
1257 // generate all possible valid qubit arrangements
1258 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
1259 int* ctrls = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numCtrls, targs, numTargs) );
1260
1261 /* it's too expensive to try ALL Pauli sequences, via
1262 * pauliOpType* paulis = GENERATE_COPY( pauliseqs(numTargs) );.
1263 * Furthermore, take(10, pauliseqs(numTargs)) will try the same pauli codes.
1264 * Hence, we instead opt to randomly generate pauliseqs
1265 */
1266 VLA(pauliOpType, paulis, numTargs);
1267 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++)
1268 paulis[i] = (pauliOpType) getRandomInt(0,4);
1269
1270 // exclude identities from reference matrix exp (they apply unwanted global phase)
1271 VLA(int, refTargs, numTargs);
1272 int numRefTargs = 0;
1273
1274 QMatrix xMatr{{0,1},{1,0}};
1275 QMatrix yMatr{{0,-qcomp(0,1)},{qcomp(0,1),0}};
1276 QMatrix zMatr{{1,0},{0,-1}};
1277
1278 // build correct reference matrix by pauli-matrix exponentiation...
1279 QMatrix pauliProd{{1}};
1280 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++) {
1281 QMatrix fac;
1282 if (paulis[i] == PAULI_I) continue; // exclude I-targets from ref list
1283 if (paulis[i] == PAULI_X) fac = xMatr;
1284 if (paulis[i] == PAULI_Y) fac = yMatr;
1285 if (paulis[i] == PAULI_Z) fac = zMatr;
1286 pauliProd = getKroneckerProduct(fac, pauliProd);
1287
1288 // include this target in ref list
1289 refTargs[numRefTargs++] = targs[i];
1290 }
1291
1292 // produces exp(-i param/2 pauliProd), unless pauliProd = I
1293 QMatrix op;
1294 if (numRefTargs > 0)
1295 op = getExponentialOfPauliMatrix(param, pauliProd);
1296
1297 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1298
1299 multiControlledMultiRotatePauli(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, paulis, numTargs, param);
1300 if (numRefTargs > 0)
1301 applyReferenceOp(refVec, ctrls, numCtrls, refTargs, numRefTargs, op);
1302 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
1303 }
1304 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1305
1306 multiControlledMultiRotatePauli(quregMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, paulis, numTargs, param);
1307 if (numRefTargs > 0)
1308 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, refTargs, numRefTargs, op);
1309 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
1310 }
1311 }
1312 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1313
1314 // test all validation on both state-vector and density-matrix.
1315 // want GENERATE_COPY( quregVec, quregMatr ), but too lazy to patch
1316 // using github.com/catchorg/Catch2/issues/1809
1317 Qureg regs[] = {quregVec, quregMatr};
1318 Qureg qureg = regs[GENERATE(0,1)];
1319
1320 // over-sized array to prevent seg-fault in case of validation fail below
1321 pauliOpType paulis[NUM_QUBITS+1];
1322 for (int q=0; q<NUM_QUBITS+1; q++)
1323 paulis[q] = PAULI_I;
1324
1325 SECTION( "pauli codes" ) {
1326
1327 int numCtrls = 1;
1328 int ctrls[] = {3};
1329 int numTargs = 3;
1330 int targs[3] = {0, 1, 2};
1331
1332 // make a single Pauli invalid
1333 paulis[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numTargs))] = (pauliOpType) GENERATE( -1, 4 );
1334
1335 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiRotatePauli(qureg, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, paulis, numTargs, param), Contains("Invalid Pauli code"));
1336 }
1337 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
1338
1339 // there cannot be more targets than qubits in register
1340 // (numTargs=NUM_QUBITS is caught elsewhere, because that implies ctrls are invalid)
1341 int numTargs = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
1342 int numCtrls = 1;
1343 int targs[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
1344 int ctrls[] = {0};
1345
1346 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiRotatePauli(qureg, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, paulis, numTargs, param), Contains("Invalid number of target") );
1347 }
1348 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
1349
1350 int numCtrls = 1;
1351 int numTargs = 3;
1352 int ctrls[] = {0};
1353 int targs[] = {1,2,2};
1354
1355 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiRotatePauli(qureg, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, paulis, numTargs, param), Contains("target") && Contains("unique"));
1356 }
1357 SECTION( "number of controls" ) {
1358
1359 int numCtrls = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
1360 int numTargs = 1;
1361 int ctrls[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // avoids seg-fault if validation not triggered
1362 int targs[1] = {0};
1363
1364 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiRotatePauli(qureg, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, paulis, numTargs, param), Contains("Invalid number of control"));
1365 }
1366 SECTION( "repetition in controls" ) {
1367
1368 int numCtrls = 3;
1369 int numTargs = 1;
1370 int ctrls[] = {0,1,1};
1371 int targs[] = {3};
1372
1373 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiRotatePauli(qureg, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, paulis, numTargs, param), Contains("control") && Contains("unique"));
1374 }
1375 SECTION( "control and target collision" ) {
1376
1377 int numCtrls = 3;
1378 int numTargs = 3;
1379 int ctrls[] = {0,1,2};
1380 int targs[] = {3,1,4};
1381
1382 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiRotatePauli(qureg, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, paulis, numTargs, param), Contains("Control") && Contains("target") && Contains("disjoint"));
1383 }
1384 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
1385
1386 // valid inds
1387 int numQb = 2;
1388 int qb1[2] = {0,1};
1389 int qb2[2] = {2,3};
1390
1391 // make qb1 invalid
1392 int inv = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
1393 qb1[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numQb))] = inv;
1394
1395 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiRotatePauli(qureg, qb1, numQb, qb2, paulis, numQb, param), Contains("Invalid control") );
1396 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiRotatePauli(qureg, qb2, numQb, qb1, paulis, numQb, param), Contains("Invalid target") );
1397 }
1398 }
1399 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
1400}

Returns the matrix exponential of a kronecker product of pauli matrices (or of any involutory matrice...

TEST_CASE ( "multiControlledMultiRotateZ"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
multiControlledMultiRotateZ
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 1408 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

1408 {
1409
1410 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
1411 qreal param = getRandomReal(-4*M_PI, 4*M_PI);
1412
1413 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1414
1415 // try all possible numbers of targets and controls
1416 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,NUM_QUBITS) ); // leave space for min 1 control qubit
1417 int maxNumCtrls = NUM_QUBITS - numTargs;
1418 int numCtrls = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumCtrls+1) );
1419
1420 // generate all possible valid qubit arrangements
1421 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
1422 int* ctrls = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numCtrls, targs, numTargs) );
1423
1424 // build correct reference matrix by diagonal-matrix exponentiation...
1425 QMatrix zMatr{{1,0},{0,-1}};
1426 QMatrix zProd = zMatr;
1427 for (int t=0; t<numTargs-1; t++)
1428 zProd = getKroneckerProduct(zMatr, zProd); // Z . Z ... Z
1429
1430 // exp( -i param/2 Z . Z ... Z)
1431 QMatrix op = getExponentialOfDiagonalMatrix(qcomp(0, -param/2) * zProd);
1432
1433 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1434
1435 multiControlledMultiRotateZ(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, param);
1436 applyReferenceOp(refVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, op);
1437 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
1438 }
1439 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1440
1441 multiControlledMultiRotateZ(quregMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, param);
1442 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, op);
1443 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 2*REAL_EPS) );
1444 }
1445 }
1446 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1447
1448 // test all validation on both state-vector and density-matrix.
1449 // want GENERATE_COPY( quregVec, quregMatr ), but too lazy to patch
1450 // using github.com/catchorg/Catch2/issues/1809
1451 Qureg regs[] = {quregVec, quregMatr};
1452 Qureg qureg = regs[GENERATE(0,1)];
1453
1454 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
1455
1456 // there cannot be more targets than qubits in register
1457 // (numTargs=NUM_QUBITS is caught elsewhere, because that implies ctrls are invalid)
1458 int numTargs = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
1459 int numCtrls = 1;
1460 int targs[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
1461 int ctrls[] = {0};
1462
1463 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiRotateZ(qureg, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, param), Contains("Invalid number of target") );
1464 }
1465 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
1466
1467 int numCtrls = 1;
1468 int numTargs = 3;
1469 int ctrls[] = {0};
1470 int targs[] = {1,2,2};
1471
1472 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiRotateZ(qureg, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, param), Contains("target") && Contains("unique"));
1473 }
1474 SECTION( "number of controls" ) {
1475
1476 int numCtrls = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
1477 int numTargs = 1;
1478 int ctrls[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // avoids seg-fault if validation not triggered
1479 int targs[1] = {0};
1480
1481 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiRotateZ(qureg, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, param), Contains("Invalid number of control"));
1482 }
1483 SECTION( "repetition in controls" ) {
1484
1485 int numCtrls = 3;
1486 int numTargs = 1;
1487 int ctrls[] = {0,1,1};
1488 int targs[] = {3};
1489
1490 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiRotateZ(qureg, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, param), Contains("control") && Contains("unique"));
1491 }
1492 SECTION( "control and target collision" ) {
1493
1494 int numCtrls = 3;
1495 int numTargs = 3;
1496 int ctrls[] = {0,1,2};
1497 int targs[] = {3,1,4};
1498
1499 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiRotateZ(qureg, ctrls, numCtrls, targs, numTargs, param), Contains("Control") && Contains("target") && Contains("disjoint"));
1500 }
1501 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
1502
1503 // valid inds
1504 int numQb = 2;
1505 int qb1[2] = {0,1};
1506 int qb2[2] = {2,3};
1507
1508 // make qb1 invalid
1509 int inv = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
1510 qb1[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numQb))] = inv;
1511
1512 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiRotateZ(qureg, qb1, numQb, qb2, numQb, param), Contains("Invalid control") );
1513 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledMultiRotateZ(qureg, qb2, numQb, qb1, numQb, param), Contains("Invalid target") );
1514 }
1515 }
1516 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
1517}
getExponentialOfDiagonalMatrix
QMatrix getExponentialOfDiagonalMatrix(QMatrix a)
Returns the matrix exponential of a diagonal, square, complex matrix.
Definition: utilities.cpp:197

1525 {
1526
1527 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
1528
1529 // acts on the final control qubit
1530 QMatrix op{{1,0},{0,-1}};
1531
1532 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1533
1534 // generate ALL valid qubit arrangements
1535 int numCtrls = GENERATE( range(1,NUM_QUBITS) ); // numCtrls=NUM_QUBITS stopped by overzealous validation
1536 int* ctrls = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numCtrls) );
1537
1538 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1539
1540 multiControlledPhaseFlip(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls);
1541 applyReferenceOp(refVec, ctrls, numCtrls-1, ctrls[numCtrls-1], op);
1542 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
1543 }
1544 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1545
1546 multiControlledPhaseFlip(quregMatr, ctrls, numCtrls);
1547 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, ctrls, numCtrls-1, ctrls[numCtrls-1], op);
1548 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr) );
1549 }
1550 }
1551 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1552
1553 SECTION( "number of controls" ) {
1554
1555 int numCtrls = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
1556 int ctrls[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // avoids seg-fault if validation not triggered
1557 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledPhaseFlip(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls), Contains("Invalid number of qubits"));
1558 }
1559 SECTION( "repetition of controls" ) {
1560
1561 int numCtrls = 3;
1562 int ctrls[] = {0,1,1};
1563 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledPhaseFlip(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls), Contains("qubits must be unique"));
1564 }
1565 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
1566
1567 int numCtrls = 3;
1568 int ctrls[] = { 1, 2, GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS ) };
1569 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledPhaseFlip(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls), Contains("Invalid qubit") );
1570 }
1571 }
1572 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
1573}

TEST_CASE ( "multiControlledTwoQubitUnitary"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
multiControlledTwoQubitUnitary
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 1636 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

1636 {
1637
1638 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
1639
1640 // in distributed mode, each node must be able to fit all amps modified by unitary
1641 REQUIRE( quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk >= 4 );
1642
1643 // every test will use a unique random matrix
1644 QMatrix op = getRandomUnitary(2);
1645 ComplexMatrix4 matr = toComplexMatrix4(op);
1646
1647 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1648
1649 // generate ALL valid qubit arrangements
1650 int targ1 = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
1651 int targ2 = GENERATE_COPY( filter([=](int t){ return t!=targ1; }, range(0,NUM_QUBITS)) );
1652 int targs[] = {targ1, targ2};
1653 int numCtrls = GENERATE( range(1,NUM_QUBITS-1) ); // leave room for 2 targets (upper bound is exclusive)
1654 int* ctrls = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numCtrls, targs, 2) );
1655
1656 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1657
1658 multiControlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targ1, targ2, matr);
1659 applyReferenceOp(refVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targ1, targ2, op);
1660 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
1661 }
1662 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1663
1664 multiControlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, targ1, targ2, matr);
1665 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, targ1, targ2, op);
1666 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
1667 }
1668 }
1669 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1670
1671 SECTION( "number of controls" ) {
1672
1673 // numCtrls=(NUM_QUBITS-1) is ok since requires ctrl qubit inds are invalid
1674 int numCtrls = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
1675 int ctrls[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // avoids seg-fault if validation not triggered
1676 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, 0, 1, matr), Contains("Invalid number of control"));
1677 }
1678 SECTION( "repetition of controls" ) {
1679
1680 int numCtrls = 3;
1681 int ctrls[] = {0,1,1};
1682 int targ1 = 2;
1683 int targ2 = 3;
1684 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targ1, targ2, matr), Contains("control") && Contains("unique"));;
1685 }
1686 SECTION( "repetition of targets" ) {
1687
1688 int numCtrls = 3;
1689 int ctrls[] = {0,1,2};
1690 int targ1 = 3;
1691 int targ2 = targ1;
1692 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targ1, targ2, matr), Contains("target") && Contains("unique"));
1693 }
1694 SECTION( "control and target collision" ) {
1695
1696 int numCtrls = 3;
1697 int ctrls[] = {0,1,2};
1698 int targ1 = 3;
1699 int targ2 = ctrls[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numCtrls) )];
1700 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targ1, targ2, matr), Contains("Control") && Contains("target") );
1701 }
1702 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
1703
1704 // valid indices
1705 int targ1 = 0;
1706 int targ2 = 1;
1707 int numCtrls = 3;
1708 int ctrls[] = { 2, 3, 4 };
1709
1710 int inv = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
1711 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, inv, targ2, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
1712 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targ1, inv, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
1713
1714 ctrls[numCtrls-1] = inv; // make ctrls invalid
1715 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, targ1, targ2, matr), Contains("Invalid control") );
1716 }
1717 SECTION( "unitarity " ) {
1718
1719 int ctrls[1] = {0};
1720 matr.real[0][0] = 0; // break unitarity
1721 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, 1, 1, 2, matr), Contains("unitary") );
1722 }
1723 SECTION( "unitary fits in node" ) {
1724
1725 // pretend we have a very limited distributed memory
1726 quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk = 1;
1727 int ctrls[1] = {0};
1728 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledTwoQubitUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, 1, 1, 2, matr), Contains("targets too many qubits"));
1729 }
1730 }
1731 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
1732}
multiControlledTwoQubitUnitary
void multiControlledTwoQubitUnitary(Qureg qureg, int *controlQubits, int numControlQubits, int targetQubit1, int targetQubit2, ComplexMatrix4 u)
Apply a general multi-controlled two-qubit unitary (including a global phase factor).

TEST_CASE ( "multiControlledUnitary"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
multiControlledUnitary
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 1740 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

1740 {
1741
1742 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
1743
1744 // every test will use a unique random matrix
1745 QMatrix op = getRandomUnitary(1);
1746 ComplexMatrix2 matr = toComplexMatrix2(op);
1747
1748 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1749
1750 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
1751 int numCtrls = GENERATE( range(1,NUM_QUBITS) ); // leave space for one target (exclusive upper bound)
1752 int* ctrls = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numCtrls, target) );
1753
1754 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1755
1756 multiControlledUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, target, matr);
1757 applyReferenceOp(refVec, ctrls, numCtrls, target, op);
1758 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
1759 }
1760 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1761
1762 multiControlledUnitary(quregMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, target, matr);
1763 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, target, op);
1764 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
1765 }
1766 }
1767 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1768
1769 SECTION( "number of controls" ) {
1770
1771 int numCtrls = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
1772 int ctrls[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // avoids seg-fault if validation not triggered
1773 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, numCtrls, 0, matr), Contains("Invalid number of control"));
1774 }
1775 SECTION( "repetition of controls" ) {
1776
1777 int ctrls[] = {0,1,1};
1778 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, 3, 2, matr), Contains("control") && Contains("unique"));
1779 }
1780 SECTION( "control and target collision" ) {
1781
1782 int ctrls[] = {0,1,2};
1783 int targ = ctrls[GENERATE( range(0,3) )];
1784 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, 3, targ, matr), Contains("Control") && Contains("target") );
1785 }
1786 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
1787
1788 int ctrls[] = { 1, 2, GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS ) };
1789 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, 3, 0, matr), Contains("Invalid control") );
1790
1791 ctrls[2] = 3; // make ctrls valid
1792 int targ = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
1793 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, 3, targ, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
1794 }
1795 SECTION( "unitarity" ) {
1796
1797 matr.real[0][0] = 0; // break matr unitarity
1798 int ctrls[] = {0};
1799 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiControlledUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, 1, 1, matr), Contains("unitary") );
1800 }
1801 }
1802 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
1803}
multiControlledUnitary
void multiControlledUnitary(Qureg qureg, int *controlQubits, int numControlQubits, int targetQubit, ComplexMatrix2 u)

◆ TEST_CASE() [111/136]

TEST_CASE ( "multiQubitNot"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
multiQubitNot
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 1811 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

1811 {
1812
1813 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
1814
1815 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1816
1817 // try all possible numbers of targets and controls
1818 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,NUM_QUBITS+1) ); // leave space for 1 ctrl
1819
1820 // generate all possible valid qubit arrangements
1821 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
1822
1823 // for each qubit arrangement, use a new random unitary
1824 QMatrix notOp{{0, 1},{1,0}};
1825
1826 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1827
1828 multiQubitNot(quregVec, targs, numTargs);
1829 for (int t=0; t<numTargs; t++)
1830 applyReferenceOp(refVec, targs[t], notOp);
1831
1832 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
1833 }
1834 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1835
1836 multiQubitNot(quregMatr, targs, numTargs);
1837 for (int t=0; t<numTargs; t++)
1838 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, targs[t], notOp);
1839
1840 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr) );
1841 }
1842 }
1843 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1844
1845 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
1846
1847 // there cannot be more targets than qubits in register
1848 int numTargs = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
1849 int targs[NUM_QUBITS+1];
1850 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiQubitNot(quregVec, targs, numTargs), Contains("Invalid number of target"));
1851 }
1852 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
1853
1854 int numTargs = 3;
1855 int targs[] = {1,2,2};
1856 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiQubitNot(quregVec, targs, numTargs), Contains("target") && Contains("unique"));
1857 }
1858 SECTION( "target indices" ) {
1859
1860 // valid inds
1861 int numQb = 5;
1862 int qubits[] = {0,1,2,3,4};
1863
1864 // make one index invalid
1865 qubits[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numQb))] = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
1866 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiQubitNot(quregVec, qubits, numQb), Contains("Invalid target") );
1867 }
1868 }
1869 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
1870}
multiQubitNot

Apply a NOT (or Pauli X) gate with multiple target qubits, which has the same effect as (but is much ...
Definition: QuEST.c:544

TEST_CASE ( "multiQubitUnitary"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
multiQubitUnitary
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 1878 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

1878 {
1879
1880 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
1881
1882 // figure out max-num (inclusive) targs allowed by hardware backend
1883 int maxNumTargs = calcLog2(quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk);
1884
1885 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1886
1887 // generate all possible qubit arrangements
1888 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumTargs+1) ); // inclusive upper bound
1889 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
1890
1891 // for each qubit arrangement, use a new random unitary
1892 QMatrix op = getRandomUnitary(numTargs);
1893 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs);
1894 toComplexMatrixN(op, matr);
1895
1896 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
1897
1898 multiQubitUnitary(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr);
1899 applyReferenceOp(refVec, targs, numTargs, op);
1900 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
1901 }
1902 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
1903
1904 multiQubitUnitary(quregMatr, targs, numTargs, matr);
1905 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, targs, numTargs, op);
1906 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
1907 }
1908 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1909 }
1910 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1911
1912 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
1913
1914 // there cannot be more targets than qubits in register
1915 int numTargs = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
1916 int targs[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
1917 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(NUM_QUBITS+1); // prevent seg-fault
1918
1919 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiQubitUnitary(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("Invalid number of target"));
1920 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1921 }
1922 SECTION( "repetition in targets" ) {
1923
1924 int numTargs = 3;
1925 int targs[] = {1,2,2};
1926 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
1927
1928 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiQubitUnitary(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("target") && Contains("unique"));
1929 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1930 }
1931 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
1932
1933 int numTargs = 3;
1934 int targs[] = {1,2,3};
1935 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
1936
1937 int inv = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
1938 targs[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTargs) )] = inv; // make invalid target
1939 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiQubitUnitary(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
1940
1941 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1942 }
1943 SECTION( "unitarity" ) {
1944
1945 int numTargs = GENERATE_COPY( range(1,maxNumTargs) );
1946 VLA(int, targs, numTargs);
1947 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++)
1948 targs[i] = i+1;
1949
1950 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(numTargs); // initially zero, hence not-unitary
1951
1952 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiQubitUnitary(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("unitary") );
1953 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1954 }
1955 SECTION( "unitary creation" ) {
1956
1957 int numTargs = 3;
1958 int targs[] = {1,2,3};
1959
1960 /* compilers don't auto-initialise to NULL; the below circumstance
1961 * only really occurs when 'malloc' returns NULL in createComplexMatrixN,
1962 * which actually triggers its own validation. Hence this test is useless
1963 * currently.
1964 */
1965 ComplexMatrixN matr;
1966 matr.real = NULL;
1967 matr.imag = NULL;
1968 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiQubitUnitary(quregVec, targs, numTargs, matr), Contains("created") );
1969 }
1970 SECTION( "unitary dimensions" ) {
1971
1972 int targs[2] = {1,2};
1973 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(3); // intentionally wrong size
1974
1975 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiQubitUnitary(quregVec, targs, 2, matr), Contains("matrix size"));
1976 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1977 }
1978 SECTION( "unitary fits in node" ) {
1979
1980 // pretend we have a very limited distributed memory (judged by matr size)
1981 quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk = 1;
1982 int qb[] = {1,2};
1983 ComplexMatrixN matr = createComplexMatrixN(2); // prevents seg-fault if validation doesn't trigger
1984 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiQubitUnitary(quregVec, qb, 2, matr), Contains("targets too many qubits"));
1985 destroyComplexMatrixN(matr);
1986 }
1987 }
1988 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
1989}

TEST_CASE ( "multiRotatePauli"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
multiRotatePauli
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 1997 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

1997 {
1998
1999 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
2000 qreal param = getRandomReal(-4*M_PI, 4*M_PI);
2001
2002 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
2003
2004 int numTargs = GENERATE( range(1,NUM_QUBITS+1) );
2005 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
2006
2007 /* it's too expensive to try ALL Pauli sequences, via
2008 * pauliOpType* paulis = GENERATE_COPY( pauliseqs(numTargs) );.
2009 * Furthermore, take(10, pauliseqs(numTargs)) will try the same pauli codes.
2010 * Hence, we instead opt to repeatedlyrandomly generate pauliseqs
2011 */
2012 GENERATE( range(0,10) ); // gen 10 random pauli-codes for every targs
2013 VLA(pauliOpType, paulis, numTargs);
2014 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++)
2015 paulis[i] = (pauliOpType) getRandomInt(0,4);
2016
2017 // exclude identities from reference matrix exp (they apply unwanted global phase)
2018 VLA(int, refTargs, numTargs);
2019 int numRefTargs = 0;
2020
2021 QMatrix xMatr{{0,1},{1,0}};
2022 QMatrix yMatr{{0,-qcomp(0,1)},{qcomp(0,1),0}};
2023 QMatrix zMatr{{1,0},{0,-1}};
2024
2025 // build correct reference matrix by pauli-matrix exponentiation...
2026 QMatrix pauliProd{{1}};
2027 for (int i=0; i<numTargs; i++) {
2028 QMatrix fac;
2029 if (paulis[i] == PAULI_I) continue; // exclude I-targets from ref list
2030 if (paulis[i] == PAULI_X) fac = xMatr;
2031 if (paulis[i] == PAULI_Y) fac = yMatr;
2032 if (paulis[i] == PAULI_Z) fac = zMatr;
2033 pauliProd = getKroneckerProduct(fac, pauliProd);
2034
2035 // include this target in ref list
2036 refTargs[numRefTargs++] = targs[i];
2037 }
2038
2039 // produces exp(-i param/2 pauliProd), unless pauliProd = I
2040 QMatrix op;
2041 if (numRefTargs > 0)
2042 op = getExponentialOfPauliMatrix(param, pauliProd);
2043
2044 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
2045
2046 multiRotatePauli(quregVec, targs, paulis, numTargs, param);
2047 if (numRefTargs > 0)
2048 applyReferenceOp(refVec, refTargs, numRefTargs, op);
2049 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
2050 }
2051 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
2052
2053 multiRotatePauli(quregMatr, targs, paulis, numTargs, param);
2054 if (numRefTargs > 0)
2055 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, refTargs, numRefTargs, op);
2056 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
2057 }
2058 }
2059 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
2060
2061 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
2062
2063 int numTargs = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
2064 int targs[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // prevent seg-fault if validation isn't triggered
2065 pauliOpType paulis[NUM_QUBITS+1] = {PAULI_I};
2066 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiRotatePauli(quregVec, targs, paulis, numTargs, param), Contains("Invalid number of target"));
2067 }
2068 SECTION( "repetition of targets" ) {
2069
2070 int numTargs = 3;
2071 int targs[3] = {0, 1, 1};
2072 pauliOpType paulis[3] = {PAULI_I};
2073 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiRotatePauli(quregVec, targs, paulis, numTargs, param), Contains("target") && Contains("unique"));
2074 }
2075 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
2076
2077 int numTargs = 3;
2078 int targs[3] = {0, 1, 2};
2079 targs[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numTargs))] = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
2080 pauliOpType paulis[3] = {PAULI_I};
2081 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiRotatePauli(quregVec, targs, paulis, numTargs, param), Contains("Invalid target"));
2082 }
2083 SECTION( "pauli codes" ) {
2084 int numTargs = 3;
2085 int targs[3] = {0, 1, 2};
2086 pauliOpType paulis[3] = {PAULI_I, PAULI_I, PAULI_I};
2087 paulis[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numTargs))] = (pauliOpType) GENERATE( -1, 4 );
2088 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiRotatePauli(quregVec, targs, paulis, numTargs, param), Contains("Invalid Pauli code"));
2089 }
2090 }
2091 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
2092}

References applyReferenceOp(), areEqual(), CLEANUP_TEST, getExponentialOfPauliMatrix(), getKroneckerProduct(), getRandomInt(), getRandomReal(), M_PI, multiRotatePauli(), NUM_QUBITS, PAULI_I, PAULI_X, PAULI_Y, PAULI_Z, PREPARE_TEST, qcomp, qreal, sublists(), and VLA.

TEST_CASE ( "multiRotateZ"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
multiRotateZ
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 2100 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

2100 {
2101
2102 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
2103 qreal param = getRandomReal(-4*M_PI, 4*M_PI);
2104
2105 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
2106
2107 int numTargs = GENERATE( range(1,NUM_QUBITS+1) );
2108 int* targs = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numTargs) );
2109
2110 // build correct reference matrix by diagonal-matrix exponentiation...
2111 QMatrix zMatr{{1,0},{0,-1}};
2112 QMatrix zProd = zMatr;
2113 for (int t=0; t<numTargs-1; t++)
2114 zProd = getKroneckerProduct(zMatr, zProd); // Z . Z ... Z
2115
2116 // (-i param/2) Z . I . Z ...
2117 QMatrix expArg = qcomp(0, -param/2) *
2118 getFullOperatorMatrix(NULL, 0, targs, numTargs, zProd, NUM_QUBITS);
2119
2120 // exp( -i param/2 Z . I . Z ...)
2121 QMatrix op = getExponentialOfDiagonalMatrix(expArg);
2122
2123 // all qubits to specify full operator matrix on reference structures
2124 int allQubits[NUM_QUBITS];
2125 for (int i=0; i<NUM_QUBITS; i++)
2126 allQubits[i] = i;
2127
2128 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
2129
2130 multiRotateZ(quregVec, targs, numTargs, param);
2131 applyReferenceOp(refVec, allQubits, NUM_QUBITS, op);
2132 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
2133 }
2134 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
2135
2136 multiRotateZ(quregMatr, targs, numTargs, param);
2137 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, allQubits, NUM_QUBITS, op);
2138 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 2*REAL_EPS) );
2139 }
2140 }
2141 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
2142
2143 SECTION( "number of targets" ) {
2144
2145 int numTargs = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
2146 int targs[NUM_QUBITS+1]; // prevent seg-fault if validation isn't triggered
2147 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiRotateZ(quregVec, targs, numTargs, param), Contains("Invalid number of target"));
2148
2149 }
2150 SECTION( "repetition of targets" ) {
2151
2152 int numTargs = 3;
2153 int targs[3] = {0, 1, 1};
2154 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiRotateZ(quregVec, targs, numTargs, param), Contains("target") && Contains("unique"));
2155 }
2156 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
2157
2158 int numTargs = 3;
2159 int targs[3] = {0, 1, 2};
2160 targs[GENERATE_COPY(range(0,numTargs))] = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
2161 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiRotateZ(quregVec, targs, numTargs, param), Contains("Invalid target"));
2162 }
2163 }
2164 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
2165}

TEST_CASE ( "multiStateControlledUnitary"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
multiStateControlledUnitary
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 2173 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

2173 {
2174
2175 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
2176
2177 // every test will use a unique random matrix
2178 QMatrix op = getRandomUnitary(1);
2179 ComplexMatrix2 matr = toComplexMatrix2(op);
2180
2181 // the zero-conditioned control qubits can be effected by notting before/after ctrls
2182 QMatrix notOp{{0,1},{1,0}};
2183
2184 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
2185
2186 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
2187 int numCtrls = GENERATE( range(1,NUM_QUBITS) ); // leave space for one target (exclusive upper bound)
2188 int* ctrls = GENERATE_COPY( sublists(range(0,NUM_QUBITS), numCtrls, target) );
2189 int* ctrlState = GENERATE_COPY( bitsets(numCtrls) );
2190
2191 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
2192
2193 multiStateControlledUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, ctrlState, numCtrls, target, matr);
2194
2195 // simulate controlled-state by notting before & after controls
2196 for (int i=0; i<numCtrls; i++)
2197 if (ctrlState[i] == 0)
2198 applyReferenceOp(refVec, ctrls[i], notOp);
2199 applyReferenceOp(refVec, ctrls, numCtrls, target, op);
2200 for (int i=0; i<numCtrls; i++)
2201 if (ctrlState[i] == 0)
2202 applyReferenceOp(refVec, ctrls[i], notOp);
2203
2204 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
2205 }
2206 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
2207
2208 multiStateControlledUnitary(quregMatr, ctrls, ctrlState, numCtrls, target, matr);
2209
2210 // simulate controlled-state by notting before & after controls
2211 for (int i=0; i<numCtrls; i++)
2212 if (ctrlState[i] == 0)
2213 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, ctrls[i], notOp);
2214 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, ctrls, numCtrls, target, op);
2215 for (int i=0; i<numCtrls; i++)
2216 if (ctrlState[i] == 0)
2217 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, ctrls[i], notOp);
2218
2219 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
2220 }
2221 }
2222 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
2223
2224 SECTION( "number of controls" ) {
2225
2226 int numCtrls = GENERATE( -1, 0, NUM_QUBITS, NUM_QUBITS+1 );
2227 int ctrls[NUM_QUBITS+1];
2228 int ctrlState[NUM_QUBITS+1] = {0};
2229 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiStateControlledUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, ctrlState, numCtrls, 0, matr), Contains("Invalid number of control"));
2230 }
2231 SECTION( "repetition of controls" ) {
2232
2233 int ctrls[] = {0,1,1};
2234 int ctrlState[] = {0, 1, 0};
2235 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiStateControlledUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, ctrlState, 3, 2, matr), Contains("control") && Contains("unique"));
2236 }
2237 SECTION( "control and target collision" ) {
2238
2239 int ctrls[] = {0,1,2};
2240 int ctrlState[] = {0, 1, 0};
2241 int targ = ctrls[GENERATE( range(0,3) )];
2242 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiStateControlledUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, ctrlState, 3, targ, matr), Contains("Control") && Contains("target") );
2243 }
2244 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
2245
2246 int ctrls[] = { 1, 2, GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS ) };
2247 int ctrlState[] = {0, 1, 0};
2248 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiStateControlledUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, ctrlState, 3, 0, matr), Contains("Invalid control") );
2249
2250 ctrls[2] = 3; // make ctrls valid
2251 int targ = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
2252 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiStateControlledUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, ctrlState, 3, targ, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
2253 }
2254 SECTION( "unitarity" ) {
2255
2256 matr.real[0][0] = 0; // break matr unitarity
2257 int ctrls[] = {0};
2258 int ctrlState[1] = {0};
2259 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiStateControlledUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, ctrlState, 1, 1, matr), Contains("unitary") );
2260 }
2261 SECTION( "control state bits" ) {
2262
2263 // valid qubits
2264 int ctrls[] = {0, 1, 2};
2265 int ctrlState[] = {0, 0, 0};
2266 int targ = 3;
2267
2268 // make invalid
2269 ctrlState[2] = GENERATE(-1, 2);
2270 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( multiStateControlledUnitary(quregVec, ctrls, ctrlState, 3, targ, matr), Contains("state") );
2271 }
2272 }
2273 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
2274}

TEST_CASE ( "pauliZ"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
pauliZ
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 2360 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

2360 {
2361
2362 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
2363 QMatrix op{{1,0},{0,-1}};
2364
2365 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
2366
2367 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
2368
2369 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
2370
2371 pauliZ(quregVec, target);
2372 applyReferenceOp(refVec, target, op);
2373 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
2374 }
2375 SECTION( "density-matrix correctness" ) {
2376
2377 pauliZ(quregMatr, target);
2378 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, target, op);
2379 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr) );
2380 }
2381 }
2382 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
2383
2384 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
2385
2386 int target = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
2387 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( pauliZ(quregVec, target), Contains("Invalid target") );
2388 }
2389 }
2390 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
2391}
