TEST_CASE ( "rotateAroundAxis"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
rotateAroundAxis
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 2439 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

2439 {
2440
2441 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
2442
2443 // each test will use a random parameter and axis vector
2444 qreal param = getRandomReal(-4*M_PI, 4*M_PI);
2445 Vector vec;
2446 vec.x=getRandomReal(-1,1);
2447 vec.y=getRandomReal(-1,1);
2448 vec.z=getRandomReal(-1,1);
2449
2450 // Rn(a) = cos(a/2)I - i sin(a/2) n . paulivector
2451 // (pg 24 of vcpc.univie.ac.at/~ian/hotlist/qc/talks/bloch-sphere-rotations.pdf)
2452 qreal c = cos(param/2);
2453 qreal s = sin(param/2);
2454 qreal m = sqrt(vec.x*vec.x + vec.y*vec.y + vec.z*vec.z);
2455 QMatrix op{{c - qcomp(0,1)*vec.z*s/m, -(vec.y + qcomp(0,1)*vec.x)*s/m},
2456 {(vec.y - qcomp(0,1)*vec.x)*s/m, c + qcomp(0,1)*vec.z*s/m}};
2457
2458 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
2459
2460 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
2461
2462 SECTION( "state-vector ") {
2463
2464 rotateAroundAxis(quregVec, target, param, vec);
2465 applyReferenceOp(refVec, target, op);
2466 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
2467 }
2468 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
2469
2470 rotateAroundAxis(quregMatr, target, param, vec);
2471 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, target, op);
2472 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
2473 }
2474 }
2475 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
2476
2477 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
2478
2479 int target = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
2480 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( rotateAroundAxis(quregVec, target, param, vec), Contains("Invalid target") );
2481 }
2482 SECTION( "zero rotation axis" ) {
2483
2484 int target = 0;
2485 vec.x=0; vec.y=0; vec.z=0;
2486 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( rotateAroundAxis(quregVec, target, param, vec), Contains("Invalid axis") && Contains("zero") );
2487 }
2488 }
2489 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
2490}

TEST_CASE ( "setAmps"  ,
""  [state_initialisations] 
)
See also
setAmps
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 381 of file test_state_initialisations.cpp.

381 {
382
383 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
384
385 int maxInd = vec.numAmpsTotal;
386 VLA(qreal, reals, maxInd);
387 VLA(qreal, imags, maxInd);
388
389 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
390
391 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
392
393 // all valid number of amplitudes and offsets
394 int startInd = GENERATE_COPY( range(0,maxInd) );
395 int numAmps = GENERATE_COPY( range(0,1+maxInd-startInd) ); // upper-bound allows all amps specified
396
397 // generate random amplitudes
398 for (int i=0; i<numAmps; i++) {
399 reals[i] = getRandomReal(-5,5);
400 imags[i] = getRandomReal(-5,5);
401 }
402
403 // check both specified and un-specified amplitudes are correctly handled
404 initDebugState(vec);
405 QVector vecRef = toQVector(vec);
406
407 setAmps(vec, startInd, reals, imags, numAmps);
408 for (int i=0; i<numAmps; i++)
409 vecRef[startInd+i] = reals[i] + imags[i] * (qcomp) 1i;
410
411 REQUIRE( areEqual(vec, vecRef) );
412 }
413 }
414 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
415
416 SECTION( "start index" ) {
417
418 int startInd = GENERATE_COPY( -1, maxInd );
419 int numAmps = 0;
420 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setAmps(vec, startInd, reals, imags, numAmps), Contains("Invalid amplitude index") );
421 }
422
423 SECTION( "number of amplitudes" ) {
424
425 // independent
426 int startInd = 0;
427 int numAmps = GENERATE_COPY( -1, maxInd+1 );
428 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setAmps(vec, startInd, reals, imags, numAmps), Contains("Invalid number of amplitudes") );
429
430 // invalid considering start-index
431 startInd = maxInd - 1;
432 numAmps = 2;
433 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setAmps(vec, startInd, reals, imags, numAmps), Contains("More amplitudes given than exist") );
434 }
435 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
436
437 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
438 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setAmps(mat, 0, reals, imags, 0), Contains("valid only for state-vectors") );
439 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
440 }
441 }
442 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
443}
setAmps

Overwrites a contiguous subset of the amplitudes in state-vector qureg, with those passed in reals an...

References areEqual(), createDensityQureg(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), getRandomReal(), initDebugState(), NUM_QUBITS, Qureg::numAmpsTotal, qcomp, qreal, QUEST_ENV, setAmps(), toQVector(), and VLA.

◆ TEST_CASE() [125/136]

TEST_CASE ( "setDensityAmps"  ,
""  [state_initialisations] 
)
See also
setDensityAmps
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 451 of file test_state_initialisations.cpp.

451 {
452
453 Qureg matr = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
454 VLA(qreal, reals, matr.numAmpsTotal);
455 VLA(qreal, imags, matr.numAmpsTotal);
456 int maxInd = (1 << NUM_QUBITS);
457
458 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
459
460 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
461
462 // try all valid number of amplitudes and offsets
463 int startRow = GENERATE_COPY( range(0,maxInd) );
464 int startCol = GENERATE_COPY( range(0,maxInd) );
465
466 // determine the max number of amps that can be passed from the given start indices
467 int numPriorAmps = startRow + startCol*(1 << matr.numQubitsRepresented);
468 int maxNumAmps = matr.numAmpsTotal - numPriorAmps;
469
470 // previously, we tried all possible number of amps, like so:
471 // int numAmps = GENERATE_COPY( range(0,maxNumAmps) ); // upper-bound allows all amps specified
472 // but this is too many and causes a timeout on Ubuntu.
473 // So we instead randomly choose the number of amps, and repeat 10 times.
474 int numAmps = getRandomInt(0, maxNumAmps);
475 GENERATE_COPY( range(0,10) );
476
477 // generate random amplitudes
478 for (int i=0; i<numAmps; i++) {
479 reals[i] = getRandomReal(-5,5);
480 imags[i] = getRandomReal(-5,5);
481 }
482
483 // check both specified and un-specified amplitudes are correctly handled
484 initDebugState(matr);
485 QMatrix matrRef = toQMatrix(matr);
486
487 setDensityAmps(matr, startRow, startCol, reals, imags, numAmps);
488
489 int r=startRow;
490 int c=startCol;
491 for (int i=0; i<numAmps; i++) {
492 qcomp amp = reals[i] + imags[i] * (qcomp) 1i;
493 matrRef[r][c] = amp;
494
495 r++;
496 if (r >= maxInd ) {
497 r=0;
498 c++;
499 }
500 }
501
502 REQUIRE( areEqual(matr, matrRef) );
503 }
504 }
505 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
506
507 SECTION( "start index" ) {
508
509 int badInd = GENERATE_COPY( -1, maxInd );
510 int numAmps = 0;
511 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setDensityAmps(matr, badInd, 0, reals, imags, numAmps), Contains("Invalid amplitude index") );
512 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setDensityAmps(matr, 0, badInd, reals, imags, numAmps), Contains("Invalid amplitude index") );
513 }
514 SECTION( "number of amplitudes" ) {
515
516 // independent
517 int numAmps = GENERATE_COPY( -1, matr.numAmpsTotal+1 );
518 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setDensityAmps(matr, 0, 0, reals, imags, numAmps), Contains("Invalid number of amplitudes") );
519
520 // invalid considering start-index
521 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setDensityAmps(matr, maxInd-1, maxInd-1, reals, imags, 2), Contains("More amplitudes given than exist") );
522 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setDensityAmps(matr, maxInd-1, maxInd-2, reals, imags, maxInd+2), Contains("More amplitudes given than exist") );
523 }
524 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
525
526 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
527 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setDensityAmps(vec, 0, 0, reals, imags, 0), Contains("valid only for density matrices") );
528 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
529 }
530 }
531 destroyQureg(matr, QUEST_ENV);
532}

Overwrites a contiguous subset of the amplitudes in density-matrix qureg, with those passed in reals ...

TEST_CASE ( "setDiagonalOpElems"  ,
""  [data_structures] 
)
See also
setDiagonalOpElems
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 1032 of file test_data_structures.cpp.

1032 {
1033
1034 // must be at least one amplitude per node
1035 int minNumQb = calcLog2(QUEST_ENV.numRanks);
1036 if (minNumQb == 0)
1037 minNumQb = 1;
1038
1039 // try 10 valid number of qubits (even for validation)
1040 int numQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(minNumQb, minNumQb+10) );
1041 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOp(numQb, QUEST_ENV);
1042
1043 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1044
1045 // make entire array on every node
1046 long long int len = (1LL << numQb);
1047 VLA(qreal, reals, len);
1048 VLA(qreal, imags, len);
1049 long long int n;
1050 for (n=0; n<len; n++) {
1051 reals[n] = (qreal) n;
1052 imags[n] = (qreal) -2*n; // (n - 2n i)
1053 }
1054
1055 // set one value at a time (only relevant nodes will update)
1056 for (n=0; n<len; n++)
1057 setDiagonalOpElems(op, n, &reals[n], &imags[n], 1);
1058
1059 // check op.real and op.imag updated correctly
1060 REQUIRE( areEqual(toQVector(op), reals, imags) );
1061
1062 // no check that GPU values updated (occurs in initDiagonalOp)
1063 }
1064 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
1065
1066 long long int maxInd = (1LL << numQb);
1067 qreal *reals = NULL;
1068 qreal *imags = NULL;
1069
1070 SECTION( "start index" ) {
1071
1072 int startInd = GENERATE_COPY( -1, maxInd );
1073 int numAmps = 1;
1074 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setDiagonalOpElems(op, startInd, reals, imags, numAmps), Contains("Invalid element index") );
1075 }
1076
1077 SECTION( "number of elements" ) {
1078
1079 // independent
1080 int startInd = 0;
1081 int numAmps = GENERATE_COPY( -1, maxInd+1 );
1082 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setDiagonalOpElems(op, startInd, reals, imags, numAmps), Contains("Invalid number of elements") );
1083
1084 // invalid considering start-index
1085 startInd = maxInd - 1;
1086 numAmps = 2;
1087 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setDiagonalOpElems(op, startInd, reals, imags, numAmps), Contains("More elements given than exist") );
1088 }
1089 }
1090
1091 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
1092}

Modifies a subset (starting at index startInd, and ending at index startInd + numElems) of the elemen...

TEST_CASE ( "setQuregToPauliHamil"  ,
""  [state_initialisations] 
)
See also
setQuregToPauliHamil
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 540 of file test_state_initialisations.cpp.

540 {
541
542 Qureg rho = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
543
544 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
545
546 // too expensive to enumerate all paulis, so try 10x with random ones
547 GENERATE( range(0,10) );
548
549 int numTerms = GENERATE( 1, 2, 10, 15, 100, 1000 );
550 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS, numTerms);
551 setRandomPauliSum(hamil);
552
553 setQuregToPauliHamil(rho, hamil);
554 REQUIRE( areEqual(rho, toQMatrix(hamil)) );
555
556 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
557 }
558 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
559
560 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
561
562 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS, 5);
563 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
564
565 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setQuregToPauliHamil(vec, hamil), Contains("density matrices") );
566
567 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
568 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
569 }
570 SECTION( "pauli codes" ) {
571
572 int numTerms = 3;
573 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS, numTerms);
574
575 // make one pauli code wrong
576 hamil.pauliCodes[GENERATE_COPY( range(0,numTerms*NUM_QUBITS) )] = (pauliOpType) GENERATE( -1, 4 );
577 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setQuregToPauliHamil(rho, hamil), Contains("Invalid Pauli code") );
578
579 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
580 }
581 SECTION( "matching hamiltonian qubits" ) {
582
583 int numTerms = 1;
584 PauliHamil hamil = createPauliHamil(NUM_QUBITS + 1, numTerms);
585
586 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setQuregToPauliHamil(rho, hamil), Contains("same number of qubits") );
587
588 destroyPauliHamil(hamil);
589 }
590 }
591 destroyQureg(rho, QUEST_ENV);
592}

TEST_CASE ( "setWeightedQureg"  ,
""  [state_initialisations] 
)
See also
setWeightedQureg
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 600 of file test_state_initialisations.cpp.

600 {
601
602 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
603
604 // repeat each test below 10 times
605 GENERATE( range(0,10) );
606
607 /* note tolerance in areEqual increases with tests, since
608 * small differences propogate in vecC which is not re-initialised
609 */
610
611 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
612
613 // make three random vectors
614 Qureg vecA = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
615 Qureg vecB = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
616 Qureg vecC = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
617 for (int j=0; j<vecA.numAmpsPerChunk; j++) {
618 vecA.stateVec.real[j] = getRandomReal(-5,5); vecA.stateVec.imag[j] = getRandomReal(-5,5);
619 vecB.stateVec.real[j] = getRandomReal(-5,5); vecB.stateVec.imag[j] = getRandomReal(-5,5);
620 vecC.stateVec.real[j] = getRandomReal(-5,5); vecC.stateVec.imag[j] = getRandomReal(-5,5);
621 }
622 copyStateToGPU(vecA); copyStateToGPU(vecB); copyStateToGPU(vecC);
623 QVector refA = toQVector(vecA);
624 QVector refB = toQVector(vecB);
625 QVector refC = toQVector(vecC);
626 QVector refOut;
627
628 // get three random factors
629 qcomp numA = getRandomReal(-5,5) + getRandomReal(-5,5) * (qcomp) 1i;
630 qcomp numB = getRandomReal(-5,5) + getRandomReal(-5,5) * (qcomp) 1i;
631 qcomp numC = getRandomReal(-5,5) + getRandomReal(-5,5) * (qcomp) 1i;
632 Complex facA; facA.real = real(numA); facA.imag = imag(numA);
633 Complex facB; facB.real = real(numB); facB.imag = imag(numB);
634 Complex facC; facC.real = real(numC); facC.imag = imag(numC);
635
636 // check out-qureg is correct, when all quregs are unique...
637 setWeightedQureg(facA, vecA, facB, vecB, facC, vecC);
638 refOut = numA*refA + numB*refB + numC*refC;
639 REQUIRE( areEqual(vecC, refOut) );
640
641 // ... and that other qureg's aren't modified
642 REQUIRE( areEqual(vecA, refA) );
643 REQUIRE( areEqual(vecB, refB) );
644
645 // check quregOut correct, when it's also qureg2
646 refC = toQVector(vecC);
647 setWeightedQureg(facB, vecB, facC, vecC, facA, vecC);
648 refOut = numB*refB + numC*refC + numA*refC;
649 REQUIRE( areEqual(vecC, refOut, 10*REAL_EPS) );
650
651 // ... and that the remaining qureg is not modified
652 REQUIRE( areEqual(vecB, refB) );
653
654 // check quregOut correct, when it's also qureg1
655 refC = toQVector(vecC);
656 setWeightedQureg(facC, vecC, facB, vecB, facA, vecC);
657 refOut = numC*refC + numB*refB + numA*refC;
658 REQUIRE( areEqual(vecC, refOut, 10*REAL_EPS) );
659
660 // ... and that the remaining qureg is not modified
661 REQUIRE( areEqual(vecB, refB) );
662
663 // check quregOut is correct when it's both input quregs
664 refC = toQVector(vecC);
665 setWeightedQureg(facA, vecC, facB, vecC, facC, vecC);
666 refOut = numA*refC + numB*refC + numC*refC;
667 REQUIRE( areEqual(vecC, refOut, 1E3*REAL_EPS) );
668
669 // cleanup
670 destroyQureg(vecA, QUEST_ENV);
671 destroyQureg(vecB, QUEST_ENV);
672 destroyQureg(vecC, QUEST_ENV);
673 }
674 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
675
676 // make three random matrices
677 Qureg matA = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
678 Qureg matB = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
679 Qureg matC = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
680 for (int j=0; j<matA.numAmpsPerChunk; j++) {
681 matA.stateVec.real[j] = getRandomReal(-5,5); matA.stateVec.imag[j] = getRandomReal(-5,5);
682 matB.stateVec.real[j] = getRandomReal(-5,5); matB.stateVec.imag[j] = getRandomReal(-5,5);
683 matC.stateVec.real[j] = getRandomReal(-5,5); matC.stateVec.imag[j] = getRandomReal(-5,5);
684 }
685 copyStateToGPU(matA); copyStateToGPU(matB); copyStateToGPU(matC);
686 QMatrix refA = toQMatrix(matA);
687 QMatrix refB = toQMatrix(matB);
688 QMatrix refC = toQMatrix(matC);
689 QMatrix refOut;
690
691 // get three random factors
692 qcomp numA = getRandomReal(-5,5) + getRandomReal(-5,5) * (qcomp) 1i;
693 qcomp numB = getRandomReal(-5,5) + getRandomReal(-5,5) * (qcomp) 1i;
694 qcomp numC = getRandomReal(-5,5) + getRandomReal(-5,5) * (qcomp) 1i;
695 Complex facA; facA.real = real(numA); facA.imag = imag(numA);
696 Complex facB; facB.real = real(numB); facB.imag = imag(numB);
697 Complex facC; facC.real = real(numC); facC.imag = imag(numC);
698
699 // check out-qureg is correct, when all quregs are unique...
700 setWeightedQureg(facA, matA, facB, matB, facC, matC);
701 refOut = numA*refA + numB*refB + numC*refC;
702 REQUIRE( areEqual(matC, refOut) );
703
704 // ... and that other qureg's aren't modified
705 REQUIRE( areEqual(matA, refA) );
706 REQUIRE( areEqual(matB, refB) );
707
708 // check quregOut correct, when it's also qureg2
709 refC = toQMatrix(matC);
710 setWeightedQureg(facB, matB, facC, matC, facA, matC);
711 refOut = numB*refB + numC*refC + numA*refC;
712 REQUIRE( areEqual(matC, refOut, 10*REAL_EPS) );
713
714 // ... and that the remaining qureg is not modified
715 REQUIRE( areEqual(matB, refB) );
716
717 // check quregOut correct, when it's also qureg1
718 refC = toQMatrix(matC);
719 setWeightedQureg(facC, matC, facB, matB, facA, matC);
720 refOut = numC*refC + numB*refB + numA*refC;
721 REQUIRE( areEqual(matC, refOut, 1E2*REAL_EPS) );
722
723 // ... and that the remaining qureg is not modified
724 REQUIRE( areEqual(matB, refB) );
725
726 // check quregOut is correct when it's both input quregs
727 refC = toQMatrix(matC);
728 setWeightedQureg(facA, matC, facB, matC, facC, matC);
729 refOut = numA*refC + numB*refC + numC*refC;
730 REQUIRE( areEqual(matC, refOut, 1E3*REAL_EPS) );
731
732 // cleanup
733 destroyQureg(matA, QUEST_ENV);
734 destroyQureg(matB, QUEST_ENV);
735 destroyQureg(matC, QUEST_ENV);
736 }
737 }
738 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
739
740 SECTION( "qureg types" ) {
741
742 Qureg vec = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
743 Qureg mat = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
744 Complex f; f.real = 0; f.imag = 0;
745
746 // two state-vecs, one density-matrix
747 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setWeightedQureg(f, mat, f, vec, f, vec), Contains("state-vectors or") && Contains("density matrices") );
748 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setWeightedQureg(f, vec, f, mat, f, vec), Contains("state-vectors or") && Contains("density matrices") );
749 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setWeightedQureg(f, vec, f, vec, f, mat), Contains("state-vectors or") && Contains("density matrices") );
750
751 // one state-vec, two density-matrices
752 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setWeightedQureg(f, vec, f, mat, f, mat), Contains("state-vectors or") && Contains("density matrices") );
753 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setWeightedQureg(f, mat, f, vec, f, mat), Contains("state-vectors or") && Contains("density matrices") );
754 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setWeightedQureg(f, mat, f, mat, f, vec), Contains("state-vectors or") && Contains("density matrices") );
755
756 destroyQureg(vec, QUEST_ENV);
757 destroyQureg(mat, QUEST_ENV);
758 }
759 SECTION( "qureg dimensions" ) {
760
761 Qureg vecA = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
762 Qureg vecB = createQureg(NUM_QUBITS + 1, QUEST_ENV);
763 Qureg matA = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS, QUEST_ENV);
764 Qureg matB = createDensityQureg(NUM_QUBITS + 1, QUEST_ENV);
765 Complex f; f.real = 0; f.imag = 0;
766
767 // state-vecs
768 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setWeightedQureg(f, vecA, f, vecB, f, vecB), Contains("Dimensions") );
769 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setWeightedQureg(f, vecB, f, vecA, f, vecB), Contains("Dimensions") );
770 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setWeightedQureg(f, vecB, f, vecB, f, vecA), Contains("Dimensions") );
771
772 // density-matrices
773 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setWeightedQureg(f, matA, f, matB, f, matB), Contains("Dimensions") );
774 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setWeightedQureg(f, matB, f, matA, f, matB), Contains("Dimensions") );
775 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( setWeightedQureg(f, matB, f, matB, f, matA), Contains("Dimensions") );
776
777 destroyQureg(vecA, QUEST_ENV);
778 destroyQureg(vecB, QUEST_ENV);
779 destroyQureg(matA, QUEST_ENV);
780 destroyQureg(matB, QUEST_ENV);
781 }
782 }
783}
setWeightedQureg
void setWeightedQureg(Complex fac1, Qureg qureg1, Complex fac2, Qureg qureg2, Complex facOut, Qureg out)
Modifies qureg out to the result of (facOut out + fac1 qureg1 + fac2 qureg2), imposing no constraints...
Definition: QuEST.c:1068

References areEqual(), copyStateToGPU(), createDensityQureg(), createQureg(), destroyQureg(), getRandomReal(), Complex::imag, NUM_QUBITS, Qureg::numAmpsPerChunk, qcomp, QUEST_ENV, Complex::real, setWeightedQureg(), Qureg::stateVec, toQMatrix(), and toQVector().

2659 {
2660
2661 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
2662 qcomp a = qcomp(.5, .5);
2663 qcomp b = qcomp(.5, -.5);
2664 QMatrix op{{1,0,0,0},{0,a,b,0},{0,b,a,0},{0,0,0,1}};
2665
2666 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
2667
2668 int targ1 = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
2669 int targ2 = GENERATE_COPY( filter([=](int t){ return t!=targ1; }, range(0,NUM_QUBITS)) );
2670 int targs[] = {targ1, targ2};
2671
2672 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
2673
2674 sqrtSwapGate(quregVec, targ1, targ2);
2675 applyReferenceOp(refVec, targs, 2, op);
2676 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
2677 }
2678 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
2679
2680 sqrtSwapGate(quregMatr, targ1, targ2);
2681 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, targs, 2, op);
2682 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr) );
2683 }
2684 }
2685 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
2686
2687 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
2688

2691 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( sqrtSwapGate(quregVec, targ1, targ2), Contains("Invalid target") );
2692 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( sqrtSwapGate(quregVec, targ2, targ1), Contains("Invalid target") );
2693 }
2694 SECTION( "repetition of targets" ) {
2695
2696 int qb = 0;
2697 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( sqrtSwapGate(quregVec, qb, qb), Contains("target") && Contains("unique") );
2698 }
2699 }
2700 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );

◆ TEST_CASE() [132/136]

TEST_CASE ( "syncDiagonalOp"  ,
""  [data_structures] 
)
See also
syncDiagonalOp
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 1100 of file test_data_structures.cpp.

1100 {
1101
1102 // must be at least one amplitude per node
1103 int minNumQb = calcLog2(QUEST_ENV.numRanks);
1104 if (minNumQb == 0)
1105 minNumQb = 1;
1106
1107 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
1108
1109 // try 10 valid number of qubits
1110 int numQb = GENERATE_COPY( range(minNumQb, minNumQb+10) );
1111 DiagonalOp op = createDiagonalOp(numQb, QUEST_ENV);
1112
1113 // check that changes get sync'd to the GPU...
1114 long long int n;
1115 for (n=0; n<op.numElemsPerChunk; n++) {
1116 op.real[n] = (qreal) n;
1117 op.imag[n] = (qreal) -2*n; // (n - 2n i)
1118 }
1119 syncDiagonalOp(op);
1120
1121 // via if it modifies an all-unity state-vec correctly
1122 Qureg qureg = createQureg(numQb, QUEST_ENV);
1123 for (long long int i=0; i<qureg.numAmpsPerChunk; i++) {
1124 qureg.stateVec.real[i] = 1;
1125 qureg.stateVec.imag[i] = 1;
1126 }
1127 copyStateToGPU(qureg);
1128
1129 // (n - 2n i) * (1 + 1i) = 3n - n*i
1130 applyDiagonalOp(qureg, op);
1131 copyStateFromGPU(qureg);
1132 for (n=0; n<qureg.numAmpsPerChunk; n++) {
1133 REQUIRE( qureg.stateVec.real[n] == 3*n );
1134 REQUIRE( qureg.stateVec.imag[n] == -n );
1135 }
1136
1137 destroyQureg(qureg, QUEST_ENV);
1138 destroyDiagonalOp(op, QUEST_ENV);
1139 }
1140}

References applyDiagonalOp(), calcLog2(), copyStateFromGPU(), copyStateToGPU(), createDiagonalOp(), createQureg(), destroyDiagonalOp(), destroyQureg(), DiagonalOp::imag, Qureg::numAmpsPerChunk, DiagonalOp::numElemsPerChunk, QuESTEnv::numRanks, qreal, QUEST_ENV, DiagonalOp::real, Qureg::stateVec, and syncDiagonalOp().

""  [data_structures]

toComplex

44 {
45
46 qcomp a = qcomp(.5,-.2);
47 #if (!defined(_WIN32)) && (!defined(_WIN64))
48 Complex b = toComplex(a);
49 #else
50 // MSVC profanely forbids in-line struct initialisation
51 Complex b; b.real = real(a); b.imag = imag(a);
52 #endif
53
54 REQUIRE( real(a) == b.real );
55 REQUIRE( imag(a) == b.imag );

#define toComplex(scalar)
Creates a Complex struct, which can be passed to the QuEST API, from a qcomp.

◆ TEST_CASE() [135/136]

TEST_CASE ( "twoQubitUnitary"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
twoQubitUnitary
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 2796 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

2796 {
2797
2798 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
2799
2800 // in distributed mode, each node must be able to fit all amps modified by unitary
2801 REQUIRE( quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk >= 4 );
2802
2803 // every test will use a unique random matrix
2804 QMatrix op = getRandomUnitary(2);
2805 ComplexMatrix4 matr = toComplexMatrix4(op);
2806
2807 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
2808
2809 int targ1 = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
2810 int targ2 = GENERATE_COPY( filter([=](int t){ return t!=targ1; }, range(0,NUM_QUBITS)) );
2811 int targs[] = {targ1, targ2};
2812
2813 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
2814
2815 twoQubitUnitary(quregVec, targ1, targ2, matr);
2816 applyReferenceOp(refVec, targs, 2, op);
2817 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
2818 }
2819 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
2820
2821 twoQubitUnitary(quregMatr, targ1, targ2, matr);
2822 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, targs, 2, op);
2823 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
2824 }
2825 }
2826 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
2827
2828 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
2829
2830 int targ1 = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
2831 int targ2 = 0;
2832 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( twoQubitUnitary(quregVec, targ1, targ2, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
2833 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( twoQubitUnitary(quregVec, targ2, targ1, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
2834 }
2835 SECTION( "repetition of targets" ) {
2836
2837 int qb = 0;
2838 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( twoQubitUnitary(quregVec, qb, qb, matr), Contains("target") && Contains("unique") );
2839 }
2840 SECTION( "unitarity" ) {
2841
2842 matr.real[0][0] = 0; // break matr unitarity
2843 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( twoQubitUnitary(quregVec, 0, 1, matr), Contains("unitary") );
2844 }
2845 SECTION( "unitary fits in node" ) {
2846
2847 // pretend we have a very limited distributed memory
2848 quregVec.numAmpsPerChunk = 1;
2849 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( twoQubitUnitary(quregVec, 0, 1, matr), Contains("targets too many qubits"));
2850 }
2851 }
2852 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
2853}
twoQubitUnitary
void twoQubitUnitary(Qureg qureg, int targetQubit1, int targetQubit2, ComplexMatrix4 u)
Apply a general two-qubit unitary (including a global phase factor).
Definition: QuEST.c:264

References applyReferenceOp(), areEqual(), CLEANUP_TEST, getRandomUnitary(), NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, ComplexMatrix4::real, toComplexMatrix4(), and twoQubitUnitary().

◆ TEST_CASE() [136/136]

TEST_CASE ( "unitary"  ,
""  [unitaries] 
)
See also
unitary
Author
Tyson Jones

Definition at line 2861 of file test_unitaries.cpp.

2861 {
2862
2863 PREPARE_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr, refVec, refMatr );
2864
2865 // every test will use a unique random matrix
2866 QMatrix op = getRandomUnitary(1);
2867 ComplexMatrix2 matr = toComplexMatrix2(op);
2868
2869 SECTION( "correctness" ) {
2870
2871 int target = GENERATE( range(0,NUM_QUBITS) );
2872
2873 SECTION( "state-vector" ) {
2874
2875 unitary(quregVec, target, matr);
2876 applyReferenceOp(refVec, target, op);
2877 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregVec, refVec) );
2878 }
2879 SECTION( "density-matrix" ) {
2880
2881 unitary(quregMatr, target, matr);
2882 applyReferenceOp(refMatr, target, op);
2883 REQUIRE( areEqual(quregMatr, refMatr, 10*REAL_EPS) );
2884 }
2885 }
2886 SECTION( "input validation" ) {
2887
2888 SECTION( "qubit indices" ) {
2889
2890 int target = GENERATE( -1, NUM_QUBITS );
2891 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( unitary(quregVec, target, matr), Contains("Invalid target") );
2892 }
2893 SECTION( "unitarity" ) {
2894
2895 matr.real[0][0] = 0; // break matr unitarity
2896 REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( unitary(quregVec, 0, matr), Contains("unitary") );
2897 }
2898 }
2899 CLEANUP_TEST( quregVec, quregMatr );
2900}
unitary
void unitary(Qureg qureg, int targetQubit, ComplexMatrix2 u)
Apply a general single-qubit unitary (including a global phase factor).
Definition: QuEST.c:356

References applyReferenceOp(), areEqual(), CLEANUP_TEST, getRandomUnitary(), NUM_QUBITS, PREPARE_TEST, ComplexMatrix2::real, toComplexMatrix2(), and unitary().
